column3: ['clears throat', 'whimpers', 'struggles to reach for the knife', 'screams in panic and hyperventilates']
column4: Yeah. Just gotta... pick up the knife... and... s-spread the mayonnaise.  Pick up the-  ...the knife!  Pick up... kni-i-fe!
Steven!

column3: ['picks up the jar of mayonnaise and plops it all onto the sandwich']
column4: Wait! Wait! I've got it.
That will kill you faster.
Not funny!
Oh.

column3: ['runs in', 'laughs and steps onto the Warp Pad with Pearl']
column4: Nice noggin, Steven.
We're ready, Garnet.
Wait. You're going on a mission?  Hold on! Don't leave me!  At least tell me what's gonna happen with my lunch! Do I choke on a pickle?
Mm, you don't choke on a pickle.
That means something else happens with the pickle!
Garnet! Shouldn't we be going?

column3: ["kneels down and places her hands on Steven's shoulders", 'smiles at Steven, and he smiles back']
column4: Steven, I can't be with you all the time. Just trust me when I say that you are in control.  Do not go on the roof! No matter what.

column6: It begins to rain heavily outside the Crystal Temple. Steven is alone, curled up by the windows in the dark beach house, as thunder crashes loudly outside. He then looks up to the ceiling.

column4: What could possibly happen to me on the roof?

column6: Thunder crashes again and the front door suddenly bursts open, startling Steven. He then runs forth and shuts it.

column4: Okay. Calm down. Maybe I should just get a snack.  But what if..!

column6: Cartoon Steven appears again along with the "Death Rag" music. He tries to open the fridge door and it falls over him. A live Cartoon Steven reappears and, by some unknown reasons, a chandelier falls over him, turning him into a skeleton. The wasps from before starts stinging Cartoon Steven again.

column4: Ugh! How come you guys are back?!
We're made of magic.
Yeah! Magic!

column6: Cartoon Steven turns a skeleton again while both wasps laughs maniacally.
Steven screams in paranoid from his imaginations. Thunder clashes again, scaring Steven, and he runs away screaming, hides under the table and begins to cry.

column3: ['sees his teddy bear nearby', 'reaches to picks it up']
column4: Ugh! Master of Ceremonies Bear Bear.

column6: Steven looks at the teddy bear as Steven's words "I'm a big boy now!" echo in his head.

column3: ['punches the table off him and gets up']
column4: What's happening to me? I'm supposed to be... a Crystal Gem. I'm supposed to be a Crystal Gem! (Thunder crashes.) AAAAAHHH!  Ugh!

column6: Steven climbs on top of the beach house and stands against the heavy rain, while thunder continues crashing loudly.

column4: Okay. I'm here.  What are you gonna do to me, future?

column6: The inside of the house is then filled with light as someone warps back, and Garnet quickly races outside onto the porch.

column4: Steven! Get off the roof!
No! If something is going to happen to me... Just let it happen.
Steven!  You don't understand.

column3: ['grabs his head in panic', 'kneels down with his hands raised into the air']
column4: No, you don't understand.  Everything I do shoves me violently towards the end! The more I know, the more I know that I don't know!  I can't live like this! Why did you tell me about future vision?! What's going to happen to me on the roof?!
... This.
W-What?
I knew you might do this if I told you about my power. I saw this, and I told you anyway.
But why?

column3: ['takes off her visor, revealing her third eye', 'puts her visor back on']
column4: I took a risk at your expense. There was a chance you'd understand this, and we'd be closer.  Steven, I see so many things that can hurt you. I should never have let one of them be me.  There are millions of possibilities for the future, but it's up to you to choose which becomes reality. Please understand. You choose your own future.

column3: ['sighs, slides down the roof and runs towards Garnet to hug her']
column4: I do understand. I... (Thunder crashes, and Steven has an epiphany.) What am I doing?... I guess I can't really see a future for myself up here.  I'll watch out for myself from now on.

column6: Garnet looks up to the sky and raises her hand, blocking a lightning strike just in time and protecting Steven from it. Steven continues to hug Garnet unknowingly.

column4: What was that?
Oh, nothing important.

column6: The star iris then zooms in on Steven and Garnet, ending the episode.
Steven is lying on the couch in the living room, reading a series of novels titled "The No Home Boys".

column4: Woah, how are they gonna get out of this one?  Oh, that's how.

column6: Steven then hears the Gems returning on the Crystal Temple Warp Pad and runs over to greet them.

column3: ['notices several Flask Robonoids the Gems are carrying']
column4: You're back!  Hey, it's those things from the Galaxy Warp. Why'd you bring them home?
We can't have them reactivating and fixing the Homeworld Warp.
Hey Steven, check this out! Kabloosh!

column6: Amethyst crushes the Flask Robonoid in her hands, spilling green goo all around her and startling Pearl, causing her to drop her Flask Robonoids in hand.

column4: Amethyst, please! This is serious! We need to understand these things, not squash them. If Homeworld Gems are trying to return to Earth...  THEY HAVE TO BE STOPPED!
Pearl, calm down. We're still cut off. The Earth is safe.
Safe from what? What do the Homeworld Gems want to do?

column3: ['exchanges looks with Garnet', 'looks at Amethyst, who quickly turns away']
column4: Steven, a very long time ago, Gems tried to do something... very bad.  It was something that would have damaged the Earth. Some Gems, like your mother, Garnet, and myself, felt that this was unfair to the life that already existed here, and so we swore to never let the Earth be used for their... purposes. Even if it meant-

column6: Amethyst approaches another Flask Robonoid and crushes it underneath her foot in upset.

column4: -Even if it meant we could never go home.
We chose Earth.
Wait a sec, so that means... we're just like the No Home Boys!
The wha-?

The No Home Boys! It's a book series about these boys who have no home. So they travel around the country, living in boxcars, and riding river rafts, solving mysteries! They had a successful run, until the disastrous graphic novel adaptation. But my favorite story is this classic one where the no home boys are chased across the countryside by a mysterious pursuer, which turns out to be the very fear resting within themselves.
Steven, we are not like the No Home Boys. We are literally standing in your home right now.
Aw, I wish, I was a No Home Boy. No past, no future, just the open road!
Yeah, sounds like fun. Let's do it.
Really?!
Yeah. Let's run!

column6: Steven and Amethyst pack some food in their own bindles on sticks and they begin to sing "On the Run". They leave the house and walk through Beach City, when Jenny, Buck Dewey and Sour Cream offer to give them a ride in Jenny's Car. They drive Steven and Amethyst to the edge of Beach City, and the pair run off into the countryside. They encounter a Raccoon and it joins them on their travel, but then attacks Steven while Amethyst looks on in laughter. They eventually come across a railroad as a train is passing by, and decide to hop aboard a boxcar. Steven and Amethyst continue singing their duet until the sunset, as they watch it from atop the boxcar.
Steven opens his bindle, preparing to eat his food, when the raccoon from before suddenly jumps in and attacks Steven again, while Amethyst watches.

column4: Aah! Aah! The raccoon is back! (The raccoon eats all of Steven's food and runs away.) Um, Amethyst? Can I have some of your food?

column3: ['devours all of her food in one go']
column4: Oh, uh, sorry dude.
My bindle couldn't fit enough food for me and a raccoon.
Why didn't you bring your backpack?

column3: ['climbs onto a hay stack', 'sees Amethyst sitting at the boxcar doorway, ignoring him', 'goes and sits next to her']
column4: It wouldn't fit in my bindle?  Maybe I can just sleep this hunger off... Just like the No home Boys. You know, I feel like I've been misled about hay. It always looks so soft in those illustrations, but it's actually really scratchy. (The boxcar rumbles a bit, and another hay stack falls on top of him.) Amethyst, I want to go home now.  Amethyst?  I'm done pretending to be a No Home Boy.
Not me.
I'm sure Garnet and Pearl are worried sick about us. Wondering when we're coming home.
That's not my home.
But— Oh, that's right. You're from Homeworld.
That's not my home either!
Then where are you from?
I'll show you.

column6: Amethyst brings Steven to a foggy, desolate canyon.

column4: Here we are!  Welcome to the Kindergarten! What do you think?
Uh... It's great!
Sure is!  Come on!

column6: Amethyst drags Steven along and they start walking through the Kindergarten. Steven looks up and see several machinery hanging on the walls of the canyon.

column4: What is this place?
It's kinda where I'm from.
But I thought Gems were from space?

column3: ['gasps', 'runs to a giant rock and laughs']
column4: Pearl and Garnet are, but I was made here on Earth, like you!  Check it out!  Oh, man. I missed this guy. Aww! It's my climbing rock.
Uh, hello!

column3: ['points to off-screen rocks', 'climbs the climbing rock and sits atop it']
column4: And over there, that's the sitting rock. And that was the one rock that I kicked into two rocks!
Uh, how long did you live here?

column3: ['flops off of rock and and runs further into the Kindergarten']
column4: For a while, I guess, um, at least until I met your mom and the others.

column3: ['notices one of the machinery on the ground']
column4: Woah! What is that thing?
Eh, it's just some old Gem junk, from a long time ago. It's probably busted by now.

column6: Amethyst runs off as Steven examines the strange machinery in worry, resting his palm on one of its legs and noticing some drills on the machinery.

column3: ['motions to a hole in the canyon wall']
column4: Hey, Steven! Look!  Here's the hole I came out of!
Hang on.  What?

column3: ['steps into the hole', 'slides into the back of the hole and sits down']
column4: It's my hole.  Look! It's me-siiiiiized.  Still got that good hole smell.
You came out of this hole?
This is where I was made, dude. One day just, "pop" ...Right outta this hole.

column3: ['glances up and notices numerous holes on the canyon wall']
column4: So... what about the other holes?

column6: Light suddenly emit from behind Steven as the warping sounds whirs. Pearl then arrives on a warp pad on a platform in the Kindergarten.

column3: ['looks around in disgust and leaps off the platform']
column4: There you are.
Great.  Here comes the fun police.
Garnet said you'd be here, but I didn't want to believe it. Amethyst, what were you thinking bringing Steven to a... Kindergarten!?
I don't know.  We were in the neighborhood.
Pearl? Was Amethyst really made here?
How much did you tell him?
What? You mean about the bad thing? How this bad place is where bad Gems came to grow more bad Gems? Is that what you're talking about?
They grew other Gems here?!
Amethyst! He's not ready!
Oh, but don't worry, Steven. Everything's just fine now-
Amethyst!
It all worked out. We won!-
Stop.
And we shut this place down-
Stop!
So the Earth would be safe from parasites like ME!
AMETHYST! That's enough! (Amethyst walks away in anger.)
Pearl?
Steven, I'm sorry. I never wanted you to see this horrible place.
Then why don't you just... LEAVE!!!

column6: Amethyst summons her whip, wraps Pearl with it, and hurls her against one of the Gem machinery.

column4: Admit it! I'm just an embarrassment to you!

column6: Amethyst swings her whip at Pearl again, who quickly dodges away, slice through a leg of the machinery.

column4: Amethyst! Wait!

column6: Steven tries to stop Amethyst, but she lifts him up and tosses him away, sending him tumbling a distance away.

column4: I don't want to fight you.
I wouldn't want to fight me neither!

column6: Amethyst spin-dashes towards Pearl. Pearl quickly rolls out of the way and starts firing energy blasts with her spear at Amethyst. Amethyst avoids the energy blasts while spin-dashing, jumps into the air and swings her whip downwards. Pearl sidesteps, stomps on the tip of the whip and slices it off with her spear.

column4: You guys, stop it!
Stay out of this!

column6: Amethyst throws her whip like a bolas at Steven, which wraps around his legs and causes him to fall. Pearl jumps towards her and she, summoning another whip, tries to hit her. Pearl dodges each swing of Amethyst's whip and kicks her away.

column4: Amethyst, stop this! You can't beat me.

column3: ["summons two more whips and wraps them around Pearl's spear"]
column4: I... DON'T... CARE!  I'm NOT gonna let you stand there and remind me of everything I HATE ABOUT MYSELF!!!!

column6: Amethyst lashes her whips and send violet energy waves down the whips towards Pearl, causing a huge explosion and sending Pearl flying and slamming against the Gem machinery.

column4: I never asked for it to be this way..  I never asked to be made..!
Amethyst...

column3: ['steps in between Pearl and Amethyst, tears in his eyes, and spreads his arms out']
column4: Amethyst, please, no more! I know you're upset, but, I can't bear to watch you two hurt each other.

column6: The "leg" of the Gem machinery, previously sliced by Amethyst's whip, gives way and begins to fall towards the group. Steven summons his bubble shield, which Amethyst quickly sidesteps away from, and encases only Pearl and himself.

column4: Amethyst! Amethyst, Amethyst, AMETHYST!

column6: Amethyst begins running away and the Gem machinery collapses on top the bubble. The screen is darkened for a moment, which quickly subsides as dust clouds disperse away. Steven quickly dispels his bubble shield and looks around for Amethyst, who seems to have disappeared in the chaos.

column3: ["looks back at the rubble and pushes it aside to uncover Amethyst's hole"]
column4: Ame-thy-st! Where are you?!  Amethyst!
Go away. I'm bad, and you shouldn't be around me.
What? That's ridiculous. Look, I don't know what any of this really means, but I-
Yeah, you don't. 'Cause if you did, you wouldn't be talking to me.
Pearl, get in here. You got to help me.
But-
You have to talk to her.

column3: ['slides into the hole and kneels next to Amethyst']
column4: Amethyst?... Amethyst, I had no idea you've been upset about this.
What?! You had no idea!? Ho! This is, like, my entire existence! You want to pretend that none of this ever happened! You think I'm just a big mistake!

column3: ['gasps', 'blushes embarrassingly in realization', 'tears up', 'extends a hand towards Amethyst']
column4: No, no. Amethyst, you're not the mistake. You're just the byproduct of a... big mistake.  ... No, that's not- I... I just never thought of this as you. None of this is your fault. You didn't build this place. I... I'm sorry, Amethyst.  I hope you can forgive me. You're the one good thing that came out of this mess. I always thought you were proud of that.

column6: Steven quickly steps away to clear the path for Pearl and Amethyst to exit the hole. Amethyst looks at Pearl hesitantly for a few seconds, before enveloping her in a crushing hug. Pearl is taken aback briefly, but returns the hug back to Amethyst. The group then step onto the warp pad, hand in hand, ready to return home.

column4: Crystal Gems forever! Now let's go home, so Steven can sleep in a bed.

column6: The three warp out of Prime Kindergarten, as the fog in the canyon begins to clear up, revealing even more of the Gem machinery and holes deep in the canyon, while ominous metal clanging noises are heard in the background.
It is already late at night, Sadie and Lars are closing up the Big Donut for the night. Lars first exits through the back door ahead of Sadie, playing with the keys at the door lock.

column4: Saaaaa-dieee!~ Better hurry up! I'm gonna lock you in!
Hey, just a sec!

column6: Lars leans against the wall to wait for Sadie, when he looks down and get startled by the sudden appearance of Steven in front of him.

column4: Don't be too scared. It's just me.  I'm on my way over to a spooky-movie party. You want to come?
Party!? ... Who's throwing it?
Ronaldo, the French Fryman.
Ugh! That social napalm? Do what you want, man. I got better things to do than wax weird with Beach City's biggest bozo,  Ronaldo.
Ah, okay. Oh, ha! Nice timing, Steven. Hey, should we head over to Ronaldo's?
Yeah! I'm-a get so scared!
Night, Lars.
Nighty-night!

column3: ['runs after them', 'returns quickly to lock the door, and runs back to Sadie and Steven']
column4: Hey! Wait up!  So, where's this thing at?
It's right up there.

column6: Steven, Sadie and Lars climbs the hill towards the Lighthouse, decorated with scarecrows outside. Steven knocks on the door and Ronaldo, wearing a mask and costume, opens the door.

column4: Steeeeeveeeeen...!  Welcome to my Beach City horror club.
More like comedy club.

column3: ['accidentally drops his mask on ground, and it breaks', 'clears the doorway']
column4: LARS?!  OH! What are you doing here?! Um...  C-c-c-come in.
I'm scared already.
Ronaldo, right? Yeah. I'm Sadie.  Nice to finally officially meet you.

column6: Sadie and Lars step past Ronaldo into the Lighthouse. Lars suddenly turns around and shouts a single "Boo!", startling Ronaldo. He laughs again as he walks back into the Lighthouse. Steven is about to step inside when Ronaldo halts him.

column4: Steven, you're friends with Lars?
Yeah. Isn't everybody?
Oh, boy!
Yeah!

column6: Inside the lantern room of the Lighthouse, Steven, Sadie and Lars are seated in front of a big TV.

column4: Our first film tonight is a rare classic that hardly needs introduction.  "Evil Bear 2: Bearly Alive"!
What?! I've seen that. It's boring. And that stupid fake C.G. bear! Hardly looks like it's really killing anybody.
C.G.?! Blasphemer!  You saw the remake! I have the original. A true fan would accept nothing less.
Whoa, man. Take it down a notch. (Ronaldo covers his face in embarrassment.)

Whoa, wait. How did you get a copy of that? Can I see the box? (Ronaldo walks over and presents the cover box.) Woah! In this cut, you actually see Evil Bear eat the hermit's leg. Ho! Oh, is this gonna be a bit much for him?
I can handle it!

column6: Steven watches the movie, unfazed as bear growling and woman screaming are heard, when Ronaldo peeks over and reveals that Steven is just sitting behind the couch.

column4: Yo, Steven, are you sure you can see with the couch in your way?
You're... eating my... leg!

column6: Steven cowers in fright as more screaming and the bear's evil laughter are heard.

column4: Oh, did I miss the part where you can see the sound guy?

column6: The power in the Lighthouse suddenly goes out, turning off the TV.

column4: Hey! It was just getting good!
What's going on?
Probably just a fuse.
Or maybe it's a gho-o-st?
Good one.

column3: ['hands another flashlight to Sadie', 'rummages through his cabinet of files', 'pulls out a pendulum']
column4: No, really. What if it's a gho-o-o-o-st?  As a skeptic of mortality, I've long suspected that this place might be haunted.  Aha! Spirit, I beseech you!
Dude, cut it out. You're being super-weird.

column6: Sadie and Steven gather around Ronaldo's pendulum, as Sadie shines her flashlight on it.

column4: We wish to make contact. Please, spirit, send us a sign.

column6: The pendulum begins to swing around on its own accord, shoots off of Ronaldo's hands and hits Lars in his face.

column4: Woah!
Ow!
Spirit, that was a good sign. But could you send a couple more like that just to be sure?

column6: Indistinct whispering are heard. The drawers of the cabinet suddenly burst open and files come flying out, swirling in circles above Ronaldo, Steven, Sadie, and Lars. Everyone screams in shock.

column4: That's— That's okay, spirit. You can rein it in a little!

column6: A cup of coffee flies in and smashes in front of the group.

column4: How is this happening?!
This... is amazing! A real-life haunted house! Ahh!

column6: A barrel smashes to the ground next to Steven, barely misses him as he jumps into Ronaldo's arms. Another cup of coffee hovers in the air and flies towards Lars.

column3: ['tackles Lars down, and the coffee cup misses him']
column4: Look out!  Let's get out of here!

column6: The group runs towards the door, but it suddenly slams shut. Ronaldo pulls on the door knob with no luck.

column4: It won't open!

column6: The group then slams themselves through the door, successfully breaking it and exiting the lantern room. The door then mends itself from the broken pieces.

column4: I'm so sorry! I had no idea there was this violent of a presence here.
It happens.
No, it doesn't! It's not a ghost!
Who cares what it is? We need to get out of here.

column6: The group starts descending down the spiraling staircase of the Lighthouse.

column4: You know, I deal with this kind of stuff on a regular basis, but, uh, you, uh, looked pretty cool back there.
Yeah?
Yeah! You really took charge.
When stuff gets hairy, I just keep my eyes forward, you know?
Once the civilians are safe, I'm gonna come back to investigate, if you wanted to help.

column6: Ronaldo and Sadie chuckle together, and Steven notices Lars getting unrest.

column4: Something wrong, Lars?
OH, SHH!

column6: Eerie laughter of children is suddenly heard.

column4: What is that?
Oh, it's nothing! We're all just hearing things and seeing things and feeling things that aren't real.

column6: Lars runs ahead towards the front door, when it suddenly swings open and smashes him in the face, knocking him backwards. The scarecrows outside are now animated and creeping towards the group. Sadie and Ronaldo quickly lean themselves against the door, attempting to force it closed from the scarecrows. A few bats and a scarecrow manage to slip through the door, and they begin to attack Lars. Steven manages to pry the scarecrow and bats away from Lars and tosses them out the door, which Sadie and Ronaldo finally manage to shut afterwards.

column4: Have you ever seen a haunting this bad?!

column3: ['shines his flashlight onto his own face', 'shines his flashlight onto Lars']
column4: This is no run-of-the-mill haunting!  It's a poltergeist. A "ghost" only haunts a house. A poltergeist haunts a person! They're usually attracted to the terrifying inner world of the emotionally disturbed.
You think stuff is coming after me?! How can you listen to this...weird guy?! He practically lives in a haunted house. Don't you think maybe he had something to do with it?
I think you can stop being such a dink to Ronaldo.

column3: ['groans in frustration and runs toward Sadie']
column4: Sadie, you're not an idiot!
Hey!
Do you believe all of this?!
All this stuff— They've gotta be doing it somehow. We've gotta ditch these guys. Come on.

column6: Sadie backs away from Lars.

column4: I'm not ditching anyone.
BUT WHAT ABOUT ME, HUH?!?! Sadie! C'mon, you always—

column6: The floorboards suddenly open up underneath Sadie, revealing a glowing red void, and Sadie falls into it, screaming. Lars tries to rush forwards to save her but the floorboards close up, swallowing Sadie as her screams fade away, leaving just her flashlight behind.

column4: Sadie?
The spirit took her!  You're gonna drag us all down with you! Don't you even care?!
Laaaaaars...

column6: A hatch on the floor suddenly opens up.

column4: The basement!

column6: The trio descends into the basement, which is illuminated by the eerie red glow.

column4: I don't see her anywhere!
Spirit, show yourself!

column3: ['places his hand on the lighthouse structure']
column4: It's close.  I can feel it. It's hurting and... obsessed.

column6: Ronaldo shines his flashlight to a wall, and the trio notices a pulsing flesh-like structure with Lars' name carved into it.

column4: Ahaao...
It should have been you!
Wh-what?
It took her, but it should have been you, Lars!
Woah hold on, Ronaldo.
Laaarrrrsssss.

column6: A mouth opens up in the wall below the pulsing flesh. Ronaldo grapples Lars and starts dragging him towards it.

column4: Hey! Let go!
Wait! Stop! What are you doing?

column6: Ronaldo lifts Lars above his head, causing him to scream in fear.

column4: Spirit, I deliver the package of darkness! Return to us the innocent Sadie!
Laaaaarrrsss!
C-come on, man. We used to be friends.
And you threw me away!
AAAAH!

column3: ['runs towards Lars and into the mouth']
column4: Lars!
No, Steven, he's not worth it!
Why does everything bad happen to me?

column6: The mouth pins Steven and Lars down with its tongue. Its teeth begin to slowly come down in an attempt to sever Steven and Lars in half. Ronaldo watches in horror, when Steven summons his bubble shield, protecting himself and Lars. He then expands the bubble, causing the mouth to stretch and explode. The bubble rolls Steven and Lars away to safety before popping. Sadie then emerges from the rubble of the wall, coughing and gasping, along with a Gemstone.

column4: Sadie!
It's a gem!

column6: The gem starts to glow, enveloping the place in a bright light, and begins to project a holographic flashback of a younger Lars and Ronaldo.

column4: This is the perfect clubhouse for the Beach City Explorer Club!
Secret clubhouse, right, Ronnie?  Zip!

column6: The group watches the holograph, as Steven laughs and Lars groans.

column4: Lars, you're a riot!

column6: Young Ronaldo is playing with a camera, when he is startled by some scrapping noises.

column4: DUDE!

column3: ['etching his name into the wall with a screwdriver']
column4: Just carving our names in! Pretty metal, huh?
Weird.

column6: A wooden board from the wall then springs outwards and knocks Young Lars away. Young Ronaldo quickly snaps a photo of it.

column3: ['runs over to Lars and shows him the photo']
column4: Holy smokes! The clubhouse is possessed!  Lars! Lars! When you turn on the TV tomorrow, this is what's gonna be on every station!
B-B-But—But you said this was secret!
Our first paranormal discovery! We're gonna take on the world together!
Um... Let me just— Uh, I'll just, uh...
NO! What are you doing?! NO-NO-NO-NO-NO-NO!
I'm just tearing myself out.

column3: ['grabs Lars and reaches for the remains of the photo', "yanks Lars' arm down and retrieves the torn photo"]
column4: STOP!  Let me... SEE!  What'd you do? Ohh!!!
Oh, come on. Ronnie, you know I can't let people see me like that.
What?! What's the matter with you?!  Don't you know how important this was?!

column6: Young Lars and Young Ronaldo begin wrestling one another. Young Lars then steps on Young Ronaldo's foot and starts running away.

column4: Aah! Why do you care so much about what other people think?!
You wouldn't say that if you knew what other people say about YOU!

column6: As the group watches, Ronaldo is visibly angry while Lars cowers in shame. Young Lars runs away and disappears in the flashback

column4: Lars?

column6: Young Ronaldo vanishes too, and the projection ends.

column4: Aah!  Okay, shh. I've got you. When you were stuck in the wall, was the house like your body? You must have felt like you were under attack back when Lars carved his name in you.
Can I see that?

column3: ['bubbles the gem and sends it away to The Burning Room']
column4: Uh, sorry. We should let it rest.
So, all that lashing out was just from feeling hurt and trapped for so long...
I didn't mean to rip it up, okay?  You can stop talking about me now.
Wait! Oh, Sadie, are you okay?
Uh, yeah. I'm fine.
Oh, yeah.  We were both worried about— I mean, I ran down here faster.
Can we get out of here?
Sadie, you can come with me. I think these two have a lot to talk about.
I bet.
I wasn't trying to make you look bad.
Ahhh, whatever. It didn't matter. I don't care!
Hey, Lars. Take it down a notch.

column6: The star iris begins zooming in on Lars' annoyed/embarrassed face.

column4: Aah!

column6: Steven and Connie are sitting by the fireplace, while Steven is roasting marshmallows on a stick.

column3: ['withdraws a roasted marshmallow away from the fire', 'blows at the marshmallow and eats it']

You told me not to do what you wanted.
Uh... URGGHHH! Where is Connie?
Steven? Steven?
Connie? C-Connie, Is that you?

column6: Steven starts looking around, when Cloud Connie grabs Steven's hand.

column4: Please let me go, I want to find the real Connie!
You told me you wanted-
That doesn't matter!

column6: Steven starts running off and Cloud Connie chases after him.

column4: Please don't follow me, I don't want you to follow me! Cart!

column6: Steven summons a food cart and Cloud Connie easily jumps over it.

column4: Ah! Uhh... Wind Lizard!

column4: Connie can you hear me?
Steven? Steven!?
Connie, I'm almost there, just a little bit further! AH!

column6: Cloud Connie pushes Steven off of the Wind Lizard and they begin to fall.

column4: Rrrr.
Please, I don't want you, I want the REAL Connie!

column3: ['approaches Steven, now wearing the wedding gown']
column4: I know what you really want, I know how you REALLY feel!
Steven?  Ah Steven, finally, there you... are?

column6: Connie sees Cloud Connie pinning a struggling Steven.

column4: Help!

column6: Connie quickly runs up to Cloud Connie and pushes her away from Steven. Cloud Connie grunts and charges back at the pair.

column4: Keep away from him!

column6: Connie steps in and slashes her iron sword at Cloud Connie, slicing her in half and she poofs away. Cloud Connie reforms back shortly in front of Steven.

column4: I know you like her!

column6: Connie steps in between Cloud Connie and Steven, and raises her iron sword in defend to defend Steven.

column4: And I know you want her to like you too.
No, don't listen!

column6: Connie slashes at Cloud Connie again, causing her to poof away. Cloud Connie then reform back on top of Steven.

column4: That's why you can't tell her the truth, but you WANT to!  You wanna tell her!
No!
Get off of him!
Tell her Steven!
I- Unggggh...
TELL HER!
Mmmmrng... I like the ending of the book!

column6: Connie stops charging forward.

column4: What?

I-I thought it was sweet that Lisa and Archimicarus got together in the end! They were always so thoughtful towards each other, and I was so happy when they found the spell to make him human, and I loved every page about the cake, I wanted to draw a picture of it! I'm... I'm sorry I pretended not to like it, I just didn't want you to think less of me.
That's better.

column6: Cloud Connie finally poofs away, and Connie walks towards Steven.

column4: D-do you think I'm a bad person for liking the ending?
Of course not I... Steven, it's just a book!
But, you really care about it!
I care about you more.
Even though I liked the wedding?
Oh, of course you liked the wedding...You're Steven, you love "schmaltz".

column6: Connie offers her hand and helps Steven up. The pair then exits Rose's room through the Temple Gate.

column4: You make a good point, but don't you remember how Archimicarus cried in Book Three?
I thought that was because they lost the sword!
No, she almost fell into the volcano! He was worried about her!
But she had access to frost spells.
Yeah but Archimicarus didn't know that! Even birds can fall in love!
I guess you could read it that way!

column6: Steven is drawing a flyer of Greg as "Guitar Dad" in his room with a pencil, and then making the final touches with a red marker.

column3: ['picks up the drawing and runs down the steps']
column4: PEARL! AMETHYST! GARNET! Uh-ah!

column6: Steven finds all the Gems are sitting on the couch in the living room.

column4: You don't have to yell, Steven, we're right here.
I know, but I just finished this drawing, and I wanted to show it to you.
Oh! Uh... Of course.

column3: ["jumps on Garnet's lap and shows the Gems his flyer"]
column4: All right!  Haha! "Guitar Dad teaches you guitar!"
What is that?
It's my dad. He's going to start teaching guitar lessons and he made me his P.R. Department.

column3: ["points at some crosses on Greg's mouth"]
column4: What's that stuff in his mouth?
Those are his teeth.
What are the lightning bolts for?
Ugh... Well, ah... I was trying to show that Dad really rocks on the guitar, and...
Then there should be rocks falling out of the guitar.
I hear what you're saying, but it's too late for notes... this is permanent marker.

column6: Steven tapes the flyer on the billboard inside the Big Donut.

column4: What's that cute flyer for, Steven?
It's for my dad, he'll teach you guitar, you guys wanna sign up? My dad's really good.
Maybe I'll stop by and check it out.
Here, lemme give you a flyer and—

column6: The door bell chimes and Buck enters.

column4: Welcome to the Big Donut.
Hey, Buck.

column3: ['surprised', 'flaps his arms like a chicken', 'takes off his headphones']
column4: Oh! W-what?  Buck, Buck, Buuuuuuuuck! Haha!  What's going on man? What can we get for you today?

column3: ['looks at the menu, then at the donuts']
column4: Can I get a caprese salad?
Oh sorry, Buck. We only serve don-

column3: ['barges in', 'makes a thumb-up, sweating', 'runs into the break room']
column4: DO-NUT worry, Buck! I'll whip ya up a salad, no sweat!  I'll be right back.
Lars! We don't even have vegetables here!
Heh, what's a "guitar dad"?

column3: ['pretends to play a guitar', "tapes a flyer onto Buck's shirt"]
column4: Like my flyer? It's for my dad.  He'll teach you guitar! Here, take one of these with you. Actually, just wear it.

column6: Buck starts laughing uncontrollably.

column4: Are you ticklish?
This would make a rad shirt, man.
Really?
Yeah, let's make your flyer into T-shirts.
Oh man, my dad would love that!
Gimme five on it.

column6: Steven swings his hand too hard and misses Buck's hand.

column4: Oh, you missed.

column4: Ho! I think it's swell you're returning to the family business, son. Gonna help the old man get re-elected again, eh?  Aww, son!
Ugh! It's not for campaign stuff, dad. Steven and I are making art.
Art!

column3: ['slaps Buck hard on the back, causing his visor to fall off']
column4: Art, huh? I don't understand it myself, but a boy's gotta have interests and ambitions.  WOAH-HO-HO-HO!

column3: ['looks around at the supplies and equipment']
column4: This stuff can be used to make t-shirts?
Oh yeah, I've got all the latest, state of the art screen-printing equipment from years of campaigning. And other some such, mayorly things. Like this week, I'm commemorating... a bench!

column6: Mayor Dewey shows the boys a banner of "Bench City", which is just a banner that reads "Welcome to Beach City", with a "N" written onto the "A" with a marker.

column4: "Welcome to... Bench City"? Thrifty!
Dad, you can't use this.
Why not? You know I "gotta gank dat youth vote, boi"!
Dad, stop.

column6: Steven goes to open one of the boxes and finds several flyers, similar to Steven's. He takes one out and it reads "Vote for My Dad" with a drawing of Buck and Mayor Dewey holding hands.

column4: What's this?
What have you got there?  Aww... I haven't seen this in years. Remember when you drew this, Buck? You couldn't wait to show it off to all your li'l Montessori friends.
Okay, dad. Thanks for all your help, see ya later, bye.
Alright, kids. I mean... "Peace in the Middle-East, Holmes."

column3: ["picks up another one of Buck's flyers"]
column4: So cool.
Let's just get started already.

column4: Swag.
Now everyone's gonna want lessons from Dad!
This is bigger than your dad, Steven. It's art. And it's gonna flood the public consciousness.
Let's start handing them out.

column6: Steven is looking for victims to shoot their T-shirts at, through his binoculars, as Buck readies the T-Shirt Cannon.

column4: Scanning for targets, T-Shirt Cannon loaded and ready. Beep, beep, beep-bibibibibi!  Sour Cream sighted!
Wom, wom. Wom, wom, wom.
Get ready... Take aim.
Aaand...

column3: ['gets hit in the head by the T-shirt', 'picks up and examines the T-shirt']
column4: Wom, wom, wom- WOMP!  What in the world?  Oh. This is the coolest thing I've ever been hit in the head with!
Ronaldo spotted, take aim!

column4: WHOA! What the heck? Huh?  Whoa, weird! Some kind of extraterrestrial space dad guitar shirt? Sooo... You've finally decided to make first contact, huh? WHERE ARE YOU?!
Lars sighted, take aim!

column6: Buck fires another T-shirt at Lars' head.

column3: ['picks up the T-shirt', 'looks up and see Buck and Steven', 'starts laughing aloud']
column4: YEOWCH! What the—?!  What is this garbage?  Buck made this?!  This is hilarious! Thaaanks Buuuck!

column6: Steven and Buck decide to take a break and eat pizzas together.

column4: Cheers!  Buck, this was such a good idea! I don't know why we didn't collaborate on a project sooner. This'll make my dad so happy. I can't wait to see the look on his face when I stop by later.
Yeah... should be good for a laugh.
Huh? Why would it be good for—

column3: ['enters Fish Stew Pizza, wearing the "Guitar Dad" T-shirt']
column4: Giiiirl! Check out my new shiiiiirt!
It's really cute. Where'd you get it?
I dunno, it just landed in front of me when I was out walking.
Well, if I were you, I wouldn't wear some random shirt that just fell out of the sky. What if there were bugs in it?
Re-lax! Who cares where it came from? This shirt is the funniest thing I've seen in my life!
Looks like our shirt has a really good buzz goin'.
Yeah, but... I think they think it's a joke.
Heh. The only thing that's important is that they're talking about it. That's how real art works.
Oh. Well, I guess you're right.

column6: Steven visits his Dad and sees Sour Cream taking a picture of Greg.

column4: Uh... how's this?
Haha, so bad.
Okay, let's get started with the first lesson! Have a seat and grab a— (Sour Cream walks off.) Where ya goin'? Oh, uh, I guess he's got an important text or something.
How's it been going today?
Really great! Lots of people have been coming by thanks to your t-shirts, little guy.
That's great, Dad. I'm really glad I can help...
Yoohoo! Guitar Dad!  I just wanted to say I think you're wonderful and hilarious!
Uh... thank you? Huh, that's kinda strange.
What is?
Well, lots of people have stopped by, but no one's taken a lesson yet.
What?! Really?!
Ah, maybe they're just checking out the scene before they come back to get a REAL lesson.

column6: Buck is printing more "Guitar Dad" T-shirts in the warehouse.

column4: Buck!
Hey, there's my main man.
The shirts aren't working, Buck!
Yeah they are,  people love' em.
But... nobody wants guitar lessons from my dad!
That's not the point.
What?! Then, what is the point?
The point is, it's an amazing shirt.
Aww, my drawing's not that good, ahaha.
Yeah, no. It's terrible.
What?!
That's what's so great about it. Your work is so naive. You really love your dad. It's funny.
I... I don't wanna make these shirts anymore.
Too bad, Steven, it's so current, you can't stop it. I'm a taste maker, and I'm gonna keep making tastes... forever.
"Forever"?

column3: ['holds a peace sign above his head and walks away']
column4: Well, forever after I go to my dad's lame bench commemoration... peace.

column6: Steven runs back to his house and bursts through the door.

column4: Garnet! Pearl! Amethyst!

column4: Steven.
What is it?!
Whoa, where's the fire?!
It's an emergency! You have to help me get rid of all the shirts and stop Buck from making more!
Have the shirts come to life and possessed the bodies of their wearers?!
No! They just-
Are people catching on fire when they put on the magic shirts?
No, no, they're just-
Are the shirts destroying the wearer's will to continue on in this mortal coil, thereby shutting down BEACH CITY?!?
NO!! They're...  They're just... using my art in a way I don't agree with.
Oh.

column6: All the Gems sit back down on the couch.

column4: Eh, we'll pass.
What?! But... But I really need your help.
Steven, this sounds like a very abstract problem.
It's not something we can punch.
You must learn to help yourself. That's how you become stronger.
Good point, good point.
Absolutely.
But...!
Figure something OUT, Steven!
Yes! Why not dust off those conflict resolution skills?
Let your problem be known. Then you can work towards an understanding.

column3: ['thinks of an idea and speaks eerily', 'walks out']
column4: Oh, I'll make them understand.  I'll make them all understand!

column6: The Gems are mildly surprised.

column4: Eh, he'll be fine.

column3: ['blushes and clears his throat', 'adjusts his neck tie']

-I called up a buddy of mine who owed me a...

Aaaah!

column4: I've been... shirt.

column4: Buck...  Did you make this?

Aw, sweet! Thanks, Steven.

You're a cool cat, Steven Universe.  Hey, Mr. U.
You wanna take a picture with me or some junk?

Story for Steven!

The tale begins with a younger Greg, holding a solo concert on the beach of Beach City, playing and singing "Comet".

column4: ♫ Some... say I have no direction, / that I'm a light-speed distraction, / but that's a knee-jerk reaction / Still... this is the final frontier, / everything is so clear, / to my destiny I steer. / This life in the stars is all I've ever known, / stars and stardust in infinite space is my only home. / But the moment that I hit the stage, / thousands of voices are calling my name. / And I know in my heart it's been worth it all of the while. / And as my albums fly off of the shelves, / handing out autographed pics of myself. / This life I chose isn't easy but sure is one heck of a ride. / At the moment that I hit the stage, / I hear the universe calling my name. / And I know deep down in my heart I have nothing to fear. / And as the solar wind blows through my hair, / knowing I have so much more left to share. / A wandering spirit who's tearing its way through the cold atmosphere. / I'll fly like a comet. / Soar like a comet. / Crash like a comet. / I'm just a comet. ♫

Back?
Back to Earth?
I'm NEVER coming back.

Uhh... you want that? You can have it...
Hm?

W-where...?

It spoke to you?

Yo~

column4: Ugh, Amethyst, wait!

column3: ['lands in front of Greg, scaring him', 'crawls around Greg']

column4: Amethyst! Leave him be! You don't know where he's been!  I'm very sorry about this... umm... you.

What should we do?

Uhh... I was kinda looking for the mysterious pink lady. Kinda really tall... lots of big curly hair?
See, he's talking about Ro—mmphhh (Pearl puts her hand over Amethyst's mouth to muffle her.)

I'll just throw him back over the fence.
Huh?

Wait!

It's you. Whoa!- Ow!

column4: Are you alright?

No one can ignore the Universe. Oh!  I brought you this. It's the free t-shirt that came with the free CD!
Why, thank you! (The other Gems crowd around Rose to look at the T-shirt.  His gimmick is space!

Better make it good.

Nnnight... time?

column4: What?

column6: Peridot pauses and slowly turns her head, seeing Pearl, Garnet, and Amethyst glaring at her at the kitchen table.

column3: ['runs in between the Gems and Peridot']
column4: Wait!
Look! Over there! Another planet to betray!

column6: Pearl grunts, Garnet summons her gauntlets and Amethyst eats a whole pizza box in one gulp.

column4: Retreat!

column6: Peridot crawls to the front door, but Pearl and Garnet block her path.

column4: Oh no, you don't!
Eeep!!

column6: Peridot scampers up the steps, where Amethyst is waiting on Steven's bed.

column4: Heey.

column3: ['jumps back down to the ground floor']
column4: AAAHH!  Ow!
Get her!

column6: Peridot scampers into the bathroom and shuts the door.

column4: You may have won the war, but the battle isn't over, CRYSTAL CLODS!

column6: The Gems then dispels their weapons.

column4: Should we tell her that's the bathroom?
Ehh.
Hmm... Seems I discovered some sort of archaic... think-chamber. Roomy, with a fresh hint of Earth citrus.  A perfect crossroads for my escape.
It's locked.
Peridot, open the door!

column6: Toilet flushing is heard.

column4: If you're trying to flush yourself down the toilet, it won't work.

column6: Peridot is seen swirling in the toilet.

column4: Trust me, I've tried.
How did she get out? We bubbled her!
Maybe we needed a bigger bubble.
My bubbles are fine.
... I did it.

column6: Garnet, Amethyst, and Pearl glare at Steven in shock and anger.

column4: Steven! Why would you do such a thing!?
Because she knows something! Something that's made her scared!
Duh. Homegirl knows we're gonna beat her into a green pancake.
No, not 'cause of us. 'Cause of something called "the Cluster".
Cluster? That's new.
What else did she tell you?
That's all I got.
That's right, you dirt bombs! You don't even know what's coming!!!  Ooh..
I'm tired of playing these games.

column6: Peridot is seen making faces in the mirror.

column4: If we can't fight her, then fine. We'll talk. Peridot!
Whoa!
Alright, no more fighting. Let's just have a civil conversation.
As if I'd negotiate with you, filthy war machine!
Okay, let's kick her butt.
Wait!

column3: ['holds a plunger while hanging from the shower curtains', 'quickly covers her mouth while clinging to the shower curtains, regretting what she said']
column4: Yeah! Destroy me again, and have fun trying to talk to me when I'm in a bubble!
I really hate to say it, but unfortunately if she has information, she's more valuable to us like... this.
This is going to be tricky.

column6: Water gushing is then heard.

column4: H-h-hot hot hot!
You have to turn the knob the other way for cold!

column6: The Crystal Gems then gather in the kitchen to discuss, while Steven drinks from a cup.

column4: Wait, so we're just gonna let her live in my bathroom?
Well, yes. What other option do we have? Keep her outside on a leash?  Ha ha...  Hmm...
But, I need to use the bathroom!
Right now?
Yeah, kinda.
Just go in the ocean, bro. Pssssh. Like a feeyush.
What's with you guys and making me pee outside!?
Well I have fun doing it..

column6: The Gems are still discussing in the background in the kitchen, while a half-awake Steven, carrying Peridot's prosthetic foot, walks past.

column4: But even if we do get her to come out of the bathroom...
She's never gonna talk to us.
Looks like there's not much else we can do right now.
We have her in our custody at least, even if the circumstances are less than optimal. How important do you think this Cluster is?
If it has anything to do with the experiments she was conducting in the Kindergarten, then very.
Peridot, can I come in? I need to get ready for the day.
No!
I have something for you.

column6: Peridot cracks the door open to see Steven holding her foot. She grabs it and shuts the door, then slowly opens the door again for Steven.
Steven enters the bathroom and turns on the lights, seeing Peridot clinging to her prosthetic foot in a corner.

column4: What a great souvenir of that other time you assaulted me.
Oh, right, sorry. I can take it back.
No, it's too late! You... wouldn't happen to have the rest?

column3: ['washing his face', 'pauses', 'points to the toothbrush on the floor']
column4: Uh, sorry, we lost them.  Well, we kinda threw 'em away.  Can you pass me that?
Is this a weapon!?
Only for cavities.
Hmm.
Thanks!
Is that a weapon?
No, that's a comb I never use.
Is that a weapon?

column3: ['rolls up his towel, and Peridot flinches in fear']
column4: Hmm? Oh, well, I guess if you get it wet and roll it up.  Look, I know you're scared, but I'm not going to hurt you. And whatever's going on, whatever the "Cluster" is, I wanna help.
I doubt you can help me, but I... appreciate the offer.
Now do you mind moving?  I have to use that.

column6: The star iris closes in on Peridot's face.

column4: ... For what?

column6: The iris closes, ending the episode.
Garnet is seen angrily knocking on the bathroom door and yelling at it.

column4: Open the door, Peridot! If this "Cluster" is putting us in danger, you need to tell us what it is so we can stop it.

column3: ['holding the doorknob on the other side']
column4: NO! I hate you. I'm not telling you anything about the Cluster!
Oh, come on! Is it like a big... hunk of... granola?
... What's "granola"?
I'm sure it's not granola. Now Peridot, I'm sure we can reach some sort of agreement. Perhaps a trade is in order?

Oh, sure, why don't you just give me back my leg enhancements and my arm attachments with my screen and my log and all my information! Oh wait, YOU DESTROYED THEM! SO NO, I DON'T THINK WE CAN REACH SOME SORT OF AGREEMENT!!

column6: The Gems collectively groan, when toilet flushing is heard, revealing that Steven is still inside the bathroom with Peridot.

column4: Okay Peridot, you can turn around now.

column6: Steven comes out of the bathroom.

column4: Sorry for, interrupting your interrogation.
Don't worry about it, Steven.
I swear, Peridot is gonna crack any second now!
I'll never crack for the likes of you, you... CRYSTAL CLODS!
I'VE GOT YOUR CLODS RIGHT HERE, YOU LITTLE--
Hold on Pearl. If she's not going to be of any help, let's investigate this thing on our own.
I'll come with you!
Sorry Steven, we're gonna need you to stay here and keep and eye on our... "guest".
Really?!
Yeah! Make sure she doesn't try anything.
Don't worry, she's harmless without her limb enhancers.
I'M NOT HARMLESS!
Oh, HUSH UP!

column6: The Gems step onto the Warp Pad.

column4: Oh! Steven, there's one more thing I have to mention.
What is it?

column3: ['forms a heart shape with her hands']
column4: I love you. Bye!
See ya later!

column6: The Gems warp away, and Steven blushes and waves. Times passes by, the sky outside the Beach House is getting dark as thunder is heard. Steven is preparing soup in the kitchen.

column4: They left, you know. You can come out now.
No! I-I like it in here!
Okay.

column6: Steven continues preparing his soup and looks out the window, as he sees a heavy rain begins to pour.

column4: Wow, it's really coming down.

column6: Thunder strikes. Peridot then kicks the bathroom door open and runs out, accidentally slamming into a wall.

column4: It's happening!
What?!
THE CLUSTER!!!
Really?!
What else could be making that horrible- (Thunder strikes again.) AHHHHH!  It's pounding on the Earth from the inside! This is it, this is THE END of the world!
Oh, that's just thunder!
What?
Yeah, everything is fine, it's just thunder. It happens when it rains.
Uh huh?
You don't know about rain?
... I don't know anything without my screen.

column3: ['lifts the cooking pot lid, releasing steam from the inside, and closes it']
column4: I-It's okay. Here, pretend this soup is the ocean. When the sun warms it up, water evaporates into clouds, like this steam.  But when the clouds get really heavy, it rains.
So, scalding liquid pours down from the sky?
No, no i-it's just water, it can't hurt you.  Here, why don't I just show you?

column6: Steven steps outside the house and runs down to the stairs, into the rain.

column4: Woo-hoo!
Steven, wait!  Umm uhhmmm...

column3: ['laughs', 'laughs and falls into a mud puddle', 'stands up, still laughing']
column4: COME ON!  Look, I'm okay, it's just water! This is just something that happens on Earth! Isn't it cool?! * and falls into a mud puddle* WOOOAAAHHH! BWAH!  YEAH! WWHHHOOOOHHHHHOOOO!

column6: Peridot cautiously reaches her hand out into rain, feeling the rain drops on her skin. She then slowly steps out of the house and into the rain.

column4: YEAH! YOU DID IT! What do you think? Isn't it cool?
Cool...

column6: Steven and Peridot are back indoors. Steven is drying his hair while Peridot is pacing around, thinking to herself.

column4: That was fun. Huh?
It was... something. Hmmm... Ehhh... Hmmm... Steven...?
Hmm?
I'm going to say something.  Thank you.
Uhh, what for?
For explaining this "rain" business to me.
Oh, no problem.
Yes, you're a much more intelligent creature than I initially thought.
Um, that's... good?
Yes, much more useful than those... clods. STEVEN! I've made up my mind.
About what exactly?
I've decided to share some... information with you!
Aww, I know you use my toothbrush.
N-no... Well.. yes, but it's about the Cluster.
You cracked!
I haven't cracked!
Wait you have to tell the Gems, they need to know this.

No! I don't want to talk to them! You're the only one I need!  I can show you now, but I have nothing! My arm attachments, my fingers, my screen, my log, it's all gone! But all of my logs up to date 6-5-2 still exist, backed up in Facet Five of the Prime Kindergarten!
You want me to take you to the Kindergarten? I don't know, uh...
Steven, don't you want to know about the Cluster?
Hmm... okay. We can go to the Kindergarten.
Ahhh, YES!
Bu-u-ut~
No! A catch. Fine! What are your demands?

column3: ['reaches his hand towards Peridot and giggles']
column4: You're gonna to have to hold my hand the whole time.

column6: Steven and Peridot, holding hands, warp to the Kindergarten.

column4: Welp, here we are.
Okay, great! Let's go.

column6: Peridot leaps off the warp pad platform, dragging Steven along, and they both fall, screaming, onto the ground, landing on their faces. They then venture into the Kindergarten.

column4: This place just gets worse every time I come here.
I know. It's been so poorly managed. It must have been in way better shape when you first emerged.
Emerged?
Yeah, you're some kind of quartz, right? (The two stop walking.) You must have been made here.
Uh... I came from my mom and dad.
Are those some kind of rocks? Or another planet?

column3: ['chuckles', 'shows Peridot his gem at his naval']
column4: Nope. My dad is from Earth, but my mom's a Gem.
You're some sort of... hybrid? How is that possible?
The answer to that is a story I like to call, "The Ballad of Rose and Greg".
I don't care. Let's just hurry to the control room. (The two start walking again.)
You sure this is safe? The last time I was here, there were a bunch of fusion monsters.
Yes, I was checking their progress.
What's the deal with those things?

column6: Steven and Peridot begin sliding down the hole to the Prime Kindergarten Control Room.

column4: When it became clear that the Earth was no longer a viable colony, Homeworld decided to use it for something else: a series of experiments. A gem geo-weapon.
Oh, did you help?
Negative. I wasn't lucky enough to be around for that. But I read over a few hundred years of reports.
This is where you need to be, right?
Yes. I'm going to have to remove this panel and do a bit of work to restore power to this room, sooo... can I have my hand back now?
Okay, but stay where I can see you.

column6: Steven releases Peridot's hand, and she taps on a wall, causing a panel to pop out. Peridot then attempts to pull out the panel, grunting and straining, but fails.

column4: It's over... I can't show you anything. Let's go back.
Mind if I try?
Go ahead, knock yourself out.

column6: Steven pulls away the panel with ease.

column4: Whoa!
There you go!

column3: ['tinkers with the wires in the wall']
column4: Alright.  This over here...

column6: The Control Room's power is then restored.

column4: It's not perfect, but it'll do for now.

column6: Steven drops the panel and Peridot groans as she cannot reach the gem pedestal.

column4: Come on!
What's up, 'dot?
I can't quite... reach the- mmm!

column6: Steven picks up Peridot and puts her on his shoulders.

column4: It's okay to ask for help, you know.
I had it.

column6: Peridot taps on the pedestal and it lowers to her height. Steven then put Peridot down and she clears her throat. She then places her hand on the pedestal in the center, lighting up the control room, and a plethora of Gem Shards are shown on the room's screens.

column4: These are the early attempts at artificial fusion.
That's a lot of Gem shards...
We were growing them here at this very site, but these were just prototypes for the final product.

column6: Peridot taps on the pedestal, and the screen projects the overview of Earth, with a marker displayed around the east coast of North America.

column4: A singular, giant, artificial fusion, comprised of millions of Gem shards. The Cluster.
Peridot, you're saying... there's a giant, mutant Gem the size of the Earth under us right now?

Oh, no, when it forms, it'll be much, much bigger than the Earth. Right now, it lies dormant, incubating in the Earth's core, but when it emerges and takes its physical form, it will destroy the planet.

column6: The screen then displays the Earth expanding and shattering, as the Cluster forms its physical form. Steven stares at it with great concern.

column4: The prototypes are already emerging. The Cluster is next. If we can't get off this planet, we've got to stop the Cluster.

column6: Steven starts sweating in anxiety.

column4: I thought it'd be impossible, but now we have a chance.
What is it?
It's you, Steven!

column6: Peridot and Steven climb out of the control room.

column4: Now that you're filled in, we can get to work!
Uhh, how am I supposed to help?
Well, you have all the information that we need about Earth and its erratic behavior. Put that together with my expansive knowledge of the Cluster and we just might be able to stop it!

No, Peridot, I don't think you get it!  Just because I know how clouds work doesn't mean I know how to stop a giant mutant in the center of the earth! Besides, the only reason that I know anything about clouds and rain is because my dad told me.
What are you talking about?
I used to be really scared of thunderstorms, just like you. Then Dad explained how rain and all that stuff works, then I wasn't scared of rain anymore.
Well I'm sure you have other knowledge about how this planet works.
Sure, but none of it's going to help us! If we want to stop this Cluster thing, we'll need help from the Crystal Gems.
I said I don't need them! Let's just warp me back to the bathroom or whatever you call it and we'll take care of this. If it looks really bad, then we can just ask this "Dad" for help, right?

column6: Loud screeching is then heard, frightening Peridot.

column4: Yikes! What was that?
Oh no! Gem mutants!

column6: Various cluster mutants appear around the warp pad. One of them leaps in front of Steven and Peridot, and Steven quickly summons his bubble shield.

column4: Do something!
I am doing something!
Something useful!!
Uh... Let's run!

column6: Steven and Peridot run away from the cluster mutants in Steven's bubble, as they begin chasing the two.

column4: Over here!
No, the other way!
No, not there!
AAAAAAHHHHHH!
Let's run into this corner! Oh no!
We're cornered!

column6: A cluster mutant catch up to Steven and Peridot, and pounces on Steven's bubble.

column4: AAHHH! Can't you destroy it?
No, this is all I can do on my own!

column6: The cluster mutant begins pushing harder on Steven's bubble.

column4: AAAAAAAAHHHHHHHH... That's it, we are finished!
Hang on, Steven!
It's the Gems!

column6: The Gems arrive and begin poofing the cluster mutants. Garnet sends an electric wave at the cluster mutant attacking Steven's bubble and poofs it too.

column4: Peridot, there's no way we can stop this thing in the Earth on our own. We need the help of the Crystal Gems.

column6: Peridot sweats in hesitation. The Gems then leap in front of Steven and Peridot, and Steven dispels his bubble.

column4: Steven! Are you alright?

column3: ['pushes Steven aside and walks up to the Gems']
column4: Move aside, Steven.
Peridot?!
What are you two doing here?!
Steven, I thought I told you to keep an eye on her.
I know, but-

column3: ['reluctantly', 'gazes at Steven, then back at the Crystal Gems']
column4: He did what he was told.  Alright, listen up you clo- nyargh- Crystal Gems! I've made up my mind. I have something to tell you about the Cluster.

column6: Peridot is seen about to give a presentation to the Gems.

column4: Ahem, ahem. As it seems I have no other options, I have conceded to reveal some important information to you Crystal Gems.

column6: Peridot snaps her fingers, cuing Steven to shuffle in, wearing a box with a crudely drawn picture of Earth on it. Peridot, using a flyswatter as a pointer, smacks the box.

column4: This-!
Woah!
... Is the Earth. At the very center of the planet's core lies... the Cluster! Rotate.

column6: Steven complies, turning the box to show a representation of the Earth's core and the Cluster inside.

column3: ['points at the illustration', 'hits the box again']
column4: This is the Cluster. A massive, artificial fusion composed of millions of Gem shards. It has laid dormant for thousands of years within this planet's crust. When this Gem activates and takes its form, the result will be catastrophic. Now!

column6: Steven turns back to the Earth picture and bobs up and down, making escalating noises. A green snake-like puppet then bursts through the box, and the Gems gasps.

column4: BWAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAH!
What is that!?
It's the Cluster.

column6: Peridot swats the puppet with the flyswatter.

column4: It does not look like that. But it is real, and it can activate at any moment!
Bwaaaah.
What a cluster.
That abomination must be stopped.
But how? We'll need to build some sort of machine to take us to the center of the Earth, it'll have to-

column3: ['suddenly swats at Pearl and interrupts her']
column4: Hey! I wasn't finished speaking! What we need is to build some sort of machine to take us to the center of the Earth.

column6: Pearl starts glaring at Peridot in annoyance. Amethyst looks at Pearl and smiles sarcastically. Pearl then glares at Amethyst, causing her to stop.

column4: It'll need to withstand up to 360 gigapascals of pressure and temperatures of 9800 degrees.
Well, we mustn't waste time. We need to start finding parts for this machine immediately.
Yes. Obviously. We'll start by dismantling all devices inside this dwelling.
Wha?

column6: Peridot runs to the kitchen and grabs the microwave.

column4: This primitive radiation concentrator should come in handy!

column6: Peridot tears the microwave off the cupboard and throws it on the counter. She then grabs a corded phone from the living room.

column4: This primitive vibration transmitter could possibly serve a function!

column6: Peridot smashes the dials on the table, splitting it in half. She then runs up to Steven's room and lifts up the television.

column4: There's a remote chance something useful could be inside this primitive image cube!

column6: Peridot smashes the TV on the floor.

column4: Wait!  I have a better idea that doesn't involve destroying the house!
Classic Steven.

column6: Steven brings Pearl and Peridot to the barn, and Peridot inspects it form the outside.

column4: All right. What we have here in the barn should be adequate enough for us to get started. First, I recommend we organize the component types and assemble a rough blueprint based off what we have available.

column6: Steven spins on a swivel chair, with a smile on his face, in front of a chalkboard with a cartoony drawing of a spaceship-like drill. Pearl then takes a look at Steven's drawing.

column4: Ugh... sorry, Steven, it's a lovely drawing but it won't look like this.

column6: Steven stops spinning, now frowning. Peridot picks up a piece of chalk, examines it and hands it to Pearl.

column4: Hmm. Good, yes, this is adequate. Thank you. You can go now.
Uh, what?
Hm? Umm.. That will be all?

column6: Peridot claps her hands in command. Pearl continues to stand there, looking incredulously at Peridot.

column4: How do you get her to leave?
Excuse me, I am not leaving.
Yeah! She's gotta stay here to help us build the drill thing, right?
No, no. You're confused. A Pearl can't build a thing like this.
Why not?
Because Pearls aren't for this! They're for standing around, and looking nice, and holding your stuff for you... right?
That's enough! If we're going to work together, you're going to have to listen to me.
Listen to you?   Did you teach her to talk like this? (Pearl looks at Peridot angrily.)
What are you talking about?
She's a Pearl. She's a made-to-order servant just like the hundreds of other Pearls being flaunted around back on Homeworld.
Wait... there's hundreds of Pearls!?
Well, yes, bu-
And she looks like a fancy one, too.

column3: ['whispering to himself, trying to grasp the number']
column4: Hundreds of Pearls...
So, who do you belong to anyway?

column3: ["snatches the sash out of Peridot's hands"]
column4: NOBODY!
Then... what are you for?

column6: Pearl recoils back.

column4: Well, you can belong to me for now. Ha! A Peridot with a Pearl, what would they say back home?
Now listen here, you tiny twerp! In case you've forgotten, you're on our turf now! And I didn't fight a thousand-year war for this planet's independence to take orders from the likes of you!
Excuse me? I am a natural technician and a certified Kindergartener. I was made for this! You were made to take orders, not to give them!
Woah, woah, hang on guys! Now, we can all agree that you are both good at building things, so can't you just try listening to each other?
NO!!
I'm as good at building things as you. Better, even!
Hah! Name one thing you can engineer better! Go on!
Robots.
Hmm?
You should build robots. Giant robots! I see a race. A giant robo-race! With prizes! Giant robo-prizes!
You mean like a competition?
Yeah! To see who's better at building stuff!
What are these "robots" you speak of?
They're like those funky marble guys you were sending! Only bigger, and you can ride them!
Hah, building one of these robots will be easy!
Well, I can build one faster!
That's what you think!

column6: Pearl and Peridot begin to build their respective robots while Steven watches in awe. Garnet and Amethyst then arrive at the barn.

column4: Yo Steven, how are the wonder nerds doing- Woah! Wh-what's going on? Are they building the drill?
No. We're building robots now.

column6: The power tools start making loud noises, causing Amethyst and Steven to cover their ears.

column4: What'd you say!?
I SAID-!

column6: Suddenly, Pearl, donning her space suit, rides out of the barn in her robot, showing off its mobility.

column4: GIANT ROBOT!
Hah! Pathetic. (Peridot marches out in her own robot.) Now, behold, my vision of ultimate power!

column6: Peridot laughs as she shows off her robot's claws. She then notices the height of Pearl's robot, compared to hers, and gasps.

column4: Hey!
Mine's taller. I win.
Ladies and gentle-Gems, welcome to the first annual Robolympics!
Woo!
Popcorn!
This competition will test our robo-engineers' skills of robo-construction and robo-piloting. Whoever wins will get to be in charge of building the Cluster-drill-machine-thing. Let the games begin!

column6: Pearl and Peridot begin competing, while Steven tallies on the chalkboard, and Amethyst and Garnet spectate. Various aspects of their machines are put to the test, such as balance, crushing, jumping, speed, and some other non-sequitur categories such as ballet, art, and rock-paper-scissors. Other competitions include jumping jacks, tug-of-war, and projectile strength. Antics ensue, such as when the two robots crash into a tree during the speed competition, to which Amethyst rejoices in excitement. Steven also chooses to declare the art competition inconclusive as it is subjective. Ultimately, the two tie in terms of points, leading to a final round at early evening, involving the tossing of trucks.

column4: Alright guys, this is the final event!
You got this, P!
Get it, girl!

column6: Pearl looks on in determination from the support, while Peridot frowns at her.

column4: Ready, set, CHUCK!

column6: Both robots grab their respective trucks and toss them far into the yonder. Both trucks disappear over the horizon, giving no clear indication of whose flew farther.

column4: Woah. (Steven and Amethyst look and shrug at each other.)
You both get a point on that one.

column6: The group return back to the chalkboard to decide the winner.

column4: Hmm, hmm. Looks like our final score is... a tie! Welp, that settles it. You both get to lead the project together!
No! This isn't over! I demand we have a tiebreaker!
Ugh, let's just give it a rest! That's it, we tied, we're the same, let's move on.

column6: Pearl begins to pilot her robot away, but Peridot grabs on with her robot's claws.

column4: No! You're a Pearl! You are beneath me! I'll always be better than you and nothing I've seen today will ever change that!
Well, have you ever seen a Pearl do this!?

column6: Pearl's robot then kicks Peridot's robot backwards, causing it to land on its back. Steven, Garnet, and Amethyst audibly gasp, with Amethyst dropping her popcorn.

column4: So, you want to fight!?  Good. We should've done this from the beginning!

column6: Peridot's robot tackles into Pearl's robot. The two lock hands and start wrestling each other.

column4: STOP! Giant robots shouldn't fight!
Fight, fight, fight, fight!

column6: Peridot, laughing, has her robot toss Pearl's robot towards Steven, Garnet, and Amethyst, who quickly jump away as Pearl's robot crash-lands onto the ground, knocking away the chalkboard.

column4: Pearl!
It's alright, guys! I've got this.
Be careful!
Kick her in the butt!

column6: Peridot's robot is about to slam its claw atop Pearl's robot, but Pearl pilots it around and block it. The two robots then lock hands again.

column4: This is pointless! There's no way you're gonna beat me! You're an accessory! Somebody's shiny toy! Where do you get off acting like your own Gem?! (Peridot's robot rips one of the arms off of Pearl's robot.) You're just a PEARL!

column6: Pearl grimaces, but her expression becomes determined.

column4: That's right! I am a Pearl!

column6: Steven, Garnet, and Amethyst all gasp in surprise.

column4: WOOO-HOOOO!

column6: Peridot's robot takes a few steps back while Pearl's robot gets up.

column4: What you're saying may be true, but it doesn't matter! (Pearl's robot jumps up.) I'm still gonna kick your butt!
Ohohohoh!

column6: Pearl's robot descends towards Peridot's robot with a kick. Peridot's robot, however, catches Pearl's robot's leg with one of its claws, and Peridot snickers in delight.

column4: Uh-oh.

column6: Peridot's robot proceeds to slam Pearl's robot on the ground repeatedly. Steven, Garnet, and Amethyst grimace with each impact. Pearl lies knocked out in a crater, along with her beat-up robot.

column4: Pearl!
Ugh...
Victory is mine! Now I'm the one in charge! Praise me, praise me!
Pearl, are you okay?

column6: Steven helps Pearl up.

column4: Ah, I'm alright.

column3: ['rushes in and gives Pearl a hug', 'punches Pearl in the arm']
column4: YEAH, P!  Aww, that was awesome! You were hardcore!
Oh... really?
Oh yeah.
Hey! Why aren't you listening to me!? I won! I'm the natural leader here! She's just a common Pearl!
You're wrong! If Pearls are really like you say they are, then Pearl isn't common at all!

column4: Okay Steven, open up!

column4: SURPRI-!
Wow.
Oh my.
Huh?

column4: Steven... Are you feeling okay?
Heh, you look good Steven.
Oh!  Thanks, Garnet.
Dude, your neck!
Oh, uh, what about it?
You HAVE one!
So, you just grew... all of a sudden?
I had a magical growth spurt, just now. Cool, right?
Oh, right! It's totally cool!
Alright then, let's get this party started.
Yeah, let's eat this cookie cake!

column6: Connie and Steven sit alone on a picnic mat, when Lion naps besides them.

column4: Here, Steven.
Wow, thanks.
Oh, you don't have to untie that. It's just a box made to look like I spent a lot of time wrapping it.

column3: ['opens the box, tossing away the lid']
column4: Ohhh a new shirt! What a pretty color.
Try it on.

column6: Steven puts on the shirt and tries to button it up.

column4: Oh, I guess it doesn't fit since-
No, don't worry. It fits fine just like this!

column6: Steven decides to wear the shirt like a coat and giggles.
Steven, Amethyst, Pearl and Connie are playing badminton together.

column4: Here it comes!
I got it, Pearl!
Nice, Connie.

column3: ['hits the shuttlecock out of the field, and it lands on a tree']
column4: Hiiii-yah!
If you hit it, you get it.

column6: Connie runs up to the tree and tries to jump and grab the shuttlecock, but fails. She then tries to climb the tree.

column4: Connie, let me.

column6: Steven runs up, jumps and grabs onto the branch, causing the shuttlecock drop off the tree.

column4: Oh, cool, thanks Steven!
No problem, Connie.
Yo, bring back that shuttlecock!
Huh?

column6: Connie runs off, when Steven's arm begins to shrink down to its former size.

column4: Oh no!

column6: Steven then uses his gem power to stretch his arm again, and he sighs in a strained relief.

Pearl, Amethyst, Connie and Steven are dancing, while Garnet and Greg browse an array of vinyl disks to play. Greg pulls out a disc cover titled "Stella", and Garnet shoves her hand in Greg's face. Everyone is having fun, although Steven seems to be straining and sweating.

column4: This one goes out to the birthday boy, and his best friend.

column6: A calm romantic music begins to play, and Steven and Connie laugh. They both then begin dancing together.

column4: I still can't believe all this time you were older than me. You should sneak me into a PG-13 movie sometime.
Oh yeah...
No, I'm just kidding, I would never ask you to break the law. It's funny that I have to look up at you now though.
Funny good or funny bad?

column3: ["leans on Steven's chest, causing him to blush"]
column4: Funny good.
Aw... Steven's having fun.
We know how to throw a party.
Excuse me for a moment Connie, I'm gonna go freshen up. Be right back.

column6: Steven runs to the side of the barn, seemingly out of view of everyone, and shrinks himself back to normal size.

column3: ['in normal voice', 'slumps against the wall in exhaustion']
column4: Ohhh geez...  If I can just keep this up for the rest of my life, no one will suspect a thi-

column6: Steven's eyes widen, as he spots Greg and Amethyst, playing with a piñata, glaring at him. Greg then drops the piñata in shock.

column4: What are you doing?!?
W-Wha... Well uh...  What are...  YOU doing?!?
What are YOU doing to your body?!?
Woah, woah, woah, have you been stretching yourself out all day?
No! I was just... slouching.
Why are you doing this? It... really isn't like you.
Because, Dad, I can't stay a kid forever, when Connie grows up and becomes president what is that gonna make me? First Boy!?
Steven, you can't just keep stretching forever. If you hold it too long, you could really hurt yourself.
Yeah well, I'm half human so maybe it works different for me, we'll just have to wait and see, right?
Steven...

column6: Steven walks off, while Amethyst and Greg exchange concerned looks.
Steven and Connie are sitting on a mat and star-gazing.

column4: That one's... "Canis helicopterus".
Uh-uh, "Helicopterus"?
Yeah, Dogcopter, get it?  Now you make one up!
Okay, um...  That one's, uh, snake constellation.
That's... pretty good.. Are you okay? It looks like you're gonna throw up.
Oh yeah, e-everything's fine!
Okay... that's good. You know, to be honest, I was a little worried before. This might sound silly, but...  I'm really glad that I'm going to get grow up with you.

column6: Steven becomes overwhelmed and begins to shrink, seemingly disappearing into his clothes.

column3: ["pulls Steven's shirt aside, revealing an infant Steven"]
column4: ...Steven?  Steven?! What's going on? What happened?
Whaa?

column6: Steven blushes and examines his shrunken body. He looks at Connie and begins to cry. Connie then carries the crying infant Steven to show to everyone.

column4: We were just talking then all of a sudden-
He turned back into a baby?!
YES!
Dude, I told you... Stretching your body out for that long is not good for you!

column6: Steven speaks baby talk in response.

column4: Here you go, Pearl.
Oh, no, no, don't give him to me!
Hand him over, Amethyst.
Here you go.

column6: Garnet holds Steven up and starts blinking her eyes one by one. She then sticks out her tongue and makes funny noises to cheer Steven up. Steven, however, keeps crying.

column4: My power means nothing to an infant.
Okay, this is my department.
What are you going to do?
Don't worry, I got this.

column6: Greg begins driving Connie and Steven, who is still crying, away from the barn while "Let Me Drive My Van (into Your Heart

column4: How can the Gems not know what to do?
You think they know the first thing about raising a baby? That was all me, but I don't get it, driving always used to calm him down.
But, how do we change him back?
I don't know! Look Connie, let me take you home, I-I'll call you when this all this gets sorted out.

column6: Connie turns to look at Steven, while he tries to communicate in baby talk.

column4: W-Wait no, I wanna stay.
Are you sure?

Yeah, I just want to be there for Steven. Don't worry Steven, it doesn't matter to me what age it seems like you are, I wanna hang out with you no matter what. Your dad still has his car wash and the Gems have to do gem stuff so I'll watch you when they're not around. I can come see you after I'm done training with Pearl too. Doesn't that sound fun?

column6: Connie holds up her finger to Steven, coos happily and holds onto it.

column4: Look at that, he finally stopped crying.
Well that's a start.
Ahem.
What's up, Amethyst?

column6: It is revealed that Amethyst had shapeshifted into a carseat for the infant Steven the whole time.

column4: Baby Steven needs changin'.

column5: Trans. Ext. The Barn, The Next Morning

column6: Connie wakes up in her tent, only to find Steven's shirt lying next to her.

column4: Oh my gosh. Ooh my gosh! Did he get even smaller? Steven's microscopic!  He's reverted back to a zygote!  Everyone! Steven is-
