column4: Look, it fits now.
You're back to normal!
Sorry this was a disaster, I wanted to look older for you.
That doesn't matter.
I... heard what you said in the van. It's really okay if I don't age like a human?
Of course it is. I like you just the way you are.
Oof, okay.
Uh... Steven? You've got something on your cheek.
Huh?  It's a facial hair!
Really!?
DAD!
What is it little man?
Look at this!
Holy smokes! You're growin' a beard! You really are getting older.  Everybody! Look at this!
Unbelievable.
Very impressive.
Is there more where that came from?

column6: The Gems start laughing together, and Connie giggles in relief too. The star iris then closes on Connie smiling, ending the episode.

It is the late evening. Pearl, Garnet, and Amethyst are seen sitting on a hill and watching the sunset over Beach City. Steven is lying nearby against Lion, strumming his ukulele, when Peridot walks up to him.

column4: Steven.
Hi!
Why did we stop working on the drill?! Why are they just sitting there looking at nothing?!
We worked hard and we deserve to take it easy for a little bit. I mean just look at that view. It's beautiful.
It's going to be blown to oblivion by the Cluster if we don't get back to work!
Working hard is important, but feeling good is important too.
WHAT ARE YOU TALKING ABOUT!?!

column6: Peridot accidentally turns on the power drill in her hand in her frustration, and it makes a buzzing sound.

column3: ['imitates the drill buzzing', 'plays the note on his ukulele']
column4: Hey!  What is that, a C?
The drill?
Yeah! (Peridot makes the drill buzz in a higher pitch.) Oh my gosh, now it's music!
Music?
Yeah! It's music! Like this, do-re-mi-fa-so-la-ti-do.
Do-mi-so-do...
♫ Isn't it pretty? ♫
That's exceedingly simple. (Steven strums his ukulele again.) Do-mi-so-ti...
♫ We're making music. ♫
What is the point? You're not making anything.
Well, if it isn't anything, then why does it sound so good?
I suppose it's just interest... Do-mi-so-do. Devoid of substance or purpose, a hypothetical pattern... Do-mi-so-ti. For the satisfaction of bringing it to completion.
Sure.
Do-mi-so-ti. Interest without meaning? Solutions without problems?
And then you just add words. Here's what I have been working on.

column6: Steven begins to sing "Peace and Love on the Planet Earth".

column4: ♫ Life and death and love and birth, / And peace and war on the planet Earth. / Is there anything that's worth more, / Than peace and love on the planet Earth? / Oh-whooah, come on and sing it with me~ ♫
Sing?
♫ The words relate to the key~ ♫
Key?
♫ If it's a pattern, if it's a pattern, / Then just repeat after me~ / Life and death and love and birth- ♫
♫ Life and death and love and birth- ♫
♫ Now you sing mi-fa-mi-mi-fa-mi-ti-la! ♫
♫ And peace and war on the planet Earth! ♫
Yes, yes! That's it!
That's so easy.
Yeah, but that's what's fun about it. You should write something, you should write a song!
About what?
Whatever you're thinking!

column6: Night falls. Peridot begins to sing her part of the song in front of a bonfire, while the Crystal Gems watch on.

column4: ♫ I guess we're already here, / I guess we already know. / We've all got something to fear, / We've all got nowhere to go. / I think you're all INSANE! / But I guess I am too... / Anybody would be if they were stuck on Earth with you. ♫
Hahaha, yes!

column6: Time goes on as Steven and the Gems continue working together on the drill, as everyone joins in the song.

column4: ♫ Life and death and love and birth and- ♫
♫ Life and death and love and birth and- ♫
♫ Life and death and love and birth and, / Peace and war on the planet Earth. ♫
♫ Is there anything that's worth more? ♫
♫ Is there anything that's worth more? ♫
♫ Is there anything that's worth more? / Than peace and love on the planet Earth... ♫

column6: Steven and the Gems all gaze at the drill in awe.

column4: Nice work.

We?

She's come so far. It feels like yesterday she was trying to kill us.

Coordinates! We still need the Cluster's exact coordinates in order to drill!

The mooooooon!

Lion! Can you make us a special super warp to the moon?

column4: Pretty cool, right?

Ahhh, lame.

So how do you turn it on?
... I have no idea.

YOU CAN"T SIT THERE!!

That chair is only for the most elite Gems, you can't go around sitting where an elite would sit.

column6: Peridot maneuvers the chair closer to the control panel.

column4: There we go. This is a really old system.

Uhh... thanks?
But where is the Cluster now?

Hang on... there it is! It's embedded deep into the mantle, relative to the barn its roughly two thousand five hundred units down. All we need to do is feed this data to the drill and we should be all set.
That's it then, mission accomplished!
Yeah, team!
Great. Let's get the heck out of here.
Wait! Hold on, does this thing have any games on it?
No no no no, this wasn't used for "games".
Aw.
It was used for planning a colony. Here, look.

column6: Peridot pulls on a map of Earth on the screen, and the Gems pause to look back at it.

column4: So here is a map of all structures that were originally built on Earth. All told, this probably only accounts for maybe, five percent of what was originally planned.
What was the plan?
Well, let's take a look.

column6: A hologram of Earth is projected. The Crystal Gems watch in horror as the Earth hologram hollows out, forming rings around it and Gem structures all over it.

column4: Ta-da! A finished Earth colony. Wow, look at this! Eighty-nine kindergartens, sixty-seven spires, a Galaxy Warp in each facet, efficient use of all available materials. What were you thinking, shutting this operation down? It could've been great!
No! You're wrong!
What do you mean? It's perfect, look at it.
We are looking at it.
Yeah, this plan stinks!
Completing this colony would have meant the extinction of all life on Earth!
But think of the good it would have done. The Gems that would have been made, our Empire expanded.
Rose Quartz believed all life was precious, and worth protecting.

Well if she wanted to protect it, she did a lousy job! There'd be no Cluster if the Earth had stayed a colony. Now there's no colony, and there's gonna be no Earth, so thank you, Rose Quartz! You doomed the planet!

column6: Garnet, Amethyst, and Pearl each look at Peridot furiously.

column4: ♫ Is there anything that's worth more th-

column6: Garnet grabs and lifts Peridot up by her tunic.

column4: You, listen to me, now.  You are talking about things that you do not understand.
Garnet, stop! Please! It's not worth it. We're done here, let's just... go home.

column6: Garnet drops Peridot on the chair and smashes the control panel with her gauntlet, dissipating the hologram. The Gems then walk off, irritated, and Steven sighs in dismay.

column4: What did I say? I'm just stating a fact. The Rebellion didn't really save Earth, it just delayed the inevitable.
That's not the way they see it. They've spent thousand of years trying to protect the Earth. I thought maybe, you finally understood why.

column6: Steven walks down the steps, as Peridot begins looking around in caution.

column4: Peridot!
What? I'm coming.

column6: Steven glances at Peridot and notices she is holding the prism from the chair behind her back.

column4: Let's go, you two.

column6: Steven looks in the direction of Peridot and frowns.
The Crystal Gems are gathered around the drill they recently completed, while Peridot is nowhere to be found.

column4: How much longer 'till we can use the drill?
Well, with the new coordinates we got from the moon base, it should be ready to go. But we really should perform a few tests first.

column6: Steven watches as he sees Peridot sneaking into the barn and follows her. Peridot fumbles with the prism she retrieved from the Moon Base in "It Could've Been Great". She quickly hides it behind her back when she sees Steven.

column4: Oh! Steven.
Peridot, I need to talk to you.
Uhhh, yeah! Sure!

column6: Steven and Peridot enter the truck that is parked inside the barn

column4: Why are we in this broken-down vehicle?

column6: Steven continues to observe the prism Peridot is hiding.

column4: I wanted to ask you...about the Diamonds?
Oh! I don't know what the others have told you, but there's a reason they're in charge.
Why's that?

They're objectively better than us. Every Gem has their strengths and weaknesses, but not them. They're absolutely totally completely flawless beings! Especially my diamond, Yellow Diamond, the most perfect, the most reasonable, rational, efficient decider ever to exist in the universe!
You're really loyal to her, aren't you?
How could I not be? We might have our little truce, but I'll never forsake the Gem I was made for!
That's good, because... she's right behind you!
WHAT?

column6: Peridot turns around and Steven snatches the prism from her. He then exits the truck and locks Peridot inside.

column4: Ahh, no! Ahh!
Save your strength! You're up against one of the earth's greatest trapping technologies: the child safety lock!
Oh, no! How could you do this to me, the great and lovable Peridot?! I thought we were finally friends like you wanted...
I saw you sneak this off the moon base while nobody else was looking!  What is it? Tell me!
It's nothing special. And definitely not important at all.

column3: ['picks up a hammer lying on the floor']
column4: Hmm!  Then why don't I just smash it!
Nonononono, wait! All right, look. I have a plan. Allow me to explain... It's... a communicator. Meant for the express purpose of contacting the Diamonds back on Homeworld.
You're still trying to contact Homeworld?

Yes, of course! I figured it out. You simple clods keep trying to protect the earth, but you can't do anything right! I let myself get carried away, too... laughing, singing, building our little machine... but don't you see? None of that matters! All that matters is that I'm of use to Yellow Diamond! This planet can be of use to Yellow Diamond! I must contact her, to reveal what I've discovered!
But the Diamonds are bad! They don't care about the earth! They wanted to hollow it out, and now they wanna blow it up with the Cluster!
Yes, yes! That's the point!
Why do I keep sticking my neck out for you? You're never gonna be on our side! Garnet! Amethyst! Pearl!
Steven, no! Don't get them. Steven! Release me!

column6: Steven shuts the barn door, leaving Peridot behind.
Steven shows the communicator to the Gems, and they gasp in shock.

column4: She took a direct line to the Diamonds!  From the moon base? What was she thinking?

Man, after everything we've gone through, she's still  out to get us! Ohh, I'm takin' back all my cool nicknames for her! So long, Peri and P-dot, hello... Ahhh, I'm too mad! I'll think of something later.

column6: Car horn honking is then heard from inside the barn.

column4: I see she knows what a horn is now.
You offered her a lot of your trust.
I did! And it blew up in my face. You guys have been protecting Earth for thousands of years. She could've destroyed all of that. A whole Earth, why did I think I could change her mind?
Ugh, I know right? But I guess you can't like go into peoples' heads and change how they think. Maybe we can? Yeaaah, if we just shrink down really little-
No no no, I don't want to tell her what to do. She should just know. Shouldn't she?
It's 'cause you believe in everyone Steven. Like your mother, you seem to have a little more patience than the rest of us. But the truth is, not everyone deserves that patience.
Look on the bright side. At least you got this thing away from her before she did any real damage.
... Yeah.

column6: Suddenly, one side of the barn explodes.

column4: Ah!
OHHH NOOOOO!!!!

column6: The Crystal Gems see Peridot bursting out of the barn in her robot from "Back to the Barn".

column4: Free!! FREEEEE!!! AHAHAHA!
How did she escape?!

column6: Peridot throws the truck door in front of the Crystal Gems.

column4: Ah!
Fools! Your invisible rotary shield was no match for me... once I applied logic!

column6: Steven groans in frustration as the Gems charge towards Peridot.

column4: Now I'm going to do this right!

column6: The Crystal Gems dodge out of the way from the truck. Pearl and Amethyst keep ahold of the communicator, but Peridot snatches it from them.

column4: See? None of you know what you doing!
Ohh okay! I've been ready for this!  Get in.

column6: Pearl and Garnet smile at each other and climb inside Amethyst.

column4: Where's Steven?
Stupid Peridot, stupid giant robot! Oh why, oh why did I have to encourage her?

column6: Amethyst begins to take off.

column4: That's right. You can feel horrible all you want back at the temple.

column6: Amethyst flies off and chases Peridot, as she tries to operate the communicator with her robot's claws.

column4: What's up, Perisnot?!

column4: Ohh...

column4: DOG PILE!

column6: The Gems begin smashing the Peribot as Peridot slips away through the arm of the robot to retrieve the communicator. Only Steven notices Peridot and runs after her.

column4: You're not getting away with it!  I TRUSTED YOU! I spend all that time bonding and hoping and caring about you!
You don't get it either! This is your whole prooobleeem! Your emotions rule out reason! I will do what has to be done!

column3: ['backs off as the communicator turns yellow']
column4: Ahh!

column3: ['snickers', 'releases the communicator as it floats in front of her']
column4: She'll sort this out!

column6: Garnet grabs Steven and the Crystal Gems quickly take cover behind the damaged Peribot. A chime is heard as the communicator opens up a screen. Peridot gets manically excited.

column4: This is the Yellow Diamond control room.
Is that another Pearl?
Who is she?
Ugh, not all Pearls know each other, Steven.
Who authorized you to make this call?
No one, b-but it's an emergency!
That's no excuse to use the direct Diamond communication channel.
Pearl.
Yes, my Diamond?
Why is there someone on the Diamond line?
I don't know. I was just about to tell her that-
I'll take it from here.

column6: Yellow Diamond brings the screen up to her eye level, revealing herself for the first time, and the Crystal Gems gasp in shock.

column4: Is that-
Yellow-
Diamond!
My Diamond! Peridot, reporting in.

column3: ['busy typing away on her control panel']
column4: Which Peridot?
F-Facet 2-F-5-L, Cut 5-X-G. I'm sorry to contact you this way, but all other forms of communication have been destroyed and-

column4: This says you're behind schedule on your mission to...

column4: How is... the Earth?
It's... full of... life.
Organic life... And where is the Jasper I assigned you? And why aren't you calling from the ship?
Oh um... The ship was destroyed.

column4: Increasing speed!

column6: The drill then quickly dive into the ground, digging deeply as it traverses.

column4: Alright. Bracing for impact.

column6: Peridot turns on some elevator music.

column4: Uh, thanks.

column6: Steven and Peridot remain silent as the drill continues to dig further downwards. Steven's eyes are filled with anguish as he watches the layers of rock pass by. He shuts his eyes tightly, shakes his head and begins talking to Peridot as a distraction.

column4: It's kinda... freaky down here, huh?
Why's that?

Peridot...ite?
Yeah. It's made of the same stuff as Peridots.
You were made on Homeworld, right?
Mmhmm.

I didn't exist. Then I did. I don't have memories of it, just feelings. I know I can never go back to Homeworld, but it's hard. Not to have some feelings for where you came from.

column4: But it's fine!  I have something different now.
What's that?
You know! You... guys.

column4: What's that sound?

They must've buried some prototypes with the Cluster.

column6: More banging is heard outside the compartment.

column4: They're all over us! They're attacking the drill! What do we do?

column6: Peridot presses a button on the panel and a weaponized CCTV camera pops out from atop the cockpit, knocking a Gem mutant away.

column3: ["hands a controller, akin to the Nintendo 64's, to Steven"]

column6: A Gem mutant arm, climbing atop the drill, loosens its grip and falls off into the magma.

column4: C'mon! We've gotta help them.

There is no helping them. They're too broken. The beings who used to be in those shards are so shattered, they don't know who they are, or what's happening around them. They just seek out other gems, looking for the missing pieces of themselves. Trying to make themselves whole.

column6: A red Gem mutant hand tries to reach out to the camera, and Steven blasts it away.

The Cluster.

column4: What's happening?

column4: It's too late! It's taking form!

Affirmative. Activating triple tip penetration mode!

Need FORM!!!!!
Agh!
To be whole.
Whole?

column6: Steven, the Pizza kids and the Fryman kids gather back in Steven's house. A heartbroken Ronaldo walks around while texting on his phone while the others mope in the living room.

column4: Ugh, what are we gonna do?!
Hmm... Peedee said the last time the war ended because your dad and his dad came together to sign a treaty. How did that happen?
Well, you know where Suitcase Sam's is? It used to be a restaurant called "The Everything Buffet".
Oh, yeah! They sold everything!
But it wrecked the boardwalk's economy! Not one store could compete. But just when everyone thought all hope was lost, our dad and Mr. Fryman teamed up and ran them out of town.
Hmm. Another restaurant eh? I think I have a plan.

column5: Title Card - Restaurant War: Operation: Let's Get Cooking

column6: The Pizza family and the Fryman family are waiting outside of Steven's house, which has been rebranded as a cardboard sign reading "Steven's". Steven, wearing a waiter uniform, opens the door and steps out.

column4: Welcome to the Grand opening of Steven's. Right this way.

column6: Steven leads the two families into the house, redecorated into a restaurant with star-shaped light bulbs and candle-lit tables, when Garnet watches on in the kitchen. Mr. Fryman removes his cap as a sign of respect and manners.

column4: Hmm. Nice ambiance.
Ahem!  It's all right.
There are not enough tables!
There are just enough tables, daddy.

column6: The Frymans take their seats at the closest table, while the Pizzas take their seats at the only other table in the room. Mr. Fryman and Kofi glare at each other when Pearl, dressed up as a waiter too, approaches the Frymans.

column4: Hello, gentlemen. May I take your order?

column3: ['slams his head down on the table and begins sobbing uncontrollably']
column4: I'm full... of sadness!
I will have the Fantastic Fries.

column3: ["writes on her notepad and walks to the Pizzas' table"]
column4: Order taken.
I bet they're not as fantastic as ours.
And for you?
I will have the Pizza Bagel! (Pearl walks away.) I doubt a pizza bagel can beat pizza that isn't on a bagel.

column6: Pearl hands Steven the orders.

column4: Ah, let's see. Wonderful, two of our best dishes!
Our only dishes?
Amethyst, order up! Fire one fry and one pizza!
Yes, chef!

column6: Steven and Amethyst begin preparing the meals together.

column3: ['sets a plate of pizza bagels in front of Kofi']
column4: Here's your order, sir.
Heh, pizza on a bagel, indeed!

column3: ['sets a plate of neatly-arranged fries in front of Mr. Fryman']
column4: And for you, sir.
Uh, can I get some ketchup?
Sorry, no additions or substitutions.

column3: ['eats a fry and is suddenly stricken with disbelief']
column4: Ha! This place is all talk! You can't have fries without ketchup.  The ketchup... is inside the fries!?

column6: Steven smirks, realizing that he has bested Fryman. Kofi drops his pizza bagel in disbelief too, after taking a bite into it.

column4: There's cream cheese in this pizza bagel. It adds a whole other level of flavor! And with pizza on a bagel, you can eat pizza any time!
It's amazing!
It's genius!

column6: Mr. Fryman and Kofi look at each other and nod in agreement. The two then angrily approach Steven.

column4: Ah, gentlemen, I hope you enjoyed your meal. Is there something I can help you with?
Steven!  We didn't want to have to do this, but...
Please, shut this place down!
What's this? You want me to close my lovely establishment?
Steven, we're begging you!
We can't compete with a place like this!
You'll drive us out of business!
There's already a line!

column6: Kofi points at the door, where Onion is seen standing outside, fork in hand.

column4: I'll close up shop, under one condition.
Anything!
Stop this foolish war! Cook for yourselves and the good of the boardwalk! No more cooking out of hate and spite.

column6: Mr. Fryman and Kofi look at each other and smile.

column4: Let's just do, what we do best!
Agreed!

column6: Mr. Fryman and Kofi hug each other.

column3: ['cheer and walk up to their fathers']
column4: Yeah!
Good job, daddy.
Do you hear that, Ronaldo? The war's over!

column6: Ronaldo, still crying face-down on the table, gives a thumbs up.

column3: ['turns to the Gems in the kitchen']
column4: Glad that's settled.  Y'all help me clean this place up.
Sorry. We on break.

column6: The star iris closes on Garnet, who then claps twice, ending the episode.
Steven is setting up the table in the living room, in preparation for a seemingly fancy dinner.

column3: ['sets a fork down next to another fork', 'pours orange juice into a wine glass and sips it', 'turns on a fake candle', 'slams a vase with two roses on the table']
column4: Two forks, it's fancy.  Mm-hmm.  Some mood lighting.  Some classy decor. There! Mwah!

column6: Steven does a chef kiss and admires his table setup.

column3: ['hears knocking at the door and gasps in excitement']
column4: This is so nice!  Pizza time!

column6: Steven runs to the door and opens it, finding Kiki standing outside, sweating and holding several pizzas.

column4: Kiki!
Hey, Steven! Cheddar cheese crust with double pepperoni?
Oh, thanks! (Kiki hands him his pizza.) But doesn't Jenny usually do deliveries?
I had to take double duty today because Jenny busted the pizza car.
What?!
Yeah. Who knew blasting one of Sour Cream's mix tapes could blow out the tires?
Well, his drops are pretty dirty.
Guess so. Anyways, it means I've gotta deliver all these orders by foot while Jenny takes the car to the shop.  Oh? Looks fancy! You having anybody cute over, Steven?

column3: ['glances amorously at Kiki and chuckles nervously']
column4: You mean, besides... me?  I'm taking some "me" time. You want in?

column3: ['turns slightly distressed', 'smiles again', 'picks up more pizza and runs off']
column4: Thanks, Steven, but I still have to run around town and deliver all these pizzas.  There's a lot of other people having "me" time tonight.  But it's alright. I love running. Anyways, Gotta get back to it! Later, Steven!

column3: ['walks on the pouch and waves goodbye to Kiki']
column4: See ya!

column6: Kiki pants as she runs off into town.

column4: Poor Kiki.  Pizza time! Whoo!

column6: Steven is fast asleep on the couch after indulging himself with his pizza, and making a mess of the table.
Steven begins dreaming that he is flying through the sky with rocket flip-flops.

column4: Yeah, whoo! Oh! Oh! Oh!  Whoo-hoo!

column6: Steven draws his own initials "SU" in the sky in smokes from his rockets, and puts on a pair of sunglasses.

column4: Those initials are looking pretty slick, Steven. Whoa!

column6: Steven takes off his sunglasses and finds himself flying over a land of pizza.

column4: Cool! A pizza dream! Hey, look!

column6: Steven flies down and sees a reflection of him on the shiny cheese surface.

column3: ['dunks his hand into the cheese and laughs']
column4: It's cheese me!  Oh, gross!

column6: A hand suddenly emerges from the cheese and grabs onto Steven's arm.

column4: Ew, ew!

column6: Steven tries to fly away, unintentionally pulling the hand out of the cheese, revealing to be Kiki, coughing and gasping for air.

column4: Kiki?!  Are you all right?

column6: An arm made of cheese suddenly grabs onto Kiki's leg.

column4: My leg!

column6: Another cheese arm then emerges from the cheese. Steven screams and tugs harder with his rocket flip-flops. successfully pulling Kiki away from the cheese arm's grip.

column4: What was that thing?!
Keep going! It won't give up!
Wha?!

column6: The cheese arms extend and try to grab Steven and Kiki, as they try to fly away. Steven then lands Kiki safely on a pepperoni.

column4: I'll take care of this!
Steven, be careful!
Don't worry about me! Anything is possible when you have... rockets for bones!

column6: Steven shoots two rockets from his elbows and destroys the cheese arms.

column4: Steven, that was so brave!
Well, it's cheddar than nothing

column6: Dogcopter emerges from the ground and picks up Steven.

column4: Oh, hey, Dogcopter.
Meow.
See ya, dream Kiki!
Oh, okay. See you, dream Steven!
Dream Steven!

column6: Steven rides atop Dopcopter and they both speed off into the sky.

column5: Trans. Ext. Fish Stew Pizza, The Next Day

column6: Steven, now awake, strolls along the streets towards the back alley of Fish Stew Pizza.

column4: Man, I can't wait to tell Kiki about my weird- (Steven arrives and finds Jenny begging to Kiki outside the pizzeria.)
Please, Kiki, just one more time? I seriously can't miss this show. It's Uber Rage's first concert back in the States since they got banned!
Jenny, I'm not sure. I've covered for you for almost two weeks now!
Kiki, seriously, this concert is gonna change my life! And the ticket was, like, $40!
Is that a lot for a concert?
It's... more than average?
Okay, I'll cover you.
Yes!  That's why you're my favorite twin!
I'm your only twin.

column3: ['gets in her car and starts it up', 'drives off']
column4: Mwah! I'll get you a shirt or something.  Hey, Steven! Oh, and don't tell Dad!
That was really nice of you!
Yep, that's me: the nice one.

I came here to tell you I had the craziest dream about you last night, Kiki! I was flying around, and I pulled you out of an ocean of cheese! (Kiki listens with shock.) And then these hands formed and came after you-
And then you saved me and flew off on a rocket dog!?
"Dream Kiki" was you!?
"Dream Steven" was you!?
I'm-I'm so sorry! I didn't mean to go into your mind, I-
No, this is great!
You're not mad?
Steven, I always have that dream, and I always drown! I haven't gotten a good night's sleep in weeks! You're my total hero, Steven, can you do it again?
Oh! Of course! I'd really love to help!

column3: ['hears the phone ringing inside the pizzeria']
column4: Thank goodness! Because... I seriously have that dream, like, every single night.  Oh, I got to go! Seriously, Steven, thank you so much! See you later!
In your dreams!
Ha ha! Nice!

column6: Steven goes to bed wearing a bandanna, with a determined look on his face.

column4: I'm a dream warrior!

column6: Steven falls asleep and enters Kiki's nightmare once again.

column4: Hey, Kiki! It's time to cut the cheese! Hyah!

column6: Steven summons a giant pizza cutter and hurls it at the cheese monster, slicing it in half.

column4: Wow!

column6: The next day, a refreshed Kiki greets Steven outside Fish Stew Pizza, giving him a high-five, and at night, Steven prepares to be Kiki's dream warrior again.

column4: Dream warrior! Dream warrior!  Prepare yourself...for my grate-est technique yet! Hyah!

column6: Steven summons a giant cheese grater and attacks the cheese monster.

column4: Whoa!

column6: Next day, Kiki hangs out with Steven inside the pizzeria, when Jenny begs Kiki to cover for her again. At night, an increasingly tired Steven goes to sleep.

column4: Dream warrior. Dream warrior... Dream warrior...
Here I come.  Hey, Kiki.

column6: Steven starts biting on the cheese monster's hand, much to Kiki's confusion.
Steven, with visible eye bags, snores and grunts as he slowly wakes up lying on the edge of his bed.

column4: Huh?
Steven?

column3: ['notices Kiki standing next to his bed']
column4: Kiki?
You're upside down! Did you sleep okay?
Yeah, like a baby. What's happening?

column3: ['holds out a box of pizza to Steven']
column4: Here.
Pizza? For breakfast?
... It's 3 o'clock.

column3: ['takes a pizza slice and bites into it']
column4: Oh. More of a late-afternoon lunch.  Delicious.

column6: Steven dozes back to sleep again and falls off the bed.

column4: AH!  Steven?
Kiki, you got to quit your job!
What?
I think you have a serious problem with pizza.
I don't have a problem with pizza.
I don't know, Kiki. I think you do! (Kiki stares at Steven, startled.) I'm sorry. I- I didn't mean to yell.
No, it's okay. I get it. I've been asking too much of you. I just wish these dreams would stop.
Maybe we've been going about this all wrong.
What do you mean?
Hmm. We've just been looking at the toppings of the problem. We've got to track this back to the sauce! But after this, I can't help you anymore, okay? I'm just too tired.
I understand.
All right. Tonight, we end these nightmares once and for all!

column6: Steven snores in his sleep, as he enters Kiki's nightmare for a final time. He lands next Kiki in the dreamscape and they exchange determined looks.

column4: You ready, Steven?
Time to cut the cheese. Shing!  Sorry for using the same pun twice.
That's not a pun, but I forgive you!

column6: Steven and Kiki gasp as the cheese monster approaches them. They both begin fighting in confidence, slicing the cheese with their pizza cutters, until they realize its speedy regeneration.

column4: Huh?
We can't keep fighting off the cheese. It just won't stop!
You're right! We got to find out where all this cheese is coming from!
Oh!

column6: The cheese arms engulf Steven and Kiki and begin to drown them underneath, but Steven manages to burst out with his rocket flip-flops just in time. With Kiki on his back, Steven flies through the sky.

column4: Look!
Huh?

column6: Steven and Kiki encounter a giant head of Kiki, made entirely out of melted cheese.

column4: Whoa!
It's me? Now, that is nasty.

column6: Steven and Kiki enter the head through a hole and travel through a tunnel on a river of cheese. Several pizza-themed lifeforms begin to attack Steven and Kiki from the cheese river.

column4: Aah! Anchovies! And Pepperanhas!

column6: Steven flies higher, avoiding the lifeforms.

column4: Ahh. That was close!  Who's that?!
They sound like they're in pain! We got to find them!

column6: Steven and Kiki enter a room with a large pond of cheese and lands in front of it. They stare at it when a pizza version of Jenny emerges from the cheese pond.

column4: Jenny?
Kiki!
I'm here, Jenny! Oh!

column6: Kiki reaches out to grab Pizza Jenny's hand, and cheese begin engulfing her arms.

column4: Oh, no! I'll help you, Kiki!
Wait, I think she's trying to tell me something!
Kiki...
What is it, Jenny?
Thanks for delivering all those pizzas for me.
Oh, it's okay. I totally don't mind. That's what twins are for. Whoa!

column6: A strand of cheese emerges from the cheese pond and wraps around Kiki. Kiki grunts and struggles as it attempts to drag her into the cheese pond.

column4: Kiki, you're lying!
What?
You totally do mind!
Aaagh, it doesn't matter!
Yes, it does!
Your feelings matter. Just tell her "no".
Ugh, I- I can't!
Why not?
I... I don't want to let her down! I'm her favorite twin!
When I said I couldn't help you anymore after this, you understood!
But this is different. She's my sister!

column6: More cheese begin engulfing Kiki's body.

column4: That's right! And she cares about you, too! Do you think she'd want to put you through this?
No.
Does she even know this is happening to you?
No!
You got to tell her!
Hey, Kiki, I want to ask you something. There's gonna be a really cool cheese rave in the pizza cave tonight. I have to be there. Will you cover for me again?

column6: The cheese start retracting from Kiki's body back into the pond and Pizza Jenny lets go of her hands.

column4: Okay, fine.

column6: Pizza Jenny begins melting into the pond, as the land of pizza all around Steven and Kiki melts away too. The dreamscape slowly changes into a beach shore at night, with pizza pillars in the distance.

column4: You did it!
Yeah! All the cheese is gone!  Well, most of it.

column6: Steven and Kiki sit down on the shore and take in the beautiful view.

column4: Man, dreams are weird.
Yeah.  They sure are.

column6: Kiki stares at Steven as Pepperanhas chomp on him.

column5: Trans. Ext. Fish Stew Pizza, The Next Day

column6: Steven walks up to the pizzeria and finds Jenny sweeping the floor and opening the restaurant for the day.

column4: Hi, Jenny.
Oh, hey, Steven.
Is Kiki around? I wanted to see if she's doing okay.  I just spent all night helping her fight her inner cheese demons.

I don't know what that means, but Kiki is fine. She's taking the day off. This morning, we had a twin talk. She said I was using up all her "me" time, and I was like, if you're just gonna spend your "me" time running anyway, you might as well carry some pizzas for me. But I can't say no to my favorite twin.
So where is she?

column6: Steven and Jenny turn and see Kiki on the beach, jogging and enjoying herself. Steven sighs deeply in relief.

column4: She deserves a break after working so hard for me. Right, Steven?

column6: Jenny turns to Steven and notices that he has dozed off, snoring while standing upright.

column4: Steven?

column6: Jenny pokes Steven with her broom to try to get a response, to no success. The star iris then closes onto Steven's face, ending the episode.

column5: Open. Int. Beach House, Steven's Room

column6: Steven is in his bedroom inspecting one of his teddy bears.

column3: ["reveals a tear underneath the bear's armpit"]
column4: Oh no! MC Bear-Bear, you've got a tear-tear!  I should have been more careful. We've lost too many good bears. Don't worry. You're hurt, but I'll look after you. Mwah!

column6: Steven kisses MC Bear-Bear and gasps, as the tear magically mends itself back together.

column4: Guys? Guys?!

column6: Steven runs down from his bedroom to meet the Gems in the kitchen.

column4: What's up, little Ste-cup?
We were just about to put away the dishes.
Look what I can do!

column6: Steven smashes the plate on the ground, to Pearl's shock and Amethyst's approval.

column4: All right! It's a Ste-party!
What is the meaning of this?!
My healing spit is back! I fixed a rip on MC Bear-Bear! Here, I'll show you!

column6: Steven licks his hand, preparing to "heal" the party, but Pearl quickly halts him.

column4: Fine, fine, I believe you. I don't want you touching a broken plate. I'll find a broom.
I'll find some other stuff to break!
No, Amethyst!
Now that my healing spit is back... maybe I can finally-
No.
What? But, I didn't even ask anything yet.
With my future vision, I can see you're going to ask if you could use your power to heal one of the monsters in the bubble room.
Can you see if I can get you to change your mind?

column6: Steven puts his hands in a begging motion and eventually wins Garnet over.
The Gems accompany Steven into the Burning Room.

column4: Why did you agree to this?
I lost a battle of will.
Here it is!

column6: Steven jumps up and grabs a bubbled gem.

column4: Gotcha!
Is that...
It's Centipeetle. If I can help any of them, I want to help her first.

column6: Amethyst summons her whip and reels in a bubbled Chaaaaps to her.

column4: Don't forget these!
Chaaaaps! They're her favorite! Okay. You guys ready?

column6: Garnet nods while Amethyst and Pearl brace themselves. Steven pops the bubble and the Centipeetle begins to regenerate.

column4: Come on dude, do your thing!
Be careful!

column6: While Centipeedle is regenerating, Steven licks his hand and slaps it on her gem, causing a bright light to engulf the place. The gem is healed, turning Centipeedle back in Nephrite, with humanoid arms and legs. The Gems gasp in surprise.

column4: Is it working?

column6: Nephrite turns around, revealing she is still semi-corrupted, and screeches loudly at the Crystal Gems.

column4: ... It worked!

column6: Steven takes the bubbled Chaaaaps from Amethyst and walks up to Nephrite.

column4: Uh, Steven?

column6: Nephrite falls onto the floor in her confusion.

column4: Centi, you're back!

column6: Nephrite hisses at Steven.

column4: Whoa! What's the matter? Don't you want some Chaaaaps?

column6: Nephrite angrily squawks at Steven.

column4: I don't think she remembers them.

column3: ['pushes the bubbled Chaaaaps bubble back into the air']
column4: Forget the Chaaaaps.  You remember me, don't you?

column6: Nephrite tilts her head, staring at Steven in confusion.

column4: I have a bad feeling this didn't work how I wanted it to work.
Hmm, possibly not. Oh! Don't go closer!
Maybe she just needs a little extra love!

column6: Steven walks up to Nephrite and kisses her gem, causing Nephrite to cover her gem, back away, and squawk in pain.

column4: Uh, oops.
Hmm. This is the best we've ever seen it work.
But it didn't work. I guess it'll take more than a kiss to heal damage from the Diamonds.
But why? My healing powers are back. I-I should be able to do this.
It's alright Steven. Remember, she's not cracked, she's corrupted, and that's something different, something nearly... impossible to describe.
It's sort of like if MC Bear-Bear didn't tear the fabric of his arm, but the fabric of his mind.
Sounds pretty explained to me!
Hmm.
Steven, I'm impressed with your ability to bring the Centipeetle this far, but it's time to let her rest again. Amethyst...
Uh, sure.  I'll poof her.

column6: Nephrite is seen looking at her own reflection and squawking at it in one of the Crystal Heart's veins, as Amethyst starts approaching her.

column4: But! She's not a monster anymore!

column3: ['turns Steven around and presses his face in her chest']
column4: Here.  You don't have to watch.

column3: ['pushes himself away from Garnet', 'runs in front of Nephrite']
column4: No, please!  She can walk, and talk! Just like you guys!

column6: Nephrite squawks friendly at Steven.

column4: See?

column6: The Gems are slightly convinced.

column4: I helped her this much, maybe I can help her more. I have to try, I made a promise!

column6: The Gems look at each other uneasy.

column4: Pleeeeeeease?
What are we going to do with her? Let her move in?
Aw yeah! Corrupted roommate!
Oh Amethyst, be sensitive.
She can even stay in my room!
Uh, we're... really doing this?
She can stay un-bubbled. But you have to understand. Some Gems are beyond our help.

column6: Nephrite is seen sitting on the couch, and Steven walks up to her.

column4: Okay, Centi. Oh, I guess that's not really your name. What is your name?

column6: Nephrite speaks in a series of squawks.

column4: Gurgle click-click? Oh, right. Can't talk, huh? You really don't remember me? You don't remember saving me from that seagull or our adventures in the ice caves, or when I electrocuted you with- Uh, actually, do forget that one.

column6: Nephrite tilts her head, confused.

column4: You even forgot Chaaaaps.

column6: Steven opens the bag of Chaaaaps on the table. Nephrite begins drooling in reaction.

column4: I love Chips...

column6: Nephrite sings "I love Chips" distortedly in squawks.

column4: Do... do you remember me singing the Chaaaaps jingle?

column6: Nephrite takes the chip out of Steven's hand and eats it. She then squawks happily in response.

column4: You love chips, and I love chips! We love chips from Chaaaaps!

column6: Nephrite takes the Chaaaaps bag and begins eating out of it.

column4: Your memories are still in there! I just have to draw them out! Oh! I know how we can talk, even if your voice is messed up!

column6: Steven runs off and returns with papers and crayons. Nephrite tilts her head confused.

column4: See, this is an Earth crayon! I-I bet you Gems are used to super-advanced space crayons, but we make do.  Look, Ste...ven. That's me! Can you do that?

column6: Nephrite nods and squawks, as she begins drawing on the paper.

column4: Ah, Steven, you're a genius!

column6: Nephrite squawks and shows Steven her drawing, seemingly to just be a bunch of illiterate scribbles to Steven.

column4: Okay, maybe not. (Nephrite is unimpressed.) That's alright. I have another plan! We'll just talk through the language of art!

column6: Steven draws and shows Nephrite a drawing of himself. Nephrite takes Steven's paper and begins drawing on it.

column4: What are you adding?

column6: Nephrite shows Steven the paper, revealing that she had drawn herself holding Steven's hand.

column4: You remember we were buds!

column6: Nephrite squawks happily, which sounds like a "Yeah!".

column4: Do you remember anything from before yo- I-I mean, from long ago?

column6: Nephrite thinks for a bit, squawks and starts drawing. She then shows Steven her drawing.

column4: It's you in... some kind of spaceship? Is that how you came to Earth?

column6: Nephrite adds on to her drawing.

column4: What are you drawing now?

column6: Nephrite shows the paper again, showing a few other Nephrites beside her.

column4: Huh. They look kind of like you. Was that... your crew?

column6: Nephrite squawks in approval.

column4: You were a captain? That's so cool! I'm sorry, that's so cool, sir!  Oh, yeah, you guys don't salute like that. You go like... Mm.

column6: Steven tries to do the Diamond salute unsuccessfully.

column4: Ow, ow! Oh, this looked so easy when Peridot did it.

column6: Nephrite does the correct Diamond salute.

column4: Yeah! Like that!

column6: Nephrite does the salute repeatedly, squawks in realization, and continues drawing. Steven then tries to interpret her drawings sequentially.

column4: It's you... saluting... You're saluting someone... Your commander? She gave you an order... You and your crew... and your ship. Woah, lots of ships. You flew through space. Towards Earth. You landed and started building stuff. But then... the Gem war...! You joined the fight...

column6: Nephrite starts striking out figures on her drawing in fury, while a horrified Steven watches on.

column4: You and your crew kept going.

column6: Nephrite rips the drawing of her away from her crew.

column4: You got separated, but you were still fighting. Then, new orders from your commander... to retreat. Everyone's running, but from what? You don't know. Where's your crew? Where's your ship?! You stopped. You heard something. From the sky, a sound. A song? And then...

column6: Water droplets suddenly drip onto the paper, after Nephrite colored the whole paper in white crayon.

column4: Centi?

column6: Nephrite starts crying out of sadness and breaks a crayon in her hand in half.

column4: That light. Where did it come from?

column6: Nephrite, sobbing, draws The Great Diamond Authority symbol on the white-out drawing.

column4: Damage from the Diamonds.

column6: Nephrite then starts coughing spits out some acids onto the floor.

column4: Are you okay?!

column6: Nephrite collapses onto the floor, and her left arm begins to mutate back to its corrupted form.

column4: You're reverting. Here, I'll heal you again!

column6: Steven licks his hand and touches Nephrite's gem. Nephrite's arm glitches a bit, but it remains corrupted.

column4: Why isn't it working?! How can I help you!?

column6: Nephrite shows Steven the drawing of the Diamond symbol.

column4: I don't understand!

column6: Nephrite squawks agitatedly at Steven and runs up to the Warp Pad. She starts hitting it in an attempt to activate it.

column4: It's not working 'cause your corrupted. Where do you want to go?  The battlefield? Your ship?

column6: Nephrite squawks in response.

column4: Is there something on the ship that can help you?

column6: Nephrite screams and slams her fists on the warp pad

column4: Just hold on.  I'll get you there.

column5: Trans. Ancient Gem Colony Ship, Sunset

column6: Steven warps him and Nephrite to the abandoned Gem ship. Nephrite squawks and starts running off.

column4: Hey! Wait for Steven!

column6: Nephrite runs through the jungle, squawking loudly as if calling out to someone. Suddenly, she grabs her head in pain, as she reverts more into her corrupted form. Steven eventually catches up.

column4: Oh no.  Where are you trying to get to?!

And Gems never hear they can be anything other than what they are, but Rose opened our eyes.

...Son.
Right. You are different. That's what's so exciting. You don't have to be like Rose Quartz. You can be someone even better. You can be you. And you know what? You deserve an even better weapon.

Um, uhh...

column3: ["grabs Steven's shirt and lifts him up"]

column6: Steven quickly creates his bubble shield and escapes from Bismuth's grasp.

column4: Wait, Bismuth! This is just a big misunderstanding!

column6: Steven collapses into a sitting position behind the bushes, crying profusely from his eyes.

column4: Whoa, buddy!
My dreams... I was seeing through her eyes! I've been crying her tears!
What are you doing over there?

column6: Steven and Greg flinch in shock, as the accompanying person, revealing to be a blue Pearl, walks over to inspect.

column4: I thought I heard someone.
Don't worry, I'll handle this.
I think we're not alone.

column6: Greg pops up from behind the bush, startling Blue Pearl.

column4: Hey! Uh... nice day out, huh? Uh, I didn't see you there. What's uh, what's... up?
Pearl?
My Diamond, I've found a native.
Oh yeah, I'm from here alright.  Annyeonghaseyo, Your... Highness.
Bring it here.

column6: Blue Pearl and Greg both walk over to the hooded figure.

column4: Dad, no!

How curious. I'm impressed by humanity's ability to survive in the wild. What a strange planet. Where else would a being as fragile as a human live, while a being as powerful as a Diamond, perish? This is where it happened, where she was... broken.
Were you close?
Very.
I-I'm awfully sorry. I know how hard it is to move on when you've lost someone.

column6: The hooded figure turns her face towards Greg, revealing to Blue Diamond.

column4: You do?

column6: A tear drop drips out of Blue Diamond's eye, which affects Steven as well, as tear flows from his eye too.

column4: I lost someone very important to me, too. I miss her every single day, and I think about her all the time. But she's never coming back. That feeling can be so hard to be okay with.

I'm surprised that a human being is capable of understanding how I feel. It's a shame. There's a geo-weapon incubating in your planet that will destroy everything shortly. But you don't deserve that, do you?
Geo-weapon, huh?
You know, I really shouldn't be here. But I'm glad I came back one last time. I can save one last piece of her legacy.
Oh yeah?

column6: Blue Diamond suddenly grabs Greg, keeping him within the grasp of her hand.

column4: Dad!

column6: Blue Diamond extends her arm forward, summoning a large blue hand ship hidden in the clouds  in the background.

column4: That's a... big... arm!

column6: The legs of the blue Palanquin retract, and it hovers over to Blue Diamond as she begins walking toward it.

column4: Whoa! Put me down, please! Whoa, whoa! Put me down, Your Highness!

column6: The Palanquin lands in front of Blue Diamond, and she and Blue Pearl step into it before shutting itself closed.

column4: Dad, Dad!

column6: Steven runs out of the bushes after the Palanquin, as it ascends into the palm of the hand ship, gripping onto the Palanquin.

column4: STOP!

column6: Steven jumps from the ground, floating high into the sky after the hand ship. The ship starts turning around to face up into space. Steven is about to reach the ship, when it warps into faster-than-light travel, disappearing instantly. The force from the warp forces Steven back towards the ground.

column4: Dad...

column6: Steven continues to fall, when Garnet suddenly leaps in and catches him in midair. She lands back on the ground and embraces Steven.

column4: Steven, I'm s- I'm sorry!
Garnet!
I saw you come here, I saw Blue Diamond on Earth, I saw her see me and find all of us, I couldn't be here with you!
She took my dad! It's all my fault! I should've listened to you! What are we gonna do, Garnet?
We're going to space. We're going to get him back.

column6: Garnet and Steven warp back onto the Crystal Temple Warp Pad, with Steven still traumatized back what happened in Korea.

column4: This can't be happening.
Steven! You're back!
Hey, Steve-O.
We're so sorry about earlier-
Forget that! We have to catch up with her!
What!?
Who?
Blue Diamond.
Blue Diamond!?  O-O-On Earth!?
Holy smokes! They're all coming out of the woodwork.
Amethyst, turn into a chair. I-I need to sit down.
She took Dad! She alien-abducted him, and it's all my fault!
She took Greg!?
Our Greg?
What other Greg is there!? How are we gonna get him back!?
What did she even want him for? To eat him!? T-to put him in a zoo!?
Wait. That might be it.
She's gonna eat him!?
What? No. But there was a... No. No, it couldn't possibly still exist. Not since we-
That's right! Pink Diamond's insidious human zoo.
What?
During her reign on Earth, Pink Diamond stole humans from their families as trophies of her conquest.
You gotta be kidding.

Oh no. It was very serious. When I still served...  ...Homeworld, I saw it myself. A private menagerie deep in space. Humans in captivity. We were never able to rescue them. We had no way to get to them after the war. But, that was over 5,000 years ago.
You really think Greg's there?
Steven, Blue Diamond wanted him alive?
Yes! Yes! She liked him!
I can't think of anywhere else she'd put him if she wanted to keep him, that is if the zoo's still there.
It's our only chance! But, how are we going to get there?
With the Roaming Eye.
The Ruby ship?
That's right. We're going into space, and we're not coming back without Greg.

column6: The Crystal Gems arrive at the barn, and Peridot is seen inspecting the interior of the Roaming Eye.

column4: Let's see. Rear pulsar trackers are tracking pulsars. The atmosphere shield seems functional, but you're not going to need that in space, obviously.
Well, make sure it is safe for Steven.
He should be fine. But, I think I should go in and change the system preferences the Rubies set. How do you feel about green lights instead of red?
There's no time for that! If it works, then let's just do it already!

column6: Steven walks towards the barn while talking to Connie on his phone.

column4: Sorry, Connie, but we just can't wait. Dad's in trouble, and we need to go into space to get him back. There's no time. We're going right now. ...Just protect Beach City while we're gone.
So, if I input the coordinates, it will take us right there?

It's a little more complicated than that. These aren't your Era 1 light kites. You're gonna be pretty much bending reality if you turn on the gravity engine. Come to think of it, I should really change the Ruby preferences on that, too.
So what, so it's red! Come on! Come on! We gotta go!
Rubies aside, will it fly?
Short answer, yes.
Okay, let's go!
Lapis, Peridot, stay here. You'll have to protect Beach City if something happens while we're gone.

column6: Lapis gives a thumbs-up.

column4: You can count on us!

column6: Garnet gets into the ship, shutting the hatch, and the Roaming Eye begins flying into space. Pearl pilots the ship while Steven watches Earth shrink in distance.

column4: Don't worry, Dad. We're on our way.  I hope you got to see some of this. There's enough out here for a whole album about the cosmos.

column6: Suddenly, the ship starts rumbling.

column4: Space turbulence!

column6: The Roaming Eye encounters an asteroid field. Pearl begins skillfully piloting the ship around the incoming asteroids.

column4: Sweet moves.
Hold on.

column6: Pearl navigates the Roaming Eye until it exits the asteroid field.

column4: Alright. How much further till we get to- Uhh!
Sorry, Rubies.
We should really do something about them.
We can pick them up on the way back. Dad comes first. How much longer till we get there?
Well, at our current speed, we should be reaching the human zoo in... approximately seventy human years! Just in time for Greg's 110th anniversary of being alive.
Pearl, my dad's not healthy enough to live that long.
Ehh... Do you think he'll be able to make it to 109?
Before we left, Peridot did mention the gravity engine.
Oh yeah. She said it bends reality.

Oh, I'm sure she was exaggerating. It probably just alters the definition for speed by manipulating space-time, but what effect would that have on organic matter? It might flatten Steven's body into a pancake of skin and bones.
Eww, bones are gross.
You have bones in your bedroom.
That's different. Those are my bones.
If being a pancake means saving my dad, then bring on the syrup!

column6: Steven slams his palm onto the control panel, activating the gravity engine. Steven screams as the ship speeds up drastically, causing him to black out.
Steven lays unconscious next to the captain's seat, until the Gems starts calling out to him, waking him up.

column4: Steven!
Steven! Are you okay?
I'm fine. I-I think I just blacked out. Umm.. Are you guys okay?

column6: The activation of the gravity engine happens to flatten the Gems instead of Steven. Amethyst starts giggling at her peculiar appearance.

column4: You tell me.
Uhh... NO! We're NOT okay!
Uhh, why do you guys look like that?
The gravity warp seems to be affecting our bodies.
Please tell me this lasts forever.

Our bodies are made of light, and usually, they form a mass dependent on the air pressure and the level of gravity in the environment. But we're in a situation, where the normal laws of physics don't apply.
Who cares? It's funny.
In what way is this funny!?
So, you guys aren't doing this on purpose? Can't you shapeshift back?

column3: ['shapeshifts into Purple Puma, yet remaining the same height']
column4: Hold on.  Huh, check it out. Puma cub.
The ship seems to be putting out some kind of energy, keeping us in this shape.

column3: ['ponders for a bit and turns to the control panel']
column4: Oh, I know the problem.
You do?

column6: Amethyst shapeshifts back to normal.

column4: Peridot said the ship was calibrated for Rubies. It must be making you all Ruby-sized.

column6: An imaginative projection of a Ruby appears next to the Gems, indicating their heights to the Ruby.

column4: Ugh! Why doesn't she tell us anything? This is why we don't listen to her.
Maybe I can change the settings.

column6: Steven turns the calibration like a slot machine. It stops at three bulky figures, and the Gems turn Quartz-sized.

column4: No.

column6: Steven turns the calibration again, stopping at three tiny figures. The Gems instantly shrink into Pebble-sized in mid-air and fall onto the floor.

column4: Nope.

column6: Steven turns the calibration again, stopping at three diamonds. The Gems quickly grow into Diamond-sized and hit their heads on the ceiling.

column4: Sorry!
This isn't working.

column6: Amethyst starts snickering at the antics.

column4: Try adjusting it manually.

column6: Steven taps on the screen to open the manual calibration menu, consisting of various symbols unknown to Steven.

column4: Woah! Umm... Maybe this one?

column6: Steven made a few manual adjustments, which causes the necks of the Gems to become long and unstable.

column4: Okay, so that does that. Uhh... Maybe this one.

column6: Steven made another manual adjustment, causing the limbs of the Gems to become long and unstable as well.

column4: Agh! Why is this so complicated!?

column6: Steven starts to tapping randomly at the calibration. The Gems momentarily return back to normal, before Garnet is flattened into a pancake and Pearl bloated up like a ball. Garnet and Amethyst chase after Pearl as she rolls away, when Amethyst grumbles in nausea and her body extends into a long sausage.

column4: Hey, Steven! this is getting a little weird, even for me.

column6: Steven continues to tapping the calibration at random, until an large red "X" error message pops up.

column4: I think I found the off-switch!
Guys! Wha- What did I do!?

column6: The Roaming Eye keeps accelerating into a ludicrous speed, creating visual wormholes in the fabric of space and overwhelming Steven.

column4: Amethyst!? Garnet!? Pearl!? Where are you!?  What happened? Are you cracked!? Uhh, Amethyst is usually back by now!

column6: The screen starts beeping and switches display, alerting Steven that the destination is approaching at an uncomfortable speed.

column4: Oh no. That's the zoo. Uhh, we're gonna smash right into it if we don't... slow... down!

column6: Steven struggles to move his arm from his seat, against the ludicrous speed of the ship, to reach the control panel.

column4: Gah! Come on, Steven. You can do it! I-it's okay! The Gems are gonna be fine!  They gotta be fine! D-Dad's gonna be fine, too! Gah! I-It doesn't seem like it right now, but later, we're gonna laugh if I just stop the ship!

column6: Steven continues to reach his arm out to reach the control panel, but fails at the ship's ludicrous speed.

column4: It isn't going to stop. There's no fixing this. It's all my fault! I rushed us! I pushed us into making stupid mistakes!  It didn't have to be this way. I didn't have to not listen to Garnet. I didn't have to go to Korea. Dad! I didn't have to get you taken away forever by Blue Diamond. I- I wasn't trying to be selfish. I just wanted to know what was going on for myself, for once!  But now, I lost everyone... Dad!  Dad! I want my dad! I just want my dad.

column6: Steven, collecting determination from his moment of weakness, reaches for the control panel again and succeeds in stopping the ship. The ship jolts a bit as the Gems phase through the wall, looking disoriented.

column4: You're back! Where'd you go!?  I was so worried!

I think in your attempt to fix our bodies, you may have accidentally shut off the calibration altogether. Our light-composed forms couldn't keep up with the ship moving faster than the speed of light.
So, you were just... lagging behind the ship... this whole time?

column6: Another imaginative projection appears above Steven, of the Gems' bodies stretched outside of the Roaming Eye.

column4: Yeah. Don't worry about it too much. Amethyst liked it.

column3: ["laughs in joy, but then notices Steven's tears"]
column4: I never thought I could stretch so far! Hah! I think I kind of phased through a planet.  Uhh... Yo, Stevie man. You heard Garnet. We're totally fine, dude.
I-I was pushing so hard, I... I just wanted to get Dad back so much, I-I almost wrecked the mission! This whole thing is my fault...
Steven. You didn't kidnap Greg. Blue Diamond did.
Woah. Do you guys see that?

column6: The Crystal Gems look out the windscreen, as the human zoo comes into view ahead of them.

column4: What you did? You got us to the zoo.
Yeah?
And seventy human years ahead of schedule.
I'll see you really soon, Dad. ...I hope.

column6: The Crystal Gems arrive in the Roaming Eye at Pink Diamond's Zoo, which is being watched by a Red Eye.

column4: The human zoo. I can't believe it still exists.
Dad's gotta be in there. We just have to find him and bust him out.

column6: The Roaming Eye enters the ship hangar of the zoo via its ring. The Crystal Gems gasp as they notice the two Amethyst guards standing at the entrance door.

column4: Those Gems.
Amethyst guards. Right, like we could just waltz up as an ownerless Pearl, a fusion and- and you.
We just need disguises. I'll be Esteban Universidad.
Steven, it doesn't matter what your name is. We're all going to stand out!

column6: At that moment, Garnet unfuses into Ruby and Sapphire.

column4: We won't stand out if we play the roles we were made for.
Ruby! Sapphire!
Okay, everybody. Hear her out.
Today, I'm a Sapphire traveling with my Ruby guard, and my personal Pearl. Esteban, I've brought you as an offering for the zoo.
Pobrecito Esteban!
Uhh... What about me?
You're accompanying me as extra muscle.
Muscle like them?
Exactly.
But I've never even seen another Amethyst before. What do I do? What if I say something wrong?
Just look the part. You're new and we're rusty, but we just have to sell this long enough to find Greg.
Is this really going to work?

column6: Everyone gasps in shock.

column4: Just, stick together! Play it straight! Let's... change the future!

column6: Sapphire, Ruby, holding Steven, Pearl and Amethyst, shapeshifted to look like a regular Amethyst guard, begin walking out of the Roaming Eye towards the guarded door.

column4: You'll never cage me, you rockheads!

column6: The Crystal Gems encounter the Amethyst guards, who look at them suspiciously.

column4: State your purpose.
I'm here to make a delivery to the human zoo.
Bad news: The human zoo shut down.  Which means, we'll just have to throw you in space.

column6: Steven whimpers in fear.

column4: Heh, look. He believed me.

column6: The Amethyst guards start chuckling, when an elite Gem enters and glares at them.

column4: What are you doing?
Nothing, Holly Blue Agate.

column6: Holly Blue then notices Sapphire, gasps in shock and kicks one of the Amethyst guards in her legs.

column4: Why didn't you tell me there was a Sapphire here?! What have you miscreants been saying to them!?
Nothing, Holly.

column3: ['turns to Sapphire', 'chuckles', 'glances at the Amethyst guards']
column4: You'll have to forgive them.  They're from Earth.  Ahem! Apologize.
Forgive us!

column6: Holly Blue punches the guards to correct them.

column4: ... Forgive us, your Clarity!
No use dwelling on the past. I've brought a new human for the collection.
How unprecedented! Nothing for millennia, and then two humans back-to-back! Well, it's probably for the best, that first one wasn't in... the best condition.
Dad! That's him!

column6: Ruby quickly shushes Steven.

column4: Ohh, their incessant barking, what is it saying?!  The other one was loud too, and all that thrashing about. I'm sure Blue Diamond would want to thank you personally, but you just missed her.

column6: The Crystal Gems sigh in relief.

column4: Amethyst, take this human to the-
Wait! The thing is... we've traveled so far, and it would be a shame to leave so quickly. Perhaps you'd grant us a tour of the facility?
I would be honored! Right this way, your Grand Clarity.  Amethysts are to stay and guard the door.
Uhh, but-
The door.

column6: Holly Blue begins leading the group into the facility, leaving Amethyst, groaning nervously, behind with the other two Amethysts.

column4: Does your Pearl always walk next to you?
I'll just be right here.

Hmm. Chatty. (Pearl blushes.) This facility originally belonged to Pink Diamond and houses and staffs the, otherwise useless, Quartz that she produced and what was her colony. But Blue Diamond and her trusted Agate; that's me, have been maintaining this place since the dawn of Era 2.

column6: Holly Blue leads the group towards a door and waits on the spot, expecting Pearl to open it without a prompt.

column4: Is she going to do it or, should I say something?
Oh! Pearl, the door.
Hmm? Oh, right, right! I got it!
You are so patient with her. How do you do it?
As a Sapphire, I know it will happen eventually.

column6: After a bit of difficulty, Pearl opens the door and the group enters it one by one.

column4: That will be all.
Sorry.
Hang in there.

column6: Pearl enters on the other side and begins closing the door.

column4: Do keep up, Pearl.
Ughh.

column6: Holly Blue activates a panel on the wall, and the floor beneath the group turns transparent, revealing the lower exterior of the zoo.

column4: The bottom half of this structure is devoted entirely to specimen containment. Apparently, humans don't take well to captivity, but once you understand their needs, they're easy to control.

column6: Holly Blue reverts the floor back to its original state, and the group continues touring.

column4: It's tragic that Pink Diamond's existence in this universe ended up being so finite. But what a selfless act for Blue Diamond to step forward and spend her own time and energy preserving this place in Pink Diamond's memory. It's a real testament to Blue Diamond's merciful and giving nature. Don't you think?
Uhh, of course.

column6: Ruby growls in anger at Holly Blue's glorification of Blue Diamond.

column4: And past this way is the health reservation sector...
Keep it together, Ruby. Our roles, remember? Gotta Esteban it.
And here, of course, is the human disposal chute.
W-Whaa! Ho-o-ow do you get in the zoo!?
Oh, there it goes again with its hilarious noises.
So, how do you get in the zoo?
Excellent question, your Grand Clarity! On the rare occasion that we would need to enter the containment area, we would do so via this service door.
Dad. That door's how we get to Dad. We just need to come up with a distraction.
Got it.
As a one-way access point, there are no risks of an escape. In fact, it's only been used once for a human-
Explosion!
Pardon me!?
Uhh... I just remembered I left the gravity engine... idling! Sorry, my Sapphire. I'm so forgetful and disposable.
What?

column6: Steven, Pearl, and Ruby glance at the door, signalling to Sapphire it is part of a plan.

column4: A-A-A foreseen turn of events. Yes. It is going to overheat and explode. The damage will be massive.
My word! I don't know why anyone trusts Rubies with those ships! This is what happens.
If we hurry, we can disable the engine before any damage is done. It should only take five minutes, so everyone, be on your best behavior.

column6: Sapphire winks at Ruby, Steven and Pearl, and they all wink back.

column4: This way, your Clarity, although I'm sure you don't need my guidance.

column6: Sapphire and Holly Blue walk off.

column4: I can't believe all that stuff about Blue Diamond being merciful! She's a shatterer! She yelled at Sapphire! She hates fusion a-and love!?
I know, Ruby, but we don't have much time! We have to open this door!
Right. Right. Pearl, open it!
Of course. What else am I good for?  It's different from the others.

column6: Pearl tries to operate the door panel, resulting in an error message twice.

column4: A-ha!

column6: Pearl taps on the door panel in confidence, and again resulting in an error message.

column4: I actually can't figure this out at all.
What!?
But Pearl, you're our hacker.
We don't have time for this! Steven, help me open the door.
Okay.
And Pearl, hack faster.

column6: Pearl continues to hack the door panel while Steven and Ruby tries to bash down the door. Sapphire's voice can then heard, as she and Holly Blue begin to return.

column4: I am so glad we are almost back! I was really enjoying the tour!
Yes, I can tell by the tone of your voice. Thank you so much again for averting that crisis.

column6: Holly Blue and Sapphire gasp in shock, as they notice damages on the service door, and Steven, Ruby and Pearl trying to act ignorant.

column4: What is going on!?
Oh, well, I'm sure there's a reasonable-
Did you see the Amethyst that did this!?

column6: Everyone sigh in relief.

column4: Really? We have guests.

column6: Just then, two more Amethyst guards run towards the group.

column4: Holly Blue Agate! We have important news for you!
We do not run or shout in these hallways!
I'm sorry. I-I-It's just that-
How am I supposed to know what you're saying when you're mumbling?
Uhh, I'm sorry, Holly Blue Agate. It's just-
Blue Diamond is on her way!

Oh my stars! She's back already?!  You two, best behavior. Shoulders squared! Minds cleared! Backs straight! And surely, Blue Diamond would want to thank you personally for this special delivery, your grand Clarity.
Yes. I suppose... she will.

column6: Sapphire and Ruby start sweating in anxiety.

column4: Well, don't just stand there, you useless chunks of earth! Make yourself useful and escort that human to the assimilation bay!

column6: The Amethyst guards approach Steven and pick him up.

column4: But the tour...
Oh, your Clarity. You flatter me, but we really must get ready. Our Diamond will be here at any moment.
Let me go, you bigger Amethyst!
Heh, these newer humans are so spunky. In you go.

column6: The Amethyst guard throws Steven into a dark tunnel and closes the door. The lights turn on inside and Steven begins to be transported into the zoo on a conveyor belt. Four Gem fingers then pop in in front of Steven and take a picture of him.

column4: What the... Uhh...

column6: More Gem fingers appear and begin performing health checks on Steven, such as dental hygiene, photon sensitivity in the pupils, temperature, and nasal congestion. They then begin stripping Steven off of his clothes down to his pants, and which Steven smacks the fingers away.

column4: Nope! I will do that myself.

column6: Steven takes off his pants and hands it to the Gem fingers.

column4: I'll just find my dad without pants.

column6: The Gem fingers spray sanitizing mist at Steven, causing him to cough. Steven then notice a crusher-like contraption in front of him and he tries to run away in panic. He fails to outrun it on the conveyor belt, and it "crushes" onto him, dressing him in a new attire.

column4: Ugh, loincloths.

column6: The Gem finger then attach earrings onto Steven's ears, and two glass barriers encloses him in the tunnel.

column4: Okay! What else, huh!? What else you got for me!? I'm on that Dad mission adrenaline rush and ready for whatever space junk you have next! Futuristic cattle prods! Human horseshoes! Whatever you got, come and get me!

column6: Water suddenly floods the room and a hole opens up underneath, flushing Steven into it. Steven screams underwater as he is transported through a water tunnel.
Steven emerges from a shallow body of water and begins coughing and gasping for air.

column4: Huh? What the...

column6: Steven looks around, spotting lush greenery and trees all around.

column4: What is this place? And where's...

column6: Steven then spots Greg interacting with two other humans by the water body.

column4: Dad!?

column6: Following the events in Gem Heist, Steven emerges from a shallow body of water inside the human zoo, after the assimilation process. He coughs and gasps for air, as he looks around.

column4: Where am I now?

column6: Steven spots Greg by the side of the water body, being groomed by two Zoomans.

column4: Dad?
Huh? Steven?

column6: Steven and Greg run over and give each other a hug.

column4: Dad, it's you!
Steven! My little man!
Dad! When Blue Diamond took you, I got so scared. And then the Gems said you might be in some horrible human zoo all chained up to a wall... doing tricks for peanuts...
Hey, hey, it's okay, schtu-ball. Your old man's perfectly fine. Wait, how'd you even get out here?
We got on a Gem ship from Earth. I'll tell you about it on the way home. I got separated from the Gems. We got to find them and bust you out of here.

column6: Steven begins searching in the water body where he popped out from.

column4: Well, you're not gonna get out that way. I've already tried.
What?! Well, there might be another way out if we can find it.
Ga-reg!  Who is that with you?
Is this a new friend, Ga-reg?
Wy-Six, Jay-Ten, this is-
Let me have my dad back already!
Hey, don't be like that. Relax. These people have treated me so well since I got here.
Wha?

column6: More Zoomans pop out from the bushes nearby.

column4: Greetings! Greetings!
Wow, Ga-reg!

column6: The Zoomans being to gather around Steven to greet him, mumbling among themselves.

column4: Everyone, this is Steven. He's my son!
Uhh... Hi.
Hi!
Thanks for... braiding my dad's hair.
Steven, these people are the descendants of humans brought here by Gems thousands of years ago. They've never seen the Earth before. Isn't that wild?!
Ste-van, Ga-reg has told stories of you. "The bits, the bits!" That's you, right?
The bits, the bits, the bits!
Come on, say it.
Let's get out of here. We came across a door that leads into the zoo, but we couldn't open it from the other side. Let's find it and try to open it from in here.
A door? Really? All right. Let's find it tonight. It'll be easier to look for it after the routine.

column6: A chime is sounded from the earrings, and a voice begins to speak to everyone.

column4: Greetings, everyone. It's time to start the daily routine. Please enjoy your meal during this designated eating period.
Who was that?
Ste-van does not know what a little voice is. Just like Ga-reg when he first arrived.

column6: The Zoomans begin laughing altogether.

column4: Our little voices guide us through life here.
You all must be hungry now.
Yes- yes. We are-
Umm... Dad?
Don't worry, Steven. We'll get out of here. But for now, let's just play along.

column6: Steven and Greg follow the Zoomans to the designated eating location, where purple crystal fruits are grown from the trees.

column4: Here you go, Ga-reg.
Oh, thank you.
Ste-van, today the fruit is purple.
Are you enjoying the food?
Oh, yes
How is the food? Is it good?
Yes. It is delicious.

column6: Steven glances at the Zoomans, obediently complying to the little voice without questions, in uneasy as he eats on his fruit.

column4: Now it is time to play.

column6: Greg and the Zoomans begin rolling down the hill and laughing, except Steven, who rolls down uncomfortably. Everyone then lies together on the grass.

column4: Now, everyone, reach up like you're going to touch outer space.

column6: The Zoomans comply and reach their hands upwards. Steven and Greg eventually comply as well.

column4: That's it. Reach up high. Wasn't that fun?
I have not had that much fun since yesterday!
It's time to stop and smell the flowers.

column6: The Zoomans begin smelling flowers inside a shaded garden, which Steven and Greg just watch on.

column4: What if... I don't want to smell the flowers?
Why wouldn't you want to do that?
Time to clean up, everyone. Let's all take a refreshing bath.

column6: The Zoomans begin bathing in a pool next to a basalt column waterfall. They all relax, laugh and splashes together in the water.

What's the point of this? We'll never be the Crystal Gems. We're just... the Crystal... Temps. But we have our own way of doing things. So, let's go back to that, to fix this mess we made.

Watch it.

Okay.

"Accidental".
"Accidental", and the next one's a noun.

"Unexpectedly"!
Past tense verb?
"Crashed"!
...Noun?
"Explosion"!

Steven.

This should cover your medical bills!

Ahhhh

column4: Hi Lars!
Uhh... What.
So... how was your evening?
Fine I guess. Kind of boring.
What do you mean kind of boring!?
Why are you so worked up over how my night was?
Oh, uhh... Well, I was wondering if you've seen any good wrestling matches lately?
Hmpf. Now that you mention it, no!

Yeah, but he came back as some lame, Tiger... Phil-harmonic donations-thing? Which, honestly, is such a weird angle, you know? The whole thing just felt so off.
What do you mean off?
He took off his tie, and is throwing money at everybody. It's like, the sequel no one asked for.
What! It's the sequel you asked for!
Well, he just didn't seem into it, you know? He used to care about his money. Now he's just giving it away. And he still just wins like, every match.
Oh, I get it. You want him to lose and keep his money, right?
No, I don't want him to lose, just-
What do you want him to do!? Just tell meeeee!

I don't know! I don't even know what I want for breakfast half the time! I'm a complex individual teenage boy. Now get out of here and stop taking such a personal interest in my habits and well-being!

column6: Steven lies sulking on the couch, while Amethyst is making tea next to him.

column4: I don't get it. I don't even know why I'm wrestling anymore. I guess I'm doing it for Lars? And he doesn't even care. I liked it better when I was doing it for you.
But who needs it, you know? I mean, I needed it when I felt like, ehh... I wasn't good enough. But I don't feel like that anymore.  Do you?

No. No, that- that's never why I was doing it. I just, liked it was our thing we did together. But, you're right. Doesn't make sense anymore. I think I should just do what you did. Just tell everybody I'm quitting and... leave like it's no big deal.

column4: Ladies and gents. Tonight is a very special night here at the Beach City Wrestling Arena Dome and Building. I'll let my good friend Tiger Mill- I mean, Philanthropist explain.

What now?

column4: Booooo! Philanthrophy is laaame!

Amethyst?
He's back! The legend has returned to the ring! PUUURPPPLE PUUUMAAA!!
Those belts aren't yours to give away! Those times we wrestled together meant everything to me!  You can give away all jungle bucks you want. But I will not stand by and let you give up our memories!

You came back!

With a bang!

column4: Tiger Philanthropist is down!
What?!

column4: Finish it!

All right.
Close your eyes!

column4: All of them.
Ok, ok.
Now make your wish. But don't tell me what it is.  Garnet, what did you wish for?
I wished... for another shooting star so that you could make a wish.
Oh my gosh.

column4: Garnet! It worked!

column4: Is that star... screaming?

column4: What's that?!

column4: It's "Navy"!
That's... a Ruby.
Don't you remember? I gave them all names. This one's "Navy", 'cause her gem is on her navel.
Oh. I finally get it.

column4: Oh please! Oh please! Don't make me go back to Homeworld! Oh, I wanna stay here with you.
This... is a surprise.
You... wanna live on Earth?

You're not mad at us from before?
What do you mean?
You know, about tricking you into playing baseball?
That was fun!
Or, when Amethyst pretended to be Jasper?
I've got to admit, that was pretty clever.
Or when we blasted you all out into space and stole your ship so you'd be stranded forever?
Well, we were fighting so it's understandable.
I don't know about this. She tried to stab you in space.
That was "Eyeball". This is "Navy". She... always seemed really nice, actually.
Hey thanks!
And you know, a Ruby falling from the sky, discovering this beautiful world. Sounds a lot like a story you told me once.
Oh stop!
Let me take it from here! I know exactly where she'll fit in.
All right, Steven Universe. Go work your magic.

Peridot! Lapis!
Steven!

Well well, back again. You should just move in with us at this point.
Actually, maybe not me. But I know someone else who might be interested.
Hi! I'm "Navy", a refugee from Homeworld. Just like you guys.

column4: So uhh... when did you show up on Earth?
Today.
New barnie!
What?! No! Hold on. Can we... talk about this first?
Yeah, yeah-yeah-yeah. Of course. I love talking.

column6: Lapis encases "Navy" in a water bubble and floats her away.

column4: Steven, this makes no sense. Why would she wanna live here? We've been awful to her. She must hate us.
