Just like that? Wow.
There's no way!
Well, you guys wanted to start a new life here too. It can totally happen.
Even if she wants to be here, she doesn't know what she's getting into. Life on Earth is really confusing. It took me a long time to get used to it. I'm still getting used to it.
Hmm...
But! We can show her the way. I mean, we've been through the wringer on all this stuff. It'd be cool to share what we've learned. And, you know, I think we'll be really good at it.
Ok... Ok. I'll give it a try. But we'll have to take it slow.
Yeah!
This will be great! I just know it!

column6: Pumpkin barks at "Navy". Lapis snaps her fingers to dispel her water bubble and release "Navy".

column4: Thank you!

column6: Peridot begins lecturing "Navy", and Steven, using the chalkboard.

column4: So you're an Earthling. But what does that mean? Well, the answer is... (Lapis flips the board, revealing a drawing of a shrugging alien.) Who knows?!  And that's the beauty of Earth. Nothing here makes sense, but that's why you have us now.
It might be hard to like Earth at first. It is where, a bunch of bad stuff happened.
I love it! It's so... sunny.
Ah, yes! The sun! Ever burning. Until it's not.
This planet has weather, which can be confusing and alarming. It's sunny now, but it can always rain later.
What is... rain?
It's like- Oh wait! I can just show you.

column6: Lapis controls a giant water bubble over the group and simulates rain with it.

column4: I know it's a bit strange, but-
Oh ah ha ha, the sky is crying!
She likes it! "Navy" likes it!
Oh, a planet that's not always sunny. It's almost like, it's always... changing! Oh-ho-ho! It's so beautiful!
Yeah! Exactly!

column3: ['levitates an umbrella over her and Lapis']
column4: Wow! That's like... chapter ninety-seven of Earth stuff!  Looks like we have an advanced student on our hands.
Yeah. No kidding.

column4: This is our... Gem Cave. Lapis hates it when I call it that. So I don't. The barn's pretty big so you can have one of the corners.  Make it your own.
That sounds so nice. Any corner would be lovely.
You should have a look around.

column6: "Navy" first inspects the toilets, and gets curious about the hammock.

column4: Ooohh. What's this for?
That's a hammock. It's a bed you fall out of.
It's where I like to sleep. I don't have to do it, but I like to do it. You know, turn off for a bit and-

Wow! Sounds groovy! How do I start?

column4: Looks like you've got it.

I love plants!  Ooohh.
Well, what about Pumpkin? Do you love Pumpkin too?

column4: I! Love! Pumpkin!
Eww! Pumpkin kisses.

column4: Ah! I do love the dirt!

You guys are the best! Thank you, thank you. Thank you all for taking me in.  Oh, we're gonna be the best of friends.

...Oh come on!
Did I do something?

Lapis!
Lapis!

column4: Lapis!
Lapis! Where are you?

No. Something is seriously wrong with me. It took me so long to learn to like this planet.
Hey, no one said there's a rush.

column4: Oh no! I-I didn't to make anyone upset! Oh! Maybe I just should go!
Ah... "Navy"!
No, no. It's my problem. I didn't mean to make you feel like you don't belong here.
Yeah. You should stay.
Oh! You guys! I'm so glad! I don't know where I'd go anyway. Can't go anywhere without my ship. That's the only place I ever really belonged anyways. I miss it so much.
"Navy"! We have your ship! It's right over there!
You do?

column4: Wow! I didn't even notice it there!

Things are going ok now, huh?

Uh, you mean the one right here?

I'm gonna press it!

The only thing wrong... is that you're still holding on.
Wait. This whole time, all you wanted was your ship? You could've just stolen it to begin with!
I could have done that, but then I would've never have gotten to see the look on your face, when you were tricked by your favorite little Ruby!
What?!
Hey! I can't hear what's happening! Is "Navy" showing us the ocean? 'Cause this is a heck of a way to do it!
You dirty little-

column4: Bye bye!

It was still worth a shot.

Steven is watching the video tape his mom left for him on his TV.

column4: Come on, Lion. I need you to focus here.

column6: Lion keeps gagging, on the verge of retching.

column4: No, no, no! Lion, at least do it on the floor!

column6: Lion coughs up something, with liquid splattering, to Steven's displeasure.

column4: Why is it always on the bed?

column6: Steven notices that Lion has coughed up a pink key.

column4: Magical hair-ball destiny.

column6: Lion retches one more time, coughing up a half-eaten Crystal Basilisk.

column4: Okay. That's gross.

column6: Steven cleans up the mess on his bed and turns his attention on the key.

column4: Right. Anyway. This key. Mom must have wanted you to give this to me now. What does it open? Hmm... Oh! Hey, Lion.

column4: Maybe if I...

column6: Steven heads back in to try again, only to fail again.

column4: Nothing to unlock here.

column6: Steven and Lion arrives at the fountain, and he throws the key into the water, and nothing happens.

column4: So not here either?

column6: Steven then enters Rose's Room through the Temple Gate.

column4: Give me something this key unlocks.

column6: A padlock appears in front of Steven. He gasps as he inserts the key and twists it. The padlock unlocks and poofs away, with nothing else happening. Steven groans in disappointment.
Steven sits on the floor, thinking frustratedly while scratches his head with the key.

column4: Hmm...  Of course! The answers were inside me the whole time!

column6: Steven jabs himself in the head with the key and falls back-first onto the floor.

column4: Where am I supposed to go? This has to unlock something. There must be someplace I haven't been.  Lion. Take me somewhere new.

column6: Lion yawns and turns away.

column4: Hey, come on. Where did you get this? Can you please take me there?  Pleeeeease? Argh!

column6: Lion puts his paw on Steven's head and plants his face onto the floor.

column4: Pleeeee...  ...eeeease?

column6: Lion brings Steven to the desert through a magical portal.

column4: Hey. This is where we found you.  Something of Mom's is hidden here, right? Take me there.

column6: Lion begins running deep into the desert. Time passes on, Lion keeps running through the desert while Steven gets uncomfortable, basking under the hot sun.

column4: Where are we going? It's been hours.  Mom... who were you? Who am I? Garnet... Amethyst... Pearl... They won't say it, but... I know they expect something big from me. But how can I fulfill my destiny if I don't even know what it is? Who am I supposed to be?

column6: Steven gets up and gazes up front. The bright light from the sun blinds Steven's vision partially ahead, till a pair of pink structures appear in the distance.

column4: Mom?
So this is it. Couldn't we had just warped here?

column6: Steven reaches into Lion's mane to refresh himself with a bottle of water. He gazes up at the pink structures as he approaches the locked door.

column3: ['jams the key into the locked door']
column4: Whatever's behind this door, I know it's something important.  Please tell me my destiny.

column6: Steven opens the door and enters it to the other side.

column4: Wha...?

column4: What? Is this... just... Rose's trash dump?

column6: A Crystal Basilisk appears in front of Steven, and Lion chases after it, running away from Steven.

column4: No... Please! There was supposed to be something here to tell me my purpose! This is just a bunch of garbage Mom left behind! [Growls]

column6: Steven growls in frustration, tearing up, and kicks a hardhat on the ground far away. He wipes his tear away, when he notices a VHS tape stuck in the ground.

column4: Huh?  It's... another tape from Mom?! But... Wh-Who's Nora? A-Am I not the only one? Do I have a sister? Lion! what is this? W-Who's Nora?

column6: Lion disregards Steven.

column4: I know I've asked a lot from you today, but please, just one more time.  I need your help. I need to know what this tape means. I won't get mad the next time you throw up on my bed.

column6: Lion widens his eyes.
Lion warps Steven once more, emerging in the middle of a road this time.

column4: This is near Beach City. Lion, are you sure this is the right-

column6: Steven then hears guitar music playing in the distance.

column4: Nora.

column6: Steven runs toward the source of the music, only to find Greg playing a tune on his guitar by his van on a hill.

column4: Oh, hey, schtu-ball.
Dad?! You're Nora?
Who?
What are you doing here?
Getting some songs figured out. Ah, this is sort of my jamming hill. Used to be a tree by the warehouse, but a 7th-grader with a flute muscled me out.
Uh... yeah...
Are you okay?
...I found this.
Oh, my gosh.  I never thought I'd see this again.
You've seen this tape before!?
Of course. Come here. You should too.

column4: He's following me now.
Maybe he'll help you with your intro this time.
Dad?
Shh! Keep watching.

column4: "Okay, now!" (The screen pans towards him, posing on the beach.) "They call me..."  "Mr. Universe! Get ready baby, you're gonna have the coolest dad this side of the cosmos!"
This is...
"I press it now, right?"
"Do it. Woah!"

column3: ["laughs, as a seagull perches on Greg's guitar"]
column4: "Greg?"
"Can we edit this part?"
"No, no. It's perfect."

column4: "Isn't it wonderful, Nora? This world is full of so many possibilities."
... My video.
"Each living thing has an entirely unique experience. The sights they see, the lives they live are so complicated and... so simple."
This is just like the video Mom made me.
"Nora, we can't both exist. But I won't be gone. I'm going to become half of you. And every moment you enjoy being yourself, that will be me, loving being you."
No!  I don't understand. Why is this the same as the video you guys made me? Who's Nora?
N-Nora is you.
I'm my mom and my sister?! What kind of destiny is this?!
No, no. We just had it down to two names: Steven if you were a boy, and Nora if you were a girl.
So, then, would Nora have the magical destiny if I wasn't here?
Magical destiny? I don't know about that.

Woah! Steven, it's okay.  Come here. Come here.
Am I supposed to be- D-did she want me to be Nora?

Steven, she just wanted you to be you. When you have a kid, you have no idea who they're gonna be. Even Garnet couldn't predict it. That's what was so exciting to your mom, that life is full of so many possibilities, and you would get to explore them for yourself. I mean, you could be Steven or Nora or anyone else. And you can always change your name. Hey, I did.

column4: "Because you're going to become something extraordinary. You're going to be a human being.  That's my favorite part. A human being. A human is an action. I wonder who, how you'll be, what you'll think, what you'll want. Oh, I'm so happy for everyone who's going to know you.  I'm rambling. If they look to you, trust yourself. Take care of them, Nora."

Well... yeah. Is that okay?

column6: Steven and Barbara enters the dark break room of the Big Donut.

column4: I only came over to drop off Sadie's lunch. She wasn't home last night so I figured I'd bring it here. But the place was completely empty. Maybe its some baker's holiday. Certainly not a federal one.
Sadie never came home last night?
Ehhh She's an adult. Probably just snuck off for another island adventure with her boyfriend.

That couldn't be, they were going to go to party together but.. Lars never showed. And when me and Sadie left, she said she was going home. And now Sour Cream is looking everywhere for Onion. And I was expecting a package today from Jamie but he... He never delivered it.
A package? You mean one about "yay" big, two pounds, maybe 4 ounces?
My distinguished khakis! Did you see Jamie with them?
I did this morning. Just before sending him off to your place.
Barb... This might be serious.

column6: Steven and Barbara look at each other with deep concerns.

column4: I'll see if I can find anyone on the boardwalk.
I'll go check doorsteps for piled up packages, then we'll know if anyone else is missing.  Sadie! Don't worry, honey!  Mama's coming for you, baby girl!
...Good luck.

column6: Steven walks along the quiet boardwalk, deep in thought.

column4: Jamie... Onion... Lars... Sadie?... Maybe they all are on vacation? No, Steven.  Whatever the case, it's up to me to find them.

column6: Steven starts calling out loud in front of the arcade.

column4: Jamie! Onion! Lars! Sadie!
Awaiting new challengers to validate me.
Somebody, punch me! Please.

column6: Steven stares in unrest at the desolated arcade. He then grabs himself a bag of Chaaaaps from a vending machine.

column4: Well, Sour Cream was right. Onion wasn't in the vending machine. And neither was anybody else.
Are you "My Dad"?

column6: Steven looks down and spots a small blue figure, with a teardrop gem on her face, in front of him.

column4: A Gem!
Are you, "My Dad"? I need to find "My Dad."
N-No, I- I'm not.

column6: The teardrop Gem groans and flies away.

column4: Wha- W-Wait! Don't leave me with another enigma!

column6: Steven chases the teardrop Gem around the corner, only to find that she has disappeared.
Steven begins describing the teardrop Gem he saw, while the Gems and Connie attempt to illustrate his description.

column4: And the gem was under her eye. My right, her left. And wings, and, yeah...

column6: The Gems and Connie finish their illustrations and they all show them to Steven. Connie's illustration is anime-esque, of a bust of the teardrop Gem.

column4: I think I made one eye bigger than the other.

column6: Amethyst's illustration is free-form, appearing to be a winged horse.

column4: I was going for a feeling.

column6: Pearl's illustration is extremely detailed, looking almost like Lapis Lazuli.

column4: Honestly, I can't even draw a circle.

column6: Garnet's illustration is simple, looking like...

column4: Okay Garnet, you just drew yourself.
Uh, I like me.
Well, anyway. I think Connie was the closest.
Thanks!

column3: ['crumples her illustration in her hand', "grabs Connie's illustration"]
column4: This was a waste of time.  We should be preparing for a fight.  Whoever this is, she's from Homeworld. She's gotta be here for us.
She's not though. She said, she's looking for her Dad.
What?
Her Dad?
There are all these people missing. Maybe her Dad's gone missing too.
But Gems don't have Dads!
This doesn't make any sense.
Steven's a Gem, and Steven has a Dad.
There are no other Gems like Steven.
Are you sure?

column6: Everyone stares at Connie in silence.

column4: We got to get to the bottom of this. We should split up, and investigate.
Ruby and Sapphire!
Uh, no. I meant split into teams.
Ooohh... right. Garnet with yourself, Pearl with Amethyst, and Connie with me. Let's go!

column6: Steven and Connie begin wandering the empty streets of Beach City.

column4: Connie, do you really think there could be another Gem like me?
Well... You know more about Gems than I do, but it couldn't be impossible. You exist.
Hmm.. She didn't look half human though. She was blue and... had wings.
Well, what if she's adopted? What if, she crash-landed in the big city and she was taken in by a lonely millionaire with a heart of gold?
And a house of gold.
But one day, he went on a business trip to Beach City, and he never came home.
I... guess I'd watch movie of that.
Or read the book. Or neither, 'cause it could be reality, Steven.
You really think so?
Hey, the only way to know is find out.
Yeah!

column6: Steven and Connie enter the forest towards Onion's hiding spot. Connie picks up a fallen leaf, crumples it in her hand and holds it up in the air, letting the wind blow it off her hand.

column4: Yup, there's wind.

Man... I just feel like I was here with Onion and all his friends. Where is he? Poor Sour Cream missing his brother, and Barb missing her daughter, and her mailman. And this new Gem missing her dad! I know what it's like to have your dad taken away. She must be so scared.
But you got your dad back. And you'll solve this too. We'll solve this, together.

column3: ['smiles at Connie, and she smiles back']
column4: Thanks, Connie.  Lets turn this woods upside down.

column6: Steven and Connie begin searching through the forest.

column4: Onion! Lars! Jamie!  You in here delivering packages to some mail boxes?

column6: The teardrop Gem from before then appears on a tree beside Connie.

column4: Steven! It's the Gem!
What?
She looks just like my drawing. Come on! You don't have to be afraid, we'll help you. Jump down into my arms, my body will break your fall.
Are you "My Dad"?
What? Uh- no, I'm not your dad, but we can help you find your dad.
I'm not looking for "Your Dad", I'm looking for "My Dad." I need to find "My Dad."
Riiight, well, we'll... help you.

column3: ['struggles to get out of the fallen log']
column4: Connie!  Connie, wait! Be careful.
Connie. Are you Connie?
Yes, I'm Connie. Me Connie, Connie friend.
Topaz! I found one! I found one! I found a Connie!
Steven?
Connie!

column6: Steven continue to struggle, trying to get out of the fallen log, when the ground begins to tremble. Connie draws her sword as a large yellow Gem approaches, with the missing humans merged and struggling inside them.

column4: Another Gem! She... She has everyone.
Let them go!

column6: Topaz unfuses, separating into two smaller Topazes, while still holding onto the missing humans. The Topazes charge towards Connie and hold hands. Before Connie can even do anything, the Topazes fuse back together with Connie in between, merging her in their body as well.

column4: Connie!

column6: Steven finally manages to break free from the fallen log and runs towards Topaz.

column4: Look at those organics squirming around.
Give me back my friends!
Don't bother listening to that "Steven", he's not "My Dad".

column6: The teardrop Gem takes off her hair bow, turning it into a small wand. She fires a tractor beam at Steven and hurls him into a tree.

column4: Now, all we need is "My Dad" and we're out of here!

column6: Steven weakly gets up and attempts to reach out to the Gems, with a ringing in his ears.

column4: Can't believe they wasted an Aquamarine on a job like this. It's so easy you could've done it yourself, Topaz.

column6: Aquamarine chuckles hysterically as she leaves the forest on top of Topaz.

column4: No... You... can't... take them...

column6: Steven closes his eyes, as his consciousness fades away.
Following the events in Are You My Dad?, after Steven regained consciousness, he quickly announces the latest crisis to the Crystal Gems at his home.

column4: This is an emergency!
Why is Homeworld stealing humans from the boardwalk?
I don't know, but they're only taking my friends! They even got Connie! If we don't do something, they're going to take them into space!
And our spaceship got jacked, so if they leave Earth...
They'll be gone for good.
Ugh! Who were these guys?
That little Gem I saw before, her name's Aquamarine.
What?!
She's got a big friend- a fusion, named... Topaz.
A Topaz fusion... And an Aquamarine?
Are they a big deal?
Uhh, yes! Blue and Yellow Diamond must have sent them personally.
The Diamonds? Oh no! They must be collecting more humans for the zoo!
But there's loads of humans on Earth. Why are they only grabbing your friends?
Maybe... Because my friends are the best!

column6: The Gems look away in uneasy, when Steven's phone starts buzzing.

column4: It's from Connie! I know where they are!

column6: A photo is sent to Steven's phone, revealing the entrance of Funland, and the Crystal Gems head there immediately.

column4: Stay alert. They could be anywhere.
Did Connie send you any more pictures?
No, nothing.
We know they're here somewhere.

column6: The Gems run on ahead, leaving Steven behind, as he begins whisper-yelling for his friends.

column4: Connie? Lars? Sadie? Onion?  Why them?

column6: Steven tries calling Connie's cellphone, and "Alone Together" is heard in the distance. Steven runs towards the source of the music and finds Connie's phone on the ground. The Crystal Gems also come walking in too, after hearing the music.

column4: W-Was that Connie's pho-

column6: Heavy footsteps is then heard from behind Steven. He peeks behind from the corner of his eyes and spots Topaz peeking out from behind the merry-go-round.

column4: Oh, no! ♪ You found us. ♪

column6: Onion and Sadie peeks out too, mumbling frantically.

column4: Help!
Give it up, Aquamarine! There's nowhere to run!
Oh, what's this, now? Did you think we were running away?
Steven, save yourself... After you save us!
Huh.  You know, now that I think about it, this Steven does seem to know everyone on our list. The list did come from a Steven, after all. Maybe you can help us out.
Just let the humans go!
Uhh, no! Who are these dullards?
We're the Crystal Gems, you chump!
Yeah, yeah. Rose Quartz's old lackeys. That was in the report, too. We're not here for any of you rogue Gems. We'll leave you totally alone... If! You tell us where we can find my dad.
I don't know what you're talking about!
Let's see. Yellow Diamond asked for, uh, my dad, a Connie, a Lars, a Sadie, a mailman, and an Onion, I think. Six human variations specified in a report by Peridot 5XG.

column6: Steven gasps in shock as he flashes back to the time of Marble Madness, when he was talking to Peridot for the first time.

column4: "Oh no, there's lots of humans, there's my dad, Connie, Lars and Sadie, the mailman, Onion... I think."

column6: The brief flashback ends, leaving Steven morbidly horrified.

column4: The list. I gave them the list.
What are you talking about?
Aquamarine doesn't have a dad. She's looking for someone named "my dad"!. This is all my fault.
Don't worry about that now. Our objective's still the same: beat the Gems...
...Save our friends!
Hey Topaz, look! They want to lose another fight.

column6: Garnet charges forth, preparing to make the first strike, when Topaz moves Jamie, merged in her body, right in Garnet's trajectory, causing her to flinch.

column4: No, Garnet, I've moved on, I swear!

column6: Garnet quickly halts herself to avoid hurting Jamie, which however, also allows Topaz to grab her by her head and throws her away, slamming right into a game booth.

column4: Garnet!
That's dirty!
My spear can reach her without hurting the hostages!

column3: ['fires a tractor beam with her wand at Pearl']
column4: Oh, you're so smart.  Goodbye!
Whoa!

column6: Aquamarine hurls Pearl high up into the sky, causing her to disappear into it with a blink. Amethyst then coils her whip around Connie's hand and attempts to pull her out of Topaz's body. Topaz, however, stops her by stomping on the whip with her foot. Garnet emerges from inside the game booth, Pearl lands back from the sky, and the Crystal Gems regroup.

column4: This is getting annoying. Hey, Topaz, can you remind me? I mean, my memory is perfect, but our orders were to bring back these six humans. I'm just not sure. Did they specify... alive?

column6: Aquamarine makes a sinister look at the Crystal Gems, startled by her remark. Aquamarine then quickly takes on an overjoyed expression.

column4: You know, I don't think they did!
Huh?

column6: At Aquamarine's comment, Topaz grips Jamie's head in her hand.

column4: Jamie.
Steven?
I just think, if you care about your "friends" or whatever, you should tell me where "my dad" is, all right?
What are we going to do?! Steven!
Stop! I know where you can find "my dad".
Ooh! Where? Where!?
Right here. I'm the one you're looking for. I am "my dad"!
What?
Huh?
I know what you're thinking, Topaz. It seems a little suspicious that "my dad" is also a "Steven". But you know... If it means getting out of here, I'll believe it.

column6: Topaz instantly unfuses into two Topazes, holding hands while carrying the other humans.

column4: Steven!
Steven, do you know what you're doing?

column6: Steven glances at Pearl and gives a thumbs-up, as the Topazes fuse together with Steven in between, merging him and the other humans in Topaz's body. Only Steven's head is visible from the surface of Topaz's back, along with Lars' half-submerged head and arm.

column4: Oh! Hi, Lars.

column6: Lars shouts in anger, but is muffled, due to his mouth merged in Topaz's body.

column4: Don't worry, I'm gonna bust us all out with my bubble power!

column6: Steven begins straining, while Onion, merged on Topaz's shoulder, murmurs something to Topaz.

column4: Her body's... so thick.  This... might be... a little difficult.

column6: Lars muffle-shouts in anger again, banging on Topaz's back with his free arm.

column4: Time to go!

column6: Aquamarine raises her wand, and a spaceship, disguised as the top of a merry-go-around, activates, floating into the air and opening a door into it.

column4: Uh, Steven, di-did you actually have a plan or-
Just need... a minute...

column6: Topaz leaps onto the ship's door and Aquamarine flies in front of the Crystal Gems to taunt them.

column4: Very nice meeting you all, and your compliance is appreciated, but!-  Our job here is done, so...

column6: Aquamarine blows a raspberry as she flies into her ship. Steven stops straining as he looks around the interior of the ship.

column4: Let's get back to Homeworld already.
But I'm already on my home world. I haven't even delivered all the mail today.
Don't worry. I can do this.

column6: Sadie, Lars and Connie, with their mouths merged in Topaz's body, begin muffle-shouting in panic and anger.

column4: Ohh! You might want to hurry, Steven. The threat of us perishing in this quagmire of yellow feels very real; a real encompassing kind of real. A neon death trap, which has imprisoned us so tightly, like a winter coat that's too big in the sleeves.

column6: Lars flails his hand in Steven's face in his anger.

column4: Lars, stop! I need to concentrate!
Ughh. If I never get sent on another mission to Earth, it'll be too soon. What an ordeal. But the Diamonds needed me. That's the burden of being the best.
What justice is there in such a gross tangling of symbols?!
Will you stop?! You're ruining my moment!
Steven.
I almost got it!
Huh?

column6: Topaz starts sweating and begins expanding like a balloon. She eventually pops, forcefully separated back into two Topazes, as Steven successfully summons his bubble shield. Everyone screams as they are freed from Topaz's imprisonment and scattered around the ship.

column4: What?! Topaz! Get this mess cleaned up. And, Topaz, help her out. I'm setting a course.
The door! Huh?

column6: A Topaz approaches Steven, summons her mace from her gem and swings it at Steven, who quickly blocks it with his shield. At that moment, Lars and Sadie slowly get up.

column4: Lars! Lars?!

column6: Lars whimpers and shivers in fear, as he watches Connie and Steven engaging both Topazes in battle.

column4: Steven, let's fuse!
We're already in the air. How are we going to get back?

column6: A Topaz twirls her mace and swings it with immerse speed and strength at Connie and Steven, who manages to endure the attack inside his bubble shield.

column4: Watch out!

column6: A Topaz swings her mace again hits Steven's bubble away. At that moment, Aquamarine taps on a button on the ship's control panel.

column4: I'd really appreciate you wrapping it up down there before we exit the atmosphere?

column6: Steven and Connie, after being knocked back, slowly gets up, as Steven spots Sadie trying to drag Lars on his foot.

column4: Come on! Lars, you gotta get up! We gotta move!

column6: A Topaz swings her mace at Lars, and Sadie quickly pushes Lars out of the way. The Topaz then grabs Sadie and grasps her in her hand.

column4: Lars! Come on! Help me! Lars!

column6: Lars, paralyzed with fear, gets up, only to run away in cowardice, and hides in the basement of the ship.

column4: Lars...

column6: The Topaz suddenly turns around, blocking an attack from Connie with her mace. At that moment, Sadie bites Topaz's finger, causing her to release her, and Sadie runs towards Connie.

column4: Hey, thanks! Get to the door!
Topaz, pull it together and finish this!

column6: The two Topaz look at each other and approach each other.

column4: Steven?

column6: The two Topaz fuses together back into a big Topaz, in turns fusing their maces together into a pugil stick, and engages Steven and Connie in battle again.

column4: Connie, I'm sorry!
What are you-  -talking about?!

It's my fault you were abducted...  Why everyone was taken. If it weren't for me, the Diamonds wouldn't have come for my friends. If it weren't for my mom, they wouldn't even be trying to destroy the Earth!

column3: ["defends Steven against one of Topaz's attacks"]
column4: Steven!  Focus!

column6: Just now, the entire ship begins to tremble.

column4: What now?
The door.
Right.

column6: Steven runs up to the door switch and opens, revealing Alexandrite outside, holding the ship down.

column4: Alexandrite!
Take us close to the water. We're gonna jump!
What?!
Huh?

column6: Alexandrite pushes the ship down towards the ocean.

column4: Okay-

column6: Onion immediately runs out of the door and plunges into the ocean.

column4: Uhh, go! Go.
Steven, I-I seem to be paralyzed with fear. Whoa!

column6: Steven lifts Jamie up and throws him overboard, as Sadie and Connie jumps off the ship as well. However, Aquamarine then fires her tractor beam, halting Jamie, Sadie, Connie, Onion and Alexandrite in their tracks.

column4: Nice try. But it's hopeless, "my dad". I can't go back to Homeworld without getting what the Diamonds want.

column6: Steven glances down at his friends in peril and begins to confess in defeat.

column4: I'm... not my dad.
What?!
I'm not my dad!
How much longer is this mission going to take?
Well, I can end it for you, right now.
Oh, really?
I'm someone the Diamonds will want more than any of these humans: the leader of the Crystal Gem rebellion; the Gem that shattered Pink Diamond. I'm not my dad. I'm my mom.  I'm Rose Quartz!
No way.

column6: Aquamarine retracts her tractor beam, causing Alexandrite to unfuse, and everyone to drop into the ocean.

column4: Steven?
No, don't! Steven!
What are you doing?!
I get it now. I'm the only one who can stop what she started. I can stop all of it!
You're wrong! Steven, get down here!
She wouldn't have wanted this. But I do.
I'm gonna kick your butt if you don't come down here right now!

column6: Steven turns and walks back into the ship, surrendering himself to Aquamarine and Topaz.

column4: Steven...
No! Don't you dare!
I love you.
No! Stooop!

column6: The door of the ship closes, and the ship blasts off, disappearing into the evening sky.

column4: STEEEVEEEN!
The Rose Quartz. Can you believe it? And she just handed herself in.
That's right. You caught me. Galactic Criminal Rose Quartz. I love shattering Diamonds. I just want to shatter 'em all the time.
You think shattering's bad? Wait till the Diamonds get their hands on you.
At least everyone else is safe.

column6: Just then, the other Topaz brings Lars up from the basement of the ship.

column4: What are you doing? Let go of me!  Steven!
What the- Lars?!
Oh! Looks like we got one of the humans anyway. Don't know what we'll do with just one of them, but I guess that's for the Diamonds to decide.
Wait! Aquamarine, the deal is off! You were only supposed to take me! No humans!  That's a human!
Oh, no. Is Rosie upset 'cause her widdle "deal" didn't work? Look. I'm so moved, I'm crying.  Just kidding. That's my gem. Topaz, what do you think? Should we let her friend go?

column6: The Topazes stand in silence.

column4: I agree.  Go on. Do your thing.
Oh, no, no, no. Not again.

column6: The Topazes begin to fuse together, merging Steven and Lars within their body.

column4: I'll go let the Diamonds know about our little prisoner. Say, Rose, how do I look?
Awful, small, and mean!

column3: ['laughs', "pulls Steven's cheek", 'laughs and flies up to her seat']
column4: Is that how you flattered so many Gems into joining your rebellion? How cute.  Topaz, I trust you'll still be able to fly the ship despite your... you know... additions? * and flies up to her seat*
Steven, this is all your fault. All this weird alien stuff- this is 'cause of you, isn't it?
Yes, of course it is! That's why I turned myself in, to save all of you!
Well, it didn't really work out too well, did it?
Well, everyone else managed to get off the ship. So, where were you?
I ran and hid, Steven, like any sensible person would... do, if they wanted to get trapped on a ship. Oh.
Lars...
Sadie was in trouble, and I didn't do anything. Actually, wait. I did do something. I ran and hid just like I always do. Just like I ran from the potluck.
But you were abducted. That's not your fault.
No, I trashed my roll and ran away. Then I was abducted. Oh, why couldn't I just let people eat my food?!
We have to get you out of here. Here, just leave it to me.  Hey! Look! You have Rose Quartz! Why bother with him! He's worthless!
Thanks a lot, Steven.
No! I meant like "worth less," not "worthless" like... relative to me?
At least I make a great seat cushion. You feeling cozy, you big banana?

column6: Topaz does not respond.

column4: I don't think she's listening. Can you hear me, you- What was it Jamie said? You dangerous yellow coat?
Of course she can't hear you, Steven. She's got those big headphones on.

column6: Steven sighs in defeat, when the ship starts to rumble, causing Topaz to squeeze Lars' head against her seat.

column4: Those Crystal Gems must have screwed up the engine during takeoff. Topaz, go fix it.

column6: Topaz complies and heads to the ship's basement to check on the engine.

column4: Lars, look for something that can help us.

column6: Lars grunts in pain, having be squeezed on Topaz's seat. Topaz begins operating the engine control panel, when Steven spots something nearby.

column4: A destabilizer. That's perfect!
A destaba-what?
It's a weapon that disrupts a Gem's physical form.
Cool. Thanks for explaining. I still don't know what that means.
Just hear me out. I have a plan. I'm gonna need you to be my arms.
Ugh. Fine.
Lars, pull my pants off.
What?!
Trust me! I'm trying to save you.
What if I don't want to be saved? What if I want to stay trapped here and fly around space, and why your pants, you weirdo?!
Just do it!

column6: Lars begrudging complies and removes Steven's pants off of him.

column4: Ugh. There. I did it.
Great. Now tie one of the legs into a lasso.
I can't. They're on the floor.
What are they doing on the floor?!
I don't know, Steven. What are we doing in space?
Lars, pick them up and then tie them into a lasso.
Ugh. Fine.  Wow. It worked. We're back home. Great plan.
Now lasso the destabilizer.
I still don't know what that is.
That. That thing! Come on, Lars. You can do it!
Ugh. Fine.

column6: Lars swings the lasso half-heartedly, knowing he cannot reach the destabilizer.

column4: Come on. Just one more try.
I don't want to try again.
Lars, throw the lasso!
Fine!

column6: Lars crumbles Steven's pants and throws it at the destabilizer rack, which was already out of reach.

column4: What is your problem, Lars?! Why did you do that?!

Why do you think I'm capable of anything?! You think I can do all this stuff, but I can't! I can't because... I'm a wuss, Steven. I'm just...  ...afraid. I've always just been stupid and afraid.  Not like you. You're always helping people. You're never afraid.
Lars... I'm afraid right now.

column6: Lars turns to look at Steven.

column4: I thought if I turned myself in, it'd fix everything, but... I don't want to do this, Lars. I've been to space before, but not like this. They're taking me straight to their terrible leaders that want to destroy Earth and destroy me for something I never even did. I just wanted to save everyone, but I couldn't even do that because, look, you're still here.
Steven...
I'm sorry. I don't know how I'm gonna get you out of this.
We'll... figure it out. We've got like... a billion light-years till we get there, right?
For the first time ever, you're gonna look on the bright side? Y-You don't have to sugarcoat this, but come on, you never do that. You're always real with me about how much everything sucks.
Okay. You're right. This is really, really messed up, Steven.
You know what's even more messed up? Even though you're in huge trouble and it's all my fault...  I'm kind of glad you're here? I... I don't want to be alone right now.  Isn't that awful?
Dude, At this point, everything is awful.

column6: Steven and Lars tear up and chuckle together.

column4: I'd give you a hug, but I can't use my arms.
I could try using my legs, but it might be weird.

column6: Just then, Topaz begins to cry too.

column4: That's so, so beautiful.  Even in the clutches of certain doom... You're happy to have each other.

column6: Lars gasps in surprise.

column4: T-T-Topaz.
I don't know what Topaz would do if she didn't have Topaz. I've always wanted to tell me how I'm helping me through this, but there's always someone between us!

column6: Steven looks away in awkward.

column4: They're always sending me on these miserable missions.  I'm always pretending I'm fine with it.  I have to pretend I'm fine. But you two... You're so honest and open... so...  I wanna help you guys. What do you need?
A way off this ship. And my pants.
All right. You can use this escape pod.  I'll set the coordinates for Earth.
All right, Lars, just get in and let it do its thing.
Guh. What are you talking about? You're coming, right?
I can't. I turned myself in. I still got to go. Someone's got to pay for what my mom did.
But you don't want to do this? Dude, forget it. Let's just go.
I-
Topaz, what are you still doing down here, you big boulder? We're almost to Homeworld.

column6: Aquamarine flies down into the basement, and Topaz gasps in shock, being caught in the act.

column4: What... are... you... doing?
Look, I can explain. Um, they had this whole heartfelt thing about being there for each other, and you missed it. It was so moving.

column6: Aquamarine pulls out her wand and points it at Topaz.

column4: No! Wait!

column6: Aquamarine fires a tractor fire, which Topaz jumps out of the way, and hits the escape pod instead.

column4: I can't see what's happening. Are we still escaping?
No! Nobody's escaping!

column6: Aquamarine hurls the escape pod at a wall, poofing it away.

column4: Aquamarine, let's talk about this.
Yeah, I-I bet you don't really want to hurt us. You -- You probably just act mean because deep down you're afraid you're weak. Go ahead. Let it out. We're all sharing right now.

column6: Aquamarine glares at Steven in perplexity, unshaken by Steven's statement, and quickly begins to lecture Topaz again.

column4: Topaz, you had one job, and if you're not gonna do it, you're of no use to me!

column6: Topaz whimpers as Aquamarine prepares to fire her wand again. Topaz then notices the destabilizers, quickly grabs one, and pins Aquamarine against the engine control panel. Steven and Lars watch on in shock and surprise.
