column4: Aah!

column6: Lars loses his balance and falls onto the back, and Steven tumbles out of his head. Lars groans as he and Steven get up.

column4: Sorry, Lars.
So what happened? What's in my head?
Home.
Wha?
Everyone, I've made an amazing discovery! I just traveled back to planet Earth by going through Lars' head!
You went back to Earth? What the heck? Is my head like a wormhole?

No, it's way simpler than that. You see, I have a pink pet lion who belonged to my mom when she was still here, and it turns out I can go into his mane, and it transports me to a magical dimension where my mom kept a bunch of artifacts on a hill with a tree, and for some reason, I can't breathe in there. But anyway, when I went into Lars' head, I got transported to the same magical dimension, but it was a new part of it, but since the two are connected, I could reach the portal that leads out of Lion's mane, which is back on Earth!
Uhh...
Here, I brought you some food.
Huh? Thanks, but I-I'll save it for later.
But, aren't you hungry? Maybe you only eat magical lizards now like Lion. A-Are you hungry for lizards?
No, I do not want a lizard.
But you haven't eaten in days.
I know. There must be pink magic in my guts now or something.
What is this box?
It's juice. We drink it back on Earth.
What?
That's impossible.
Earth?
There's no way.
Unh-unh.
Steven's back.
That can't be. I'm incredulous.
Why can't it be?
Everyone...knows...that...the Earth...
Was decimated by the Diamond attack! Sorry.

column3: ['holds up bag of a chips', 'holds up a sandwich']
column4: It's not like that. The Diamonds did attack, but there are still Gems living on Earth, and the planet's full of life.  It grew the potatoes that became these chips.  And grew the wheat that eventually became the flour that eventually became the bread that eventually became this sandwich!
Sand... wich?
But why would Gems still live there?
Because the Earth is a place where we can be ourselves. We can live freely without having to hide who we are.
Live freely? Without, having to hide?
That...sounds...won...derful...
It is. And now that we have this portal, we can all go there.
All? How am I supposed to go through my own head?
Ohh... Hmm...

column6: Steven tries pulling Lars' arm and the rest of his body into the dimension through his own hair.

column4: Stop! You're gonna break my elbow!
Okay, so that didn't work, but I'm sure there's another way.

No, no, look. I get it. Everyone just go, and I'll stay here. There's no other way out. I'm it. The Earth is way better than this. There's no robots flying around. Just seagulls that fly in front of the sunset and it's beautiful! Just go, you'll see. I took it for granted, so don't pass up this chance!
Well, if you insist.

column6: Rhodonite begins walking forward, but the Rutile Twins stop her.

column4: We...won't...do it. ...Not if it means...leaving you...behind...
What?! I'm trying to perform a beautiful act over here.
We...know...this...planet. ...We've...been...hiding in these tunnels...for eons. ...You'll...need us...to help you...get around. ...Besides, ...us...Off-Colors...stick...together.
We'll get to Earth another way. We'll find an alternate route.
But you've got to go back.
But it doesn't feel right to just leave you here.
You said yourself that everyone on this planet is out to get you. You won't be safe until you're back on Earth.
But, Lars-
Don't argue with me! You're always trying to help me. You brought me back to life. Just... Let me be somebody who deserved it.
All right, I'll tell everyone you're okay. I'll be back. I can bring whatever you need. Be careful, okay?
We...will...
We can't leave without Lars!
We'll see you on Earth, I hope. No, no, no. We will!

column6: Steven places his hand on Lars' chest. Lars pushes his hand out of the way and hugs Steven instead, who embraces him in return.

column4: Umm... If you could just...
Oh, yeah.

column6: Lars bends his head down to Steven.
Steven climbs back out Lion's mane, just as the Crystal Gems, Connie, and Greg shortly warp in on the Crystal Temple Warp Pad, still depressed over Steven's surrender.

column4: This is hopeless.

column6: Steven gasps in surprise.

column4: We'll never get that dropship to fly, and we're losing time! Who knows what they're doing to Steven. Hi Steven. What are we going to d-
I'm back!

column6: Everyone reacts in sheer joy and surprise at Steven's return, and they all rush to embrace Steven. The star iris then closes on Steven's face, overjoyed to be back home.

column4: We'll be fine! I'll be right back. I'm just gonna walk Connie out. Don't worry! I'm not going back into space or anything.  They're never gonna let me out of their sight again. Connie?

column6: Lion glares intently at Steven, when Connie walks off ahead. Steven and Lion run up to catch up with her.

column4: Connie! I know you got to get home and get some sleep, but once you're all rested up, I can't wait to tell you about everything! Being on Homeworld was crazy! After I turned myself in, they put me on trial! And Lars was there. We got chased by killer robots. Heh, what a wild ride that was! And uh... I'm really happy to see you again.

column6: Steven grows concerned with Connie's silence.

column4: Umm... A-Are you happy to see me, too?
Of course I'm happy to see you, Steven.
Uhh, but?

column6: Lion walks up to Connie's side, still glaring at Steven.

column4: But how could you just give yourself up like that?
Well, first, I said I was my dad, and then I said I was my mom.
No. I mean, you just gave up.
I had to. They were gonna take all those people. They were gonna take you!
But what about our training? Stevonnie. Jam buds. I believed in us. We could have done it together.
This is different. This whole thing was my fault, but I knew that I could fix it all if I turned myself in. And look! No one got hurt. Well, except for Lars, but I saved him, too.
But... I'm hurt.
No, you're not. You're safe. You're here. I'm here. We're safe. Everything's fine.
...It's not, though.

column6: Connie rides on Lion as they approach towards the sea.

column4: You know, it was a tough decision for me to make, but it had to be done.
You don't get it.
...Get what?

column6: Connie lowers her head in disappointment.

column4: Let's go, Lion.

column6: Lion glares disapprovingly at Steven, runs over the water, and warps away through his magical portal with Connie, as Steven watches on in perplexity.

column4: "Wow, Steven, that was so brave of you. I'm so glad you're back."

column5: Trans. Int. The Big Donut, The Next Day

column6: The next day, Steven goes to break the news with Sadie.

column4: What?!  And Lars is still in space?!
Yeah, he is, but don't worry. He's with some very nice Gems who are on the run from their Homeworld overlords.
Oh, Laaaars...
Sadie, he's fine. We can go see him anytime through Lion.
Glad he's not- At least he's some kind of... alive? You... told his parents, right...?
You're kind of my practice run for that.

column6: Steven and Sadie exit the Big Donut.

column4: Let's do this quick. I can't be away from work too long. I'm basically their only employee now.

column6: As they begin walking on the boardwalk, Steven and Sadie encounter a protest crowd in front of Fish Stew Pizza.

column4: Whoa, what's going on?
We're sick of it!

column6: Steven and Sadie push their way through the crowd and witness the lead advocate, who turns out to be Nanefua Pizza, standing on a soapbox and speaking through a megaphone.

column4: Am I right about it?! Aliens nearly abducted the whole town. And what did Mayor "Billiam" Dewey do about it?

column6: A Beach City citizen scratches his head and shrugs.

column4: That is right! Jack, and squat!

column6: The crowd resumes shouting, while Steven watch on anxiously.

column4: Steven, I'm going to Lars' parents' house.
Okay, I'll catch up with you.
And that is why you should vote for me, your favorite Nanefua, for mayor of Beach City!

column6: The crowd cheers in favor.

column4: When I say "Do we want Dewey?", you say "No." Do we want Dewey?
No!
Do we want Dewey?
No!
Okay, good job.

column3: ['types a message for Connie on his phone']
column4: Hmm...  "Can't hang today. Mayor D's getting blamed for Gem stuff, and it's totally my fault."

column6: Steven pays a visit to Mayor Dewey in his office, as he looks on at the protesters outside his window.

column4: I don't know, Universe. This doesn't look good.
How's this?

column6: Steven holds up his own protest sign that reads "Dewey's Great ♡".

column4: Oh. That looks great! But I may need more. My gosh. I've never had an opponent before. Even when I ran for mayor of high school, I ran unopposed. Probably because... I made up the position.
If only I could've warned you about this abduction stuff sooner, then everything would be fine now. I really dropped the ball.
You're right, Universe. This is all your fault. Huh.
How about we call an impromptu town meeting on the boardwalk? I'll tell everyone what happened and how you weren't involved at all, and everyone'll feel better and vote for you in the next election.
All right, Universe. The ball's back in your court. Just, uh... don't drop it again, huh?

column6: Mayor Dewey drives Steven in his van onto the boardwalk, and Steven begins speaking to the crowd through a megaphone.

column4: So, in conclusion, Mayor Dewey had nothing whatsoever to do with the abductions. Everything was my fault because I unknowingly provided some space Gems with a list of names and put everyone in danger. Mayor Dewey would never do anything to purposefully endanger the town. He basically just keeps a low profile and doesn't get involved in much of anything.
Yeah, maybe he should be involved!
He's the mayor!

column6: The crowd cries out in disapproval.

column4: Thanks for listening, and please vote for him in the next Beach City mayoral election.

column3: ['grabs the megaphone from Steven', 'wipes off his sweat, splashing them onto Steven']
column4: Oh, ho, ho, yeah!  Hello, everyone. Thanks for coming. Wow! This whole abduction business was a real close call, huh?  Woo. But look around you. Everyone is safe and accounted for.
That's not true! What about my friend Lars?
Who?

What? Lars! Lars Barriga?! Mr. and Mrs. Barriga's son! Did you even know he was still missing? Did you know he was still somewhere in SPACE?! WHAT KIND OF MAYOR DOESN'T KNOW WHEN HIS OWN PEOPLE ARE LOST IN SPACE?!?!

column6: Dante, Martha and Sadie begins to tear up in anger.

column4: The donut boy?  Is that why the donut shop was closed this morning?
Yeah, but-
Do not, worry! I will do everything in my power to hire a new donut boy.

column6: The crowd boos at Mayor Dewey's proposal.

column4: No!
You've got to be kidding me!

column6: Martha throws a tomato right into Mayor Dewey's face.
Steven shows Mayor Dewey a looped video of Mayor Dewey getting tomato'd in the face on his phone.

column4: How did this get on the Internet so fast? I didn't invite any press to this event.
Someone posted it on TubeTube. Only 12 people have seen it.
12 people?! That's half the town! I'm finished, Universe. I don't know of many political figures that have made a comeback after getting a tomato to the face.

column6: Mayor Dewey takes Steven's phone and watches the video in somber.

column4: Oh, again, and again, and again, and again.
You need to stop looping that! Look, we're gonna get through this together, okay? Tomorrow is the big debate. You still have one more chance to win back the town's love.
But Steven, some of the things people have been saying about me are really painful and mean.
We've just got to change the conversation. We can start, with this.
"How to talk to people"?
I'm going to get you ready for that debate, even if it takes all night.

column5: Trans. Beach City Stage; The Next Day

column6: A stage is set up on the beach with a banner reading "Speech-A-Palooza". A crowd is gathered in front of it, murmuring to themselves. Steven and Mayor Dewey are seen at the side of the stage, with visible eye bags beneath their eyes.

column4: All right.  Today's the day. You got your note cards, you look great, and if anyone brings up the alien invasion thing, I wrote a bunch of Ocean Town jokes for you to use.
Aww, shucks, Universe. You're like the son I never had.
You... have a son.
I know that. You're... just very different from him, is all.

column6: The crowd begins chanting "Speech!", Mayor Dewey whines in anxiety and Steven offers a hug to Mayor Dewey.

column4: I'm rooting for you, Dew Drops.
Thanks.

column6: The crowd keeps chanting as Mayor Dewey and Nanefua take their stands on-stage. The curtains then rise and the crowd quickly shushes themselves.

column4: People of Beach City. You might think that being a mayor is a fine and glamorous sort of thing. I can understand why my opponent would want the position. But I've been mayor of this city for a decade, and I know some things that Ms. Nanefua does not. You see, when you're the mayor, you get blamed for everything. When the boardwalk has termites, it's the mayor's fault. When aliens steal people, it's the mayor's fault. When the mayor crashes the mayor mobile into the only cell tower in town, it's the mayor's fault. Most people can't handle that kind of pressure, but I can! So, I say to you, Beach City citizens, just enjoy our wonderful ocean breeze and don't worry about a thing. Just let Dewey "do it" for you!

column6: The crowd murmurs among themselves, but approves of the statement and lightly applauds.

column4: Nice!
You know, Mayor Dewey, you are right.
I am? A-About what?
I have blamed you for too many things, and that is not helping.

column6: The crowd begins murmuring among themselves.

column4: What?

Blaming our problems completely on the mayor is not getting us anywhere. When one of us suffers, the town suffers. When you suffer, Mayor Billiam, the town suffers. So, no longer will I point my fingers at you. I will extend all my fingers on both my hands to everyone here today and ask that we share responsibility for the welfare and safety of Beach City, together! Thank you.

column6: The crowd cheers heavily and begins chanting for "Nanefua".

column4: You got this, Mayor Dewey.

column6: Mayor Dewey stammers, accidentally slips his notes everywhere, and attempts to read one of the notes provided.

column4: Uhh... Did you ever notice how people from Ocean... Town- Oh, who am I kidding? Beach City deserves a real mayor. Someone wise and collected like Ms. Nanefua.

column6: The crowd murmurs among themselves again.

column4: Wait. No, no-no!
I withdraw from the race.  You can find the key to the city under the... city welcome mat.

column6: The crowd cheers as Bill Dewey, resigning his position as Mayor, walks offstage sighing. A shocked Steven then chases after Bill Dewey.

column4: Mayor Dewey, what're you doing?! Y-You can't just throw the election like that. W-We could still win!
Well, I know it's not very traditional to do that in the middle of a debate, but, why drag it out?
We could have won! I- I really believed in you! I really believed in us!
Well, you were wrong. What do you want me to say?
How about, "I'm sorry. We were in this together, and I let you down"?
Come on, Universe. You know she's gonna be a better mayor than me. It was the right thing to do.
I guess, but... I still feel... betrayed. ...That's probably how Connie feels.
Yeah, I don't know what you're talking about, but I've got to find a new job.

column6: Bill Dewey walks off, humming a tune to himself. Steven then gets out his phone as he attempts to call Connie.
Back at home, Steven glances at a photo of Connie in his room, as he still desperately waits for Connie's answer on his phone, to no avail.
Steven is sitting on a chair outside of the car wash, reading his own texts while texting on his phone.

column4: "Hey, Connie. How are you today?" "Hope everything's going okay." "It'd be cool if you told me it was..." "I guess I miss you." "I know yesterday I said, "I guess" but I mean," "I do miss you..." "Hope you didn't get your phone mixed up with a tennis ball. Ha ha." A tennis ball? Really, Universe?!
Help! Ah! Yah! Back!

column6: Greg is then seen struggling to remove a water hose that is tangled around himself.

column4: Ugh! Hey, uh, Steve-aroni, ughh, want to help your old Pa over here?
Uh, yeah, Dad, one sec.

column6: Steven reluctantly sends a final text to Connie, reading "Please talk to me."

column4: Sorry. Sorry. I'm on it.

column6: Steven runs up to Greg and bites off a piece of the hose, freeing Greg.

column4: Are you good? Are you safe? Do you still love me?
Yeah, of- of course, buddy. It's just some hoses. I can buy new ones. I still have like... 9 million dollars left, and what better way to spend that than on some hoses, right, kiddo?
Yeah, Dad.

column6: Steven's cellphone vibrates and gasps in shock. He holds out his phone and reluctantly checks it, only to see a text from Ronaldo.

column4: "STEVEEEN! So. Did you ever get around to watching the "Koala Princess" box set I lent you three months ago?"

column6: Steven sighs in dismay.

column4: Hey, is... everything okay? You're looking a little glum.
I am a little glum.
Do you want to talk about it?
Umm... It's just... space lag... from when I went to space.
Hmm...

column3: ['throws the plate and soap bottle away in surprise']
column4: Ah!  Waahh!

column6: Steven reaches for his phone but then pauses himself.

column4: Wait. No. I need to play it cool.

column6: Steven casually flips over his phone and eagerly checks his phone screen.

column4: "I'm just gonna assume by your silence that you're entangled within the immersive koala lore of the show." "Did you get to the part where Koala Princess and Kanga-Roofus kiss?"

column6: Disappointed, Steven puts down his phone, when he hears Greg's voice from outside.

column4: Steven, you want to help us with these... groceries?
Coming.

column6: Greg and the Crystal Gems walk in,each carrying some groceries.

column4: Eh? Eh?
spits out an egg, with normal voice again* It's farm fresh.
Uhh... Thanks guys, but the fridge is full.
Not the fridge at our vacation house!

column6: Greg pulls a confetti popper as the Gems clap and cheer.

column4: Whoo! Vacation!
I thought, "Why spend money on hoses when I can spend it on houses?" So I found a place we could rent for the weekend by searching online.

column6: Greg holds up his phone, displaying an image of their vacation house with a four star rating.

column4: Back in the old days, we just went door-to-door hoping one was unlocked. But, this is the new days!
Okay. Well, have fun.
Uh, Steven, you're going on vacation, too.
Oh, yes. This is the perfect time for a vacation- I mean, how often are we on the same planet together?
Yeah. And you'll be with your favorite Gems, and your favorite dad.
Agree with Amethyst. Turn to Steven. Steven, you should go. No, with more enthusiasm. Steven, it's a vacation!
I mean, I would, but I'm really tied up with something important.

column6: Steven checks his phone again, as more texts keep appearing from Ronaldo.

column4: "In the end, the wombats were for naught." "But it really makes you think-"
I'll go.
Aced it!

column6: Greg drives Steven and the Gems in his van up to the front of their vacation house, while Steven's eyes is fixated onto his phone.

column4: Here it is, temporary home sweet temporary home.

column6: Everyone gets out and begins unloading the van; Steven observes Garnet and Amethyst carrying a mattress in the house.

column4: Is that my bed?
Yeah. I want you to be as comfortable as possible, finally have some family time. I feel... like you haven't had that in a while.
Yeah, maybe.
This place is great! They have one of those refrigerators that dispense water, not to mention four windows, and an analog clock!
Hmm, says here we can't use the water dispenser or the clock. Windows must be kept closed at all times, and remove all shoes before entering. Hmm.

column6: Pearl notices a pair of shoes outside the house. She picks them up and throws them away, before walking inside the house. Amethyst then peeks out through the doorway.

column4: Hey, Greg, did you invite anyone else? Party guy, about three feet long, hissing, reptilian?
Well... You might want to factor in a plus-one.
Oh! Party guy! No!

column6: Hissing and clashing noises are heard from within the house.

column4: I promise. It's gonna be a really good time.
It's a great place, Dad.

column6: Steven, Greg, and the Gems are gathered outside, lounging and barbecuing.

column4: It only bit Pearl once, but, like, we're Gems. She'll be okay.
It isn't the pain. It's the surprise.

column6: Greg and Amethyst glance over to Steven, who is still engrossed on his phone.

column4: Hey, Amethyst, do you think you could...

column3: ['walks over and sits down beside Steven']
column4: Yeah!  Hey, Steven.
Hi, Amethyst.
Man, you can see the stars so clearly out here. It's pretty, huh?
Huh? Uh, I don't know.  It's... okay.
Hey, hey. It's okay, if it isn't okay.
The sky?
Yeah.
What?
I don't know. So, uh, you really into phones now?
No.

column6: Steven nervously puts his phone away. Amethyst looks at Greg and shrugs.
Still staring at his phone, Steven bumps into the door inside the house, and opens it to walk outside, when Greg and Garnet, sitting in a hot tub, greet him.

column4: Hey, Schtu-ball! Won't you take my place? I've been in here way too long. I'm gonna become a raisin.

column6: Greg winks at Garnet before climbing out and walking away.

column4: Steven, you should join me. Become a raisin.
Okay, but one sec.

column6: Steven walks away and returns with his phone in a ziplock bag, and climbs into the tub with his clothes still on.

column4: Steven, I know what's troubling you.
You do?  Gosh. I really messed up, didn't I?
You didn't do anything wrong. Pink Diamond was a villain.

column6: Steven's relief quickly fades, as Garnet attempts to weave another epic tale, cuing a flashback of the Crystal Gems facing off a massive Gem, presumably Pink Diamond.

column4: It was 5,750 years ago. Pink Diamond was ravishing the planet-
Yeah, I know.

column6: The flashback abruptly ends.

column4: Oh.
Pink Diamond was bad. Everything bad had to happen so good things could kind of happen.
Uh, good. You understand.

column6: Steven is rocking back and forth on a chair outside the house, still fixated on his phone.

column4: Buzz. Buzz. At least wiggle a little.
Come on. Can't you give it another shot?

column6: Overhearing the others inside the house, Steven approaches the door and peeks inside.

column4: What are we supposed to do? He just doesn't want to talk about it.

But... I know it's not space lag. This is some Gem thing he knows I won't understand. I don't know anything about Homeworld. I don't know anything about your society. Whatever horrible things he saw out there, you guys have to put it into context.
If Steven won't talk to us, then the help we can give him is limited. We've all tried to coax it out of him, except for...
Me? But I have no idea what Homeworld is like now.
Pearl, please.
He knows you know about space stuff.
It can't hurt to try.

column6: Pearl walks toward the door, prompting Steven to quickly move away.

column4: Mmm!

column6: Steven sits down on the porch, pretending to stare at his phone, as Pearl steps outside.

column4: Heh, it sure is quiet out here, huh?
Yeah.
So... Homeworld... I always hoped you'd see it some day, but I thought I'd be there with you. Being taken there... as a prisoner, I suppose it was something of a... traumatic experience...?

column6: Pearl glances down at Steven, still on his phone.

column4: It's just... next to Steven* Steven, I'm sure you have a lot of questions you'd like answers to, like about the Diamonds, for instance? There are things that are... impossible for me to explain. But I want to. I-

column6: Pearl almost instantly, seemingly involuntarily, covers her mouth before she can speak, as Steven grows increasingly distressed. Pearl tries to pull her hand off her hands with her other hand.

column4: Steven, I-
Connie hates me!
... Wha?

column6: Greg, Garnet, and Amethyst suddenly burst through the door.

column4: We weren't listening.
Also continue, Steven.

I'm not upset about what happened on Homeworld although, yeah, a lot of that was really messed up. But my relationship with Connie is even more messed up. I left her behind to go to Homeworld after promising we'd face everything together. I'm sure I really hurt her. I've been calling and texting her for a week, but she hasn't responded once.  Connie might never talk to me again.

column6: Steven runs away crying.

column4: Steven!
I'll go get him. I don't know anything about Homeworld, but I know about this.

column6: Greg begins searching for Steven, who is seen cowering behind a pair of  barrels.

column4: Steven? Steven?
Steven's not here.
Oh, that's too bad. So, I guess I'll just talk to this Steven-shaped barrel instead.
If you must.
Schtu-ball, if this was about Connie, why didn't you say anything sooner?
I was... embarra...
You were... embroidered? Embroiled? Emboldened to talk to your old man about your problems?
I was embarrassed, okay!? You and the Gems all like Connie, and I was worried that if you heard what happened then... You'd be mad at me too.

Oh, Steven, of course we're not mad. And I'm sure Connie's not mad, either. Well, at least I'm sure she doesn't hate you. That whole handing-yourself-over-to-Homeworld thing was definitely a high-stress situation. It really scared all of us. I'm not exactly over it either, but I guess carting you off to the middle of nowhere to spend time with you is my way of dealing with it. Maybe having some distance from you is Connie's way.
But the last thing I did was send her a bunch of dumb texts. I made some weird joke about tennis, and I don't even know if it makes sense, an-
Tennis?
See? No wonder she hasn't responded.
Uhh, Steven? You don't get any service out here.
...What are you even telling me? Maybe she's been trying to get in touch with me this whole time, and I haven't seen it! What if she thinks I'm ignoring her? Dad! We have to find cell service.
Right!

column6: Steven gets into Greg's van and signals the Gems to get in.

column4: Go, go, go!
Okay.

column6: Steven buckles his seat belt and holds out his phone.

column4: Floor it!

column6: Greg steps on the accelerator panel and begins driving away from Cool Ranch.

column4: How we doing?

column3: ['observing the signal bars on his phone']
column4: Take a right!

column6: Greg turns the van right, driving it off-road.

column4: Nah, back up. No, wait! Keep going!

column6: The signal begins to improve.

column4: We're heading for a cliff, buddy.
Just a little further.
Gonna have to stop soon.
Almost got it!
Ahh!

column6: Greg stops the van just before the edge of the cliff. He sighs in  relief as Steven climbs onto the roof of the van.

column4: Come on. Come on. Come on. (Steven's phone finally receives full reception.) Yes! We've got service!

column6: A new message pops up on Steven's phone and Steven gasps in surprise. He opens it only to find...

column4: "Steven! When I didn't hear back from you, I was sure a nefarious plot was afoot-"

column3: ['peeks up at the roof of the van']
column4: Well?
...No. No messages from Connie.

column6: Greg climbs up onto the roof and sits down beside Steven, who quickly falls over onto Greg's lap in remorse.

column4: Aww. You'll get through this, buddy. I know it hurts now, but... give it time.
I know. I need to let it go.

column6: The Gems then peeks up at the roof too.

column4: Got room for three more?
Always.

column6: The Gems climb atop and join Steven and Greg on the roof.

column4: Nice night, isn't it?
...Yeah.

column6: Steven is seen looking in despair at a photo of Connie on the shelf in his room. He slumps against the wall and lies onto his bed, sighing in remorse.

column4: She'll call when she's ready. For now, you just have to let go.

column6: Steven lifts himself up and keeps his phone. He then hops off his bed and glances at his ukulele by his bed.

column4: ♪ I wish I could tell you that I-

column6: Steven's phone suddenly starts buzzing, interrupting his song, and Steven, startled, screams as he fumbles to take his phone out of his pocket.

column4: Okay, Universe. This is it! Connie's finally ready to talk. No expectations. Just let her say what she needs to say!

column6: Steven looks down at his phone, only to realize that it is actually Peridot who is video-calling him. Steven sighs in dismay and answers her call.

column4: Steven!  It's us!

column6: Lapis comes into frame.

column4: Oh, hi, Peridot. Hi, Lapis.
Don't forget Pumpkin!

column6: Peridot holds up Pumpkin and she barks excitedly.

column4: Hi, Pumpkin!
I told you he'd answer.
It's so good to see you. I'm glad you're okay.
Lapis was worried you lost your phone on Homeworld, but I said, "No way! He's probably just ignoring us."
Sorry, guys. There's been... a lot going on.
Like what? Tell us!
Well, Connie's really mad at me-
No, no, no, no. Tell us about space!
And start from the beginning.
Uhh, ok. I was trying to protect Beach City, so I surrendered myself to Homeworld, and I was put in a big, empty room, and I ended up on trial in front of the Diamonds!
On trial?!
What?
In front of the Diamonds?!
Yeah, and...
You were in front of Blue Diamond?!
And Yellow! But it's okay. I escaped in a palanquin and went underground and...
You ran from Blue and Yellow Diamond!?
Yes.
Peridot, We have to leave Earth, now!

column6: Lapis quickly hangs up the video call.

column4: Uh-oh...

column6: Peridot, Lapis, and Pumpkin are seen standing outside the barn, while Pumpkin is barking frantically.

column4: Wait. We can't leave. What about all our crops?

column6: Steven comes running in towards Lapis and Peridot from behind.

column4: Guys?
Ughh. The vegetables will have to deal.
Okay, okay, but, uhh... We're only half-way through our rewatch of "CPH" Season four.
We'll bring the box set with us.
...But, how are we gonna watch it without the TV?
We'll bring the TV.
Uhh, Lapis?
Huh?
Peridot?
Oh, Steven. Good. Let's go.
Wait, what?
We'll find some remote spot in the universe to hide out in. The Diamonds will never find us.
Lapis, don't worry. They're looking for me on Homeworld. They don't know I'm here. We're safe.
Yeah! Come on, we've gotten away with worse. They've never been able to hunt me down for my many crimes against them.

column3: ["puts her hand on Peridot's shoulder", "grasps Peridot's shoulder tightly"]
column4: This is different! Steven is important, and our transgressions are piling up!  They're going to take their anger out on this planet, just like they did before. I can't.  I won't let myself get caught up in another war.

column6: Pumpkin hides behind Peridot, whimpering anxiously.

column4: I don't want you to leave, but, I won't ask you guys to stay if you don't feel safe. If you have to go... I understand.
...Right. Peridot, if you want the TV, levitate it over here.
Hey, umm-

column6: Peridot runs inside the barn and returns, struggling to carry a "meep morp" in her arms.

column4: What about our meep morps we've made? We can't leave them behind.

column6: Peridot loses her balance and drops the meep morp.

column4: We can bring them, too.
But they're installations! They need the context of the barn! If- If-if we move them, they'll become... performance pieces.
There's no need to get so emotional!

column6: Peridot steps back in shock.

column4: You're right. I'm sorry.
It's okay. Performance art isn't bad, just misunderstood.
Hmm... Maybe I can do something.

column6: Lapis walks out past Steven and Peridot and turns towards the barn. She begins using her water abilities to seemingly drain the water from the pool outside of the barn.

column4: Ga-hah! Our smaller-than-average lake! Guh!

column6: A water wall begins to emerge from the ground around the barn, as Lapis uses the water to separate the barn away from the ground and raises it in the air.

column4: Whoa.
There! Now we can bring our whole life with us: You, me, and all of our things!
Right... Right!
Well, let's get going.
You're leaving right now? I thought that- I-I don't know what to say.

column6: Lapis' expression saddens and she walks towards Steven to give him a hug.

column4: Goodbye, Steven.

column6: Steven sniffles as he starts sobbing.

column4: Good luck. *turns to Peridot Peridot, don't you want to say bye?
Uhh...

column6: Peridot starts tearing up, and Steven whimpers in sadness.

column4: Umm...  Wait! Where's Pumpkin?
She's not inside?
She was just standing next to me! We have to find her.

column6: Lapis lowers the barn back onto the ground and refills the pool with water again.

column4: I'll check from above. Peridot, you search the ground.
I'll help, too!

column6: Steven and Peridot start running towards the farm field.

column4: Pumpkin!?
Pumpkin?
Pumpkin! Pumpkin!
Pumpkin? Pumpkin!
Pumpkin?
Pumpkin?
Pumpkin?
Pumpkin.

column6: Steven walks slowly to the top of a hill.

column4: Pumpkin! Where are you, buddy?

column6: Peridot runs frantically up the hill and passes Steven.

column4: Pumpkin!

column6: Peridot turns back to Steven, looking distressed. The pair then begins searching through a wooded area.

column4: You know, I'm really gonna miss you guys when you're in space.
Well, that's a given. I'm a very precious Gem. Without me, you would've crumbled under The Cluster's destructive force or have been smushed by Jasper. I'm --
Peridot, There!

column6: Steven points to an orange unidentified object on the ground and Peridot runs towards it.

column4: Pumpkin!

column6: Peridot picks up the object, but quickly realizes is a basketball.

column4: Is she okay?
Umm...

column6: Peridot and Steven continue walking and searching for Pumpkin, while Steven dribbles the basketball.

column4: Pumpkin!
Pumpkin!
Pumpkin!
Pumpkin!

column6: As Peridot begins to speak, Steven stops dribbling the basketball.

column4: You know, I can probably still help you when I'm out in space. I'll just video-chat from my tablet!
Uhh, t-there's no Wi-Fi in space.
...Well, maybe it's best if we can't reach you. If the Diamonds do show up and destroy the planet, we'll never know!

column6: Peridot looks to Steven with uncertainty, as he looks back with unknowing concern.

column4: Lapis was very agitated when she heard you were on Homeworld. I was bending over backwards to make her feel better. Watch this.

column6: Peridot proceeds to literally bend over backwards in a very unnatural way.

column4: That is good.
Oh, yeah. She loves this.

column6: Steven and Peridot walks out of the woods.

column4: Maybe it's good that we'll be away from everything where nothing can change, no surprises or developments. She's been through so much. She needs consistency.
But what about you?

column6: Peridot looks down, questioning in uncertainty, when she jumps and clings onto Steven, causing him to drop the basketball.

column4: Another Kindergartener!

column6: Steven notices a produce stand in front of them and reads the sign at the stand.

column4: "Fresh produce"? Pumpkin is fresh produce!

column6: Peridot and Steven run towards the stand, breathing and gasping heavily in fear.

column4: It's just... onions?
Pumpkin would never associate with this inferior sphere.

column6: Onion suddenly pops out from behind the stand, frightening Steven and Peridot as they scream loudly.

column4: Uhh... Onion? What are y- Hey, is that my hat?

column6: Onion ducks back and hides behind the stand.
Steven and Peridot returns back to the barn in disappointment.

column4: Well, that was a bust.
We'll never find Pumpkin.
Peridot...

column6: Rustling is suddenly heard from the cornfield, causing Peridot to look towards it, and she notices Pumpkin's tail sticking out from the corn stalks.

column4: Pumpkin?

column6: Pumpkin whimpers as she runs into the cornfield.

column4: Have you been here the whole time?!
She was hiding?
Come on, Pumpkin. We need to leave.

column6: Pumpkin whimpers in response.

column4: Pumpkin!  Don't you walk away while I'm talking to you!

column6: Pumpkin whimpers loudly as Peridot drags her out of the cornfield by her tail.

column4: Sometimes, you have to do things you don't want to do, like get jettisoned into space to live forever on a floating rock with a barn, and just us as for as long as time exists! Lapis needs us!

column6: Pumpkin whimpers and struggles to get away from Peridot.

column4: Peridot, give her a second!
She's doing it to herself! Pumpkin, Do as you're told!

column6: Peridot loses grip of Pumpkin's tail and falls backwards onto the ground.

column4: Gah!

column6: Once freed, Pumpkin runs up to Steven and jumps into his arms whimpering.

column4: Whoa, Peridot. It sounds like you don't really want to go.

column6: Peridot picks herself up off the ground and walks toward Steven and Pumpkin.

column4: I'm sorry, Pumpkin. I didn't mean to yank you around. It's just...  We don't have a choice in this.
What do you mean you "don't have a choice"? Peridot, you should really talk to Lapis about this.
I can't.

column6: Peridot walks away and Steven follows after her.

column4: What? Why not?

column6: Lapis flies back down from the sky and lands in front of Peridot and Steven.

column4: Oh, great! You found her!
Now, let's go!

column6: Lapis, Peridot, and Steven walk towards the barn as Lapis once again raises the barn into the air. Peridot turns to Steven and looks at him nervously, only to get a similar response from him in return. Peridot glances at Lapis and anxiously gathers up her thoughts.

column4: Wait... Lapis? Pumpkin doesn't want to go.

column6: Lapis turns her head back towards Peridot with a confused look on her face.

column4: Pumpkin doesn't know better. We do.

column6: Lapis turns her head back around and continues focusing on the barn.

column4: Actually, I... I don't want to go either.
What?!

column6: Paralyzed with shock, Lapis turns back towards Peridot and the barn crashes back onto the ground.

column4: Aah!
Ooh-whoa!
Peridot, what are you trying to say?
It's just, if something happens on Earth, I want to be here for it!
But- No! Why are you telling me this now ?!
Because... we're about to leave!
Isn't that the worst time?

column6: Peridot raises her index finger into the air with a static, blank expression.

column4: Yes.

column6: Steven looks to them with quiet fear in his eyes while mumbling nervously.

column4: Then why didn't you tell me sooner?
Well, there are many things I should say, but they would upset you, so in general, I don't say those things...?
Peridot, that's lying!

column6: Steven groans in increasing anxiety.

column4: Okay, then! The truth is... I think that we should stay, and if- and if the time comes, if the Diamonds do come to wipe this planet off the star maps, I think we should fight for this life we've built instead of tearing it up out of the ground! I think we can win. I think you can win! Earth is our home now. Isn't it worth fighting for?

column6: Peridot reaches her hand out to Lapis.

column4: What do ya say, Lapis?

column6: Lapis lowers her head in sorrow and turns her back on Peridot, walking away towards the barn.

column4: I am not getting caught in the middle of another war.

column6: Lapis sprouts her water wings and begins to lift the barn into the air again for a final time.

column4: Wait! No! You're supposed to reward me for my emotional honesty!

column6: Lapis flies in the air as she lifts the barn higher, breaking it away from the plumbing. She looks back at Peridot, Steven, and Pumpkin's fretting faces, before taking off into the sky, taking the barn along with her. Steven walks up to Peridot as she stands frozen in place and places his hand on her back.

column4: Come on. Let's go.

column6: Steven sets up a mattress in his bathtub for Peridot and Pumpkin, while Peridot sits in a daze on the toilet.

column4: Okay. You're all set up, and you can stay here as long as you need.

column6: Peridot gets off the toilet and walks towards the mattress.

column4: Wow...  Thanks...

column6: Steven and Pumpkin sit down next to the tub as Peridot lies face down on the mattress. Steven pulls out his phone and checks it. He sighs in remorse as he finds there is still no response from Connie.

column4: What do we do now?...

column6: Steven, Peridot, and Pumpkin gaze off in silence, as they sit together in the bathroom.

Steven wakes up in the morning from the buzzing of his Cookie Cat™ alarm clock. He begins his morning routine at the kitchen sink, such as brushing his teeth, washing his face, and cleaning his ears. He then dunks his head into the sink full of water to wash his head further. At that moment, Amethyst emerges through the Temple Gate and Pumpkin, barking excitedly, runs up to her.

column4: Oooh, hey there, girl!  Yo, Steven! This a bad time?
Of the three things I have to do in the sink now, this is the one I least mind you seeing.
Ugh, Peridot is still depressed all up in your B-room?
Yeah. She still hasn't gotten over Lapis leaving and taking the Barn with her into space. I think she just... needs a little more time to herself?
Nope! That's it, we're getting her out.
Wait, Amethyst!

column6: Steven and Amethyst opens the door to the bathroom.

column4: Uhh... Peridot?

column6: Somber country music is heard playing from Peridot's tablet on the sink, while Peridot lies hanging from the bathtub onto the floor, with puddles of water everywhere on the floor. Steven and Amethyst exchange worried looks, and Amethyst walks in.

column4: You... feeling any better?
Uugghhh...

column6: Amethyst pauses the music on Peridot's tablet.

column4: So... Uhh what have you... been up to?

column6: Peridot mumbles something onto the floor.

column4: I uhh... couldn't really hear you there.

column6: Amethyst lifts Peridot's foot from the bathtub and flips her over to the floor, looking absolutely haggard.

column4: Nothing...
You've been in this bathroom kind of a long time? Maybe you should get some fresh air.
... What's the point?...
To feel better?
Come on, Peridot! I can't stand seeing you like this!
Like what?...

Dude, let's just get out of the house. We could go check out my old Kindergarten. We met all those other Amethysts up in space, and they all came out of the same rock as me. I've been meaning to get a look at the old neighborhood now that I've met the neighbors.
That sounds fun. What do you say, Peridot?
You can make us feel dumb by telling us all the stuff we don't know!
I miss that...

column3: ['picks Peridot up and hoists her over her shoulder']
column4: Great, it's settled!  Let's get out of the bathroom.
Can I bring my music?...
No.

column6: Steven, Amethyst and Peridot board a train that is passing by the countryside. Steven and Amethyst are gazing out at the scenery, while Peridot is laying in a fetal position inside.

column4: Ugh. Why exactly are we taking this outdated, clackity ship there? The Prime Kindergarten has a very convenient Warp Pad.
Ehh, we're taking the scenic route.
Come on, Peridot! Take a look at the beautiful countryside.
No. Your efforts to entrance me with Earth's beauty are pointless. My sector of countryside was perfect. Now it's somewhere in space. Just let me know when we get there.

column6: Steven looks at Peridot with deep concerns.
The trio arrives at the Kindergarten and begins walking towards Amethyst's hole.

column4: Good ol' Kindergarten! Just the way I left it! Aww, some things never change. Gah- Actually, everything's different now! Man, I-I used to think this place was full of empty holes, but now it's like, it's empty with holes which were once full! All those Amethysts I met in space, they were all here! While I was right there in the ground. But now, I can finally start putting some faces to holes! Hohohoh, let's see... Hup!

column6: Amethyst proceeds to hop from hole to hole.

column4: This must've been 8XJ! Ooh! 8XK! 8XL!
Actually, the order goes from top to bottom. That's 8XJ.
Really?
Yes. Curly hair, right?
Yeah! How'd you know?
You can tell from the iron deposits in the formation there. And that's 8XL down below.
Whoa, that's pretty amazing, Dot.

column6: Peridot blushes and smiles from the compliment, but comes to a gloomy realization.

column4: This used to make sense to me. I thought life was generated in a Kindergarten. Formless, aimless energy channeled into new, useful Gems. But life doesn't start in a Kindergarten. It ends here. I've gotten used to plants everywhere. Bugs and breeze and sunshine... All of that has been sucked out of this place. It's with the Amethysts that were produced here, and now, this place is nothing but a miserable husk. All of the Amethysts are gone.
Hey!
Oh, all the well-made Amethysts are gone.
Yo, not better.
And nothing will ever grow here again, not even this flower.

column6: Peridot point at a flower growing on the ground, and the trio realizes that it, a form of biotic life, seems to be able to exist in the Kindergarten despite Peridot's descriptions.

column4: Wait!  Oh! I've never seen anything growing here, and I've been hanging around this joint for 5,000 years. Man, it looks healthy, too.
Wow! That's Earth for you: Always bouncing back.
I don't know. I'd have to run some tests to see if this is not an anomaly.
You want to try planting stuff here? You know how to farm!
Yeah, that could be fun!
It could be an interesting experiment.
Yeah! Let's re-garden the Kindergarten!

column6: The trio warp back to the Kindergarten, bringing along gardening tool, some sunflowers and Peridot's tractor, and a montage begins. Rocks are moved to make way for the tractor to plow and cultivate the soil. Holes are dug in the soil and the sunflowers are planted into them, after fertilizers are added. Steven and Amethyst begins watering the sunflowers by blasting them with water guns. Peridot calls it off, suggesting they sprinkle the water from above instead, using Amethyst as a helicopter. Lastly, Amethyst puts a plastic flamingo next to the sunflower field, and the trio celebrates.

column5: Trans. Int. Beach House, The Next Day

column6: Steven wakes up in the morning and gets ready for the day, happily taking a hot shower. As he leaves his bathroom, he sees Peridot speaking to Amethyst in the kitchen.

column4: They don't need any more water after yesterday, but according to several tutorials I read, the roots should be starting to take hold.
Oh, yeah?
So, that's something we can check for today as soon as-  Steven! What are you doing in that bathing gown?! Get dressed already!
Oh! Uh, right!

column6: The trio boards a train again to get to the Kindergarten, and they begin discussing inside a carriage.

column4: Do you think they grew much overnight?
Yeah, I bet the place looks even better!
We should plant even more stuff. What do you think we should do next?
What about, hydrangeas?
Uh, which one's that?
I don't know, but it sounds good, right?
What do you think, Peridot?
Hey... Thanks for doing this with me.
What? Haha, come on.
It was fun.
I'm just glad I was able to fix something.
Yeah, the Kindergarten looks better than ever!

column6: The trio witnesses in shock at the dead sunflowers on the ground. Peridot picks one up, and it disintegrates with the wind. Steven and Amethyst look on nervously to see what Peridot does next.

column4: Well, I don't know why I'm surprised. I should've known not to have hope.
But maybe if we try again-
It's not going to work! It's never going to work, okay?!
Hey, don't be a jerk! We were just trying to cheer you up.

And good job with that! I feel just great now that I know that nothing's ever going to get better! Everything is just ruined forever! We can't get any of it back! Not my home! Not Lapis! And not this crummy planet, either! We might as well just throw it all in the garbage and toss ourselves in after, because it's all just hopeless trash!
Peridot, maybe the sunflowers didn't work, but we know something can grow here.
This clod's just like us! Too dumb to get with the program!

column6: Peridot stomps on the flower in frustration. Steven and Amethyst whimper, and Peridot immediately feels bad for her actions. Suddenly, the ground starts rumbling.

column4: Uhhh.
Uh?
Waaaa!

column6: The ground around the flower cracks and a Flower Monster pops out of the ground, roaring at the trio loudly.

column4: Oh, of course!

column6: The Flower Monster grabs Peridot with its hand-like tongue and consumes her.

column4: Peridot!

column6: Steven and Amethyst run toward the Flower Monster, as it burrows underground and appears behind the duo. Amethyst uses her whip to grasp the Flower Monster's leg, only for the latter to drag her with it underground. Steven attempts to catch up while Amethyst continues to fight it underground.

column4: Want to get this together?
Let's do it!

column6: Steven and Amethyst hold hands and fuse into Smoky Quartz. They throws the Flower Monster onto the surface and wraps it with their yo-yos, squeezing it tightly until the corrupted Gem poofs back into its gemstone. Peridot lays unimpressed on the ground, while Smoky bubbles the gemstone away.

column4: I need to go to the bathroom.

column6: The trio lay down inside the train carriage, disappointed.

column4: Man, you were right. The Kindergarten really is dead forever.
I was a fool to think we could reinstitute life there.
Tell me about it.

All right. I will. I was pretty much using this as a distraction from losing Lapis, losing the barn, and just a general sense of complete hopelessness I tend to deal with on a day-to-day basis. But it really only confirmed to me that once you mess something up, it's ruined for good and nothing will ever be able to grow again.
Yeah, we got the subtext.
...Oh, wow.

column6: Steven looks outside the train carriage as they pass by a vast field of sunflowers.

column4: What about all this?
Now that's some plants.
Huh. Guess the countryside out here is pretty beautiful. But who cares? I wanted to have this for the Kindergarten!
Even if there was nothing we can do for that one patch of land, there's still a whole Earth blooming all around us.
Yeah! Why don't we try gardening in literally any other place? It'll be easier than trying to plant in the Kindergarten. That dirt doesn't care how green your thumb is.
Green thumb! 'Cause you're green!
I know that!
So, are ya in?
Umm...
Do it, do it, do it, say yes!
Ughh. Fine. I've got literally nothing else to do.
Yay!
Oh, yeah!

column6: Steven and Amethyst hug Peridot and the trio gazes at the countryside scenery. The star iris closes in on the trio as Peridot returns the hug.

column5: Open Int. The Big Donut; Daytime

column6: Steven enters the Big Donut, where a tired Sadie is seen greeting farewell to some customers.

column4: Thanks for coming.

column6: Sadie, almost unconsciously, begins to mop the floor.

column4: Hey, Sadie!
Hey, Steven. What'll it be?
Sorry to be a pain, but I got kind of a long order. I hope it's not too much trouble.
What trouble?  I'm a professional donut girl.

Okay... I'll have one jelly donut with powdered sugar on the side, three chocolate frosted, one frosted chocolate, two chocolate-frosted chocolate, one dog-nut; medium well, one coffee with milk and sugar, hold the coffee. I also have several methods of payment I'd like you to split this order across evenly.
Uh, what's all this for?
Band practice!
You're in a band?!
Kinda. I started jamming with Jenny, Buck, and Sour Cream!
Whoa! That's so cool! Aww man! I bet you guys sound amazing!

We're still trying to figure out our sound, but it's been fun just playing music with other people. It's also nice to have an outlet that doesn't involve space and Gem stuff and everything else going on. Um... You doing okay?

Well, I worry about Lars being in space, and I hope he's safe and all, but... Ughh... Working all these shifts by myself has been a huge drag. I'm totally used to doing his work, but I'm used to at least having him here to talk to. Now, I gotta do that myself, too. "Oh, come on, Sadie, you missed a spot!" Oh, no, sorry.
Well, we'll all be practicing at Sour Cream's place tonight. Feel free to stop by if you have time.
I'll try! Hopefully, I can finish restocking napkins early. We're always running out for some reason.

column3: ['takes a whole stack of napkins', 'leaves the shop, leaving a trail of napkins']
column4: Hmm, weird. Well, see ya, Sadie!
Bye, Steven.

column6: Steven, Jenny and Sour Cream are seen hanging outside of the garage, while Sour Cream is experimenting with his Launchpad.

column4: What do ya call that style?
Beachcore.

column6: Buck arrives, running in with a guitar case on his back.

column4: Hey.
What's up, Buck?
Guess who's got a gig at Delmarva's number-two music and seafood festival this weekend?!
Chugi and the Woo Woos?
Jack and the Frosted Tips?
7-Force?
... No, us!
What?!
We don't even have a name yet!
Or a set list!
Or even one single song to put on a set list!
Guess we got a lot of work to do.

column6: The group continues to brainstorm ideas for their band.

column4: What if we went for a more of a rap-a-billy style?
No, thanks.
How about something like...  ♪ Here we are, our hearts combining. Music and friends, our souls aligning. ♪

Hold on, Steven. You got a really cool sentiment going on that can resonate with a wide audience. I just feel like this seafood festival needs to hear something challenging and provocative. Check this out.  ♪ Doo-doo.  ♪ Butt.  ♪ The government.  ♪ Corrupts.

Hold on there, Bucky D. I'm all for being socially conscious and waking people up inside, but people are gonna be at this seafood fest to have fun! Let's give them something they can dance to! Sour Cream, give me a beat!
A what?
A beat!

column6: With her voice captured, Sour Cream uses the Launchpad to create a beat with Jenny's voice.

column4: Oh, yeah! Let's spice it up!

column6: Jenny begins playing a funky riff on her bass.

column4: Cool.
Yeah! And then how about some...

column6: Sour Cream makes some screeching tones on the Launchpad, startling Jenny.

column4: WHAT THE HECK, SOUR CREAM!?
What? Can't let your audience get too comfortable.
Maybe we should just call it a night, and try again tomorrow.
Agreed.

column6: Just then, Sadie arrives.

column4: Oh, hey, guys! Sorry, I'm so late. Took longer to close up than I thought it would. Ya'll still practicing?
Oh sorry, Sadie, we just wrapped up. We were getting nowhere.
Aww shoot! I really wanted to hear you guys. Well, let me know if you have another band practice when I'm not working. See ya, guys.
Bye, Sadie!
Bye, Sadie!
Later.
See ya, girl.

column6: Steven looks on with pity as Sadie leaves.

column5: Trans. Ext. Miller Residence, The Next Afternoon

column4: Hi, Sadie!
Hey, how's it goin'?
S'up?
Hey, girl.
Whoa! Hey, guys! I just got home from work.
We know. We followed you. Sorry if that's weird.
We know how busy your schedule is, so, we decided to bring the jam to you.
Aw, shucks, guys! But...  My room is such a mess right now. Okay, ah- okay, just give me a moment to tidy up!

column6: Sadie puts away a pile of clothes, as the group enters her room.

column4: Dang, Sadie! You've got so much space in here!
Yo, Sadie, do you have any free outlets to plug into?
Oh, yeah, check over by the TV.

column6: The group begins setting up their music instruments.

column4: Let's get serious now. The show is this weekend!
Wait... I can't really... feel the music in this... cramped spot.  This looks comfy.
No, wait!

column6: Buck sits on Sadie's bed, and crunching noise are heard underneath the blanket.

column4: Aw, doo-doo. I think I broke your bed.
Gah!

column6: Sadie shoves Buck off her bed and lifts the blanket to see if her video cassettes are okay.

column4: Whoa! Scary movies! Hey, Sadie, you've got a dark side.
It's more of a... dork side.
Hey, is that "The Lurch"?
You know this one?
Yeah! It's a classic! I can't believe you have a copy! Guys, we have to watch this.

column6: The group watches the movie on Sadie's TV with the lights off. On-screen, groaning gray zombies approach a man and woman huddled in fear.

column4: Brains...

column6: The woman in the movie then screams in fear.

column4: I can't believe you like this one. Not everyone appreciates Bulgarian horror.
