The Fog Of War is one of the best units out there. Go big! It's on my tab.
When you say, "Big", you mean, like, glow sticks in every color?
Bigger! I'm talking lasers!
Lasers?!
Special delivery.
I think this will get us through the show tomorrow and then some.

column3: ['shows off her Sadie Killer and the Suspects shirt']
column4: Check it.
Oh-ho-ho!
Nice!
Scary and stylish.

column6: Just then, Barbara arrives with some more packages.

column4: Huh? The Fog Of War and our lasers... and Barb!
These all got your name on them, Greg. You building a new car wash or something?
It's all for Sadie Killer and the Suspects.
Huh?
Your daughter's band? I'm their manager.
What are you talking about? An old duffer like you managing a band?
Well, I may be old, but that didn't stop me from getting them a gig in-
In some no-name city. It's not a big deal.

column6: Sadie accidentally knocks over a poster and the poster unrolls in front of Barbara.

column4: "Sadie Killer and the Suspects, live at Empire Ci--"  My girl is playing in Empire City?! This is a huge deal! Oh, my gosh. Geez. If you need to carry all this stuff and your instruments, I-I can probably use the mail truck if I ask nice. And I can definitely use it if I don't ask. Oh! And you'll need snacks for the road, and-
Mom! We've talked about this!
Uhh... Sadie?
The band is my thing, and I just want to be able to do it on my own.
...Right, right. You need your space. I understand. You kids be safe and have a good show, huh?
Ready the cords.
Here I go.

column6: Buck plugs the power cord in and Sour Cream turns the fog machine on, causing it to produce a prodigious amount of fog and engulfing Jenny in it.

column4: Whoa!

column6: Jenny and Sour Cream laugh in delight, as Steven pans the camcorder towards Sadie and Greg by the van.

column4: Ohh. Ugh.  My mom used to be so into my life, it was suffocating. But now I get to be Sadie Killer, and it's something that's totally mine, and I know she's just waiting to get her hands on it.
Wow. That's so funny.
How is it funny? It drives me nuts!

Oh, no. It's just back in the day, my parents didn't want anything to do with my music. They thought I was throwing my life away. They never came to one of my shows. They never even wanted to hear about them.
Really?
It's kind of amazing that your mom is excited about your band. It's just... really nice to see.
Yeah. Yeah... I-I guess you're right.

column6: The video transitions to Greg driving Steven, Sadie and the Cool Kids to Empire City in his van.

column4: Are you ready, Sadie Killer?
Yeah!
Aah! I'm so excited! It's our first big show!
Yeah!
Me, too.

column6: The band holds hands and raises them excitedly.

column4: The venue!
Yeah!
I love enthusiasm.

column6: The video transitions to Sadie Killer and the Suspects at the concert venue preparing for their show. Backstage, Greg is instructing some roadies while the Cool Kids get dressed into black suits.

column4: And we got about six more cameras in the back of the van.
What do you mean, you don't know how to tie a tie?
Yeah. Like, didn't your dad teach you? He used to wear them every day.
They were clip-ons.

column6: Steven pans the camcorder towards Sadie, who is putting on a ghostly makeup in front of a mirror.

column4: Sadie! What's up? Are you nervous?
No, no. I'm just, umm...  Just getting ready.

column6: Sadie and Steven walk to the stage curtain and peek out at the audience.

column4: Sounds like a big crowd out there. Wait. Is that...

column6: Steven zooms in towards a woman in the audience who strongly resembles Barbara, and Sadie notices too.

column4: Mom?!  Does she think she can just show up in some wacky disguise and I won't know it's her?! It's so obvious!
Maybe she should have gotten some costume tips from you.
Okay, guys. You're on in 5.

column6: The video transitions again, Steven is filming Sadie Killer and the Suspects from the audience. Jenny, Buck, and Sour Cream are already onstage, as a coffin prop rises out of the stage. Sadie bursts out of the coffin, and the band begins to perform "G-G-G-Ghost"

column4: ♪ I used to be sick, sick and tired. ♪ Delirious, dizzy, terrified. ♪ But I'm suddenly up and out of bed. ♪ You'd never believe I was almost... ♪

column6: Sadie begins walking up to each of the Cool Kids, as they act that they are unable not to see her.

column4: ♪ Why can't you see me? ♪ Why can't you see me?' ♪ I think I might be, ♪ A g-g-g-ghost. ♪

column6: Sadie walks back to the coffin and knocks it over.

column4: ♪ Awww-aahhh! ♪ Can't you see that I exist? ♪ And I don't need an exorcist, ♪ To let~ me~ out?~ ♪

column6: Sadie begins throwing confetti from the coffin everywhere.

column4: ♪ Look at me, and I'll appear. ♪ Why can't you see that I'm right here? ♪ That I'm~ right~ here.~ ♪

column6: Sadie points and winks at the woman who resembles Barbara in the audience, and begins throwing confetti at each of the Cool Kids, who reacts like they sense her presence.

column4: ♪ Why can't you see me? ♪ Why can't you see me? ♪ I think I might be... ♪ A g-g-g-ghost... ♪

column6: Sadie sits in front of the coffin, slumps over and drops her microphone. The Cool Kids walk over and place their hands on Sadie, as she "levitates" into the air.

column4: ♪ I'm calling you from the other side... ♪

column6: Sadie is raised into the air by a rope, lifting up her arms briefly before going slack. The song concludes, and the audience cheers and applauds.
The video transitions to Sadie Killer and the Suspects backstage, as Greg congratulates them.

column4: You were all so amazing!
Yeah, we were!
Sadie, you nailed that ending.

column6: Just then, the woman who resembled Barbara walks backstage towards the group.

column4: Oh! Hey, Ma-
Sunshine Justice!
How you been, Greg?  Where'd you find these kids? Reminds me of your old space gimmick, except people actually like it.
Hey!
I'm just kidding. You were very ahead of your time. But Sadie Killer and the Suspects? That crowd was going crazy. You're really something. You kids are welcome to play at the venue anytime.
Aah!
Oh, yeah!

column6: The video transitions to Greg driving Steven and the band back home. The Cool Kids are fast sleeping while Sadie is looking out the window. Steven turns to Sadie and begins whispering, to not wake the Cool Kids.

column4: You did great tonight!
Thanks.
So, how does it feel to be a rock star?
Weird. I mean, good. It's just... I went all out thinking my mom was at the show. I can't believe I kind of wanted her to be there. Well, not even kind of. I did.
There'll be other shows. Why don't you tell her about the next one?
Hey, Mr. Universe, let's play our next show in Beach City.
I'll make it happen.
That's all, folks! Thanks for watching!

column6: Steven makes a peace sign as the star iris closes on his face.
Steven, riding atop Lion, overlooks Beach City from the top of the hill.

column4: Good old Beach City, but so much has changed lately.

column6: Steven and Lion walk about the town. They pass by Beach Citywalk Fries, when Mayor Nanefua is informing the citizens about an evacuation route.

column4: I guess after all those abductions everything couldn't just return to normal.

column6: Steven waves to Sadie, Buck, and Sour Cream as they pass by.

column4: With Sadie rocking out and Lars in space, I can't even enjoy my regular snack at the Big Donut. What am I gonna do for breakfast now?!

column6: Steven leans onto Lion's head and groans gloomily. Lion stops and hurls Steven off his back onto the ground, when Steven hears a door chime nearby. He turns and sees two customers leaving the Big Donut with food in hand.

column4: Wait a minute. Big Donut is still open?

column6: Steven enters the Big Donut and gasps in surprise.

column3: ['standing behind the counter, wearing a Big Donut uniform']
column4: Hello! Welcome to the Big Donut!
Garnet?  I have so many questions.
Just one moment. You'll have to wait your turn.

column6: Garnet skillfully fills a paper bag full of donuts and hands them to a customer, completing the transaction. She then turns to Steven.

column4: Welcome to the Big Donut. Tell me how I may serve you.
I never thought I'd see you working here. Have we fallen on hard times?
Oh, Steven. This isn't about making ends meet. This is about being random.
Are you serious?
Oh, yes!
I... don't understand.

column6: Garnet pours coffee into a cup, and then spills the coffee from the cup onto the counter.

column3: ['points at the streams of spilled coffee', 'points at a pool of coffee, disconnected from the rest of the spill', 'drags her finger through the spill, linking a stream with the pool']
column4: My future vision allows me to see down the rivers of possibility, granting me insight into the possible realities our actions move us towards. But that doesn't mean I can predict everything. What I'm interested in are these extremely unlikely realities, so disconnected from the natural course of events that I can't detect them.  When we act in unnatural ways, we create new, unforeseen paths, and arrive at these pools of improbability.
Oh, so you want to do stuff you usually don't just to see what happens?
I didn't foresee you understanding that.
So, are we gonna clean up that coffee?
That's what we'd normally do. Let's see what happens to the world when we don't.

column6: Steven and Garnet watch a drop of coffee fall off the edge of the counter onto the floor.

column4: We are now dwelling in a totally new pool of improbability. My future vision is useless here.
I'm scared... but intrigued.

column3: ['somersaults over the counter', 'enlarges her muscles, bursting apart her uniform']
column4: That's the spirit! Let's get even more intriguing!  I quit!  Come, Steven!

column6: Steven and Garnet exit the Big Donut, leaving the remaining customers puzzled.

column4: So, what now?
Hmm... Instead of selling food, let's order some.
Like what?
Let's do... pizza.
Now you're talking my language!  Ordering now!

column6: Steven calls Fish Stew Pizza, and Kiki answers the phone at the restaurant.

column4: Fish Stew Pizza.
Uh, I want to order a pizza.
10 pizzas!
No, 20 pizzas! Toppings? Um...  Surprise me.
Now you're getting it!
I guess deliver it to the Temple. No... That's just what they'll be expecting.
Go weirder!
Deliver it to the ocean. No, no, no, to Kansas! No, to the moon!
I don't think that's within our delivery radius.
Remember. Improbable, not impossible.
Where's the last place they'd expect to deliver a pizza? Oh! Deliver it to... Fish Stew Pizza.
So, like, this is for pick-up?

column6: Steven and Garnet are walking along the boardwalk, each carrying several boxes of pizza.

column4: Now think, Steven, about what you typically do when you obtain pizza.
Hmm... Eat it?

column3: ['throws a pizza box at a passerby']
column4: In this timeline, we do the opposite of that. Hey, you! Have a pizza!

column3: ['falls over catching the pizza and grunts']
column4: Hey, thanks!

column6: Steven and Garnet give out pizza to various people, such as Peedee, Mr. Smiley, and a flock of seagulls.

column4: One more pizza to deliver.
Hey, Vidalia's house is around here. Let's bring her the last pie.
Now, that would be nice. She must be upset that her son was taken into space by those Homeworld Gems.
You mean Onion? He isn't in space. He's right over there.

column6: Onion is seen sneaking behind them, with a large sack slung over his shoulder, and he jumps over a fence.

column4: Sorry, I-I must be thinking of a different timeline.
O...kay... Well, I'm sure Vidalia would still like some pizza even if her kid is still on Earth. Let's go swing by.

column6: Steven and Garnet arrive at the front door of Vidalia's house.

column4: Mother Onion! Open up!
In the garage!
Get excited for pizza!
We got pepper flakes, and we're not afraid to use 'em!
Ahh! Wait a minute. Steven? What are you guys doing here? Trying to scare me to death?
Oh, sorry. We were just trying to bring you a pizza in the most unlikely way possible. Want a slice?

column6: Garnet opens the pizza box.

column4: Sure, I could use a break. I've been working on this still life of a step stool, but I just don't feel inspired.

column3: ['closes the pizza box, hands it to Steven, poses on the step stool']
column4: Paint me like one of your Amethysts.
Paint me, too!
So you wanna be my muse, eh?
If it's not too much trouble.  I promise to be very inspiring.
Hmm... Yeah, I think this is just what I needed.  Strike a pose!

column6: Steven and Garnet strike a new pose, with Garnet holding Steven in her hand.

column4: It's struck.
Okay, don't move. I need to capture your essence.

column6: Vidalia draws for a period of time, and Steven begins to get uncomfortable maintaining the pose.

column4: Garnet? How long do you see me holding still?
Who knows? The odds of us being here are so slim, I can't even-

column6: A clanging noise is heard. Garnet turns and notices a one-eyed cat sifting through a fallen garbage can outside.

column4: Uhh, Garnet?
Steven, look.

column6: Steven notices the cat too, who runs away after seeing them.

column4: Ba-ba-b-b-baby kitten? Is it possible that we chase that sweet cat?
It- it's up to you, Steven.
Yes?
Don't ask me. Tell me!
Mmm... Yes! Whoa!

column6: Garnet tosses Steven onto her head and dashes out of the garage.

column4: Huh?
Sorry, Vidalia! Maybe next time!
But wait! Your essence!

column6: Steven and Garnet catches up to the cat walking down the streets. It notices them and runs ahead, prompting the two to sprint after it.
Steven and Garnet chase the cat as it slips through a hole in some shrubs.

column4: That's one fast kitten. You think we can catch it?
If we don't lose sight of it.

column6: Steven and Garnet crawl after the cat through the shrubs. The cat, Steven and Garnet then arrive in a forest clearing, where the cat jumps into another bush. Steven and Garnet peek into the bush and see the cat, along with another four kittens of its size, meowing at the pair.

column4: Aww... There's more of them. Aww... And they have no food. Aww... And they have no one to take care of them! Garnet, we got to help these kittens.

column6: Steven begins picking up the kittens and handing them to Garnet.

column4: Look at you! You're just babies. Who knows what would've happened to them if we didn't find them? Everything's gonna be just fine. We've got you. Here's the last one. Or- Wait.

column6: Steven picks up the one-eyed cat.

column4: All right, I think we got to stop being random and figure out what we can do for these kittens. Garnet, can you use your future vision? What should we do next? ...Garnet?

column6: Steven turns around and sees Garnet sweating anxiously, with the cat clinging all over her.

column4: There's so many... cats. So many... possibilities.

column3: ['holds up the one-eyed cat to Garnet']
column4: It's too much, uh- Okay, can you focus on one?  What's this one's future?
I... I... I don't know! I don't know anything anymore!

column6: Soft thunder noises are heard overhead as it begins to rain.

column4: Are you okay?
Steven, lately, I've felt so lost.
Don't worry. I remember the way back to town.

Oh, it's not just that. It's you. You've made so many decisions I didn't expect: giving yourself up to Homeworld, coming back through Lion's mane. The future that you created was so improbable that I didn't see it coming at all, and now I can't understand where this timeline is going. We're on the outskirts of the possible, following trickles to who knows where. Everyone's looking to me for answers. I can't stand it! It's so hard for me to just exist in the first place, Steven. I want to love being alive. I want to love that there are so many possibilities, but I'm the one with this ability, so I've got to be our guide. I thought, if I could use my future vision to jump into improbable futures, I could get out ahead of the next big, unexpected change, but I don't know what I'm doing here! I can't tell what's probable anymore! Anything could happen! Anything could happen to these cats!

column3: ['smiles and holds up the one-eyed cat']
column4: That's true, but maybe instead of thinking of all the things that could happen, let's just pick the thing we want to happen and do that.  So, what do you want to happen next?
I want... to get these cats out of the rain.
And then what?

column6: Garnet smiles in reassurance.
Steven is speaking on the phone, Garnet is sitting by a box with the kittens, and Vidalia is standing nearby.

column4: Okay, sounds good. Thank you so much.  Great news. The shelter has a foster program. They said they can pick up the cats tomorrow.
Thank goodness.
Whew. Glad to hear it!

column3: ['turns to the cats in the box', 'lets a cat licks his finger, and giggles']
column4: How are you little guys holding up? Anyone need to use the bathroom? Make a phone call?  You guys are gonna be just fine.
I think I get it.
Hmm?
Why my future vision has been so off. I have to change the way I think about you.
What?

column3: ['hands Steven the cat that is in her lap']
column4: I've been looking into probable futures where you act like a child. I keep expecting you to run from responsibility and to turn to me for help, but you don't do that anymore. Those futures aren't probable at all. There's nothing wrong with this timeline or my future vision. I just need to factor in, that you've grown up.

column3: ['chuckles and puts the cat in the box']
column4: I guess I have, but it's only because I'm trying to be more like you. You always know what to do.
Not always.

column6: The one-eyed cat jumps off a table and Garnet catches it.

column4: Okay, most of the time.  I want to adopt this one. There's something about her.
Really? Is that a probable future?
It is now. Besides, I've missed having someone cute and vulnerable to take care of.  I think I'll call her "Steven."
Isn't that gonna get confusing?
All right, then. Cat Steven.
Oh, my gosh! Wow! Oh, okay. This is the best!
What, you're adopting one?! Too bad I couldn't get her in your portrait! Which I managed to finish, by the way.
Really?! What about our essence?
Well, I fudged it, but I think I got it.

column6: Vidalia shows Steven and Garnet their portrait, and they gasp in delight.
Back home, Cat Steven is sleeping atop a sleeping Lion in Steven's room, and the portrait of Steven and Garnet is seen leaning against the bed, as the star iris closes in on it.
The Sun Incinerator is seen cruising an asteroid field, as Lars begins recording his logs.

column4: Captain's Log: I think it's Friday. I've ordered Rhodonite to do a spectral scan of the system. Hopefully one of these asteroids has the flotanium deposits we need to get our warp engines back online.

column6: Lars moans in despair, when a letter flies out of Lars' hair.

column4: What now, Steven?!  A letter?

column6: Lars opens the letter and begins to read it. A voiceover of Steven narrates the letter, followed by a series of flashbacks.

column4: Dear Lars, how's space? Is it still big? You don't have to answer that right now, this is a letter. Since you're away from home, I thought I'd fill you in on what's been going on in Beach City. Everyone misses you soooo much.
Since Sadie's been busy with the band, no one's around to open up the Big Donut.

column6: Steven peeked through the glass door of the donut shop and sighed in dismay, when Ronaldo walked in.

column4: Oh come on! Are they STILL not open?!  I know Sadie quit a while ago, but why the heck isn't Lars here to pick up the slack?!
Uhh, Ronaldo, Lars is in space.
Good one Steven! I needed that!

column6: Steven stared at Ronaldo in silence and he ceased laughing.

column4: YOU'RE SERIOUS?!?!
Don't you remember when everyone in town was abducted by Gems? Mayor Dewey had to give all those speeches about it?
Do you believe everything the government tells you?
I'm the one who told the government.
Wait, what? So that means...
Mmm hmm.
So Lars is really in space?
Mmm hmm.
Is he in danger? Surrounded by aliens?
All of the above.
This is a nightmare. I'M THE ONE WHO SHOULD BE IN SPACE! WHY DOES LARS GET TO BE WHISKED AWAY INTO THE INFINITE COSMOS ON AN ADVENTURE OF A LIFETIME? IT'S SO IRONIC IT HURTS MY SOUL!

column6: Ronaldo lays down on the ground, sobbing loudly.

column4: There, there...

column6: Just then, Bill Dewey walked in.

column4: Morning Universe.
Oh, good morning.
Still not open huh? I guess me and the Big Donut have a lot in common, we're both empty inside.
As far as local politics, Mayor Dewey isn't mayor anymore. There was an election and Nanefua won with her platform of working together.

column6: Nanefua was holding a town council inside the pizzeria, while her bodyguards stood guard outside.

column4: So, we are all in agreement, yes? In the event of a Gem-related emergency, everyone should go to the newly designated shelters.
Me and Garnet can take care of food rations. Anyone know a good non-perishable brand of Chaaaaps?
We could also put some pizza ingredients on ice, just in case.
That's a great idea Garnet. We can ask all the local restaurants to pitch in food in case we have to hide for a while.
These all seem like great plans, but... How are you going to get in contact with everyone when there's an emergency? This may be a small town, but it's, a big small town.
Oh! Mayor Gunga, I could drive you around while you use the loudspeaker to spread the word through town.
Cheese on bread! That's a good idea!
And while Jenny does that, I can take to the boardwalk on foot and let all the businesses know what's up.
And, as soon as we know of any impending danger, I'll give everyone a call on my cellular phone!
It might be easier if you just send out a mass text.
What number do I call for "mass text"?
Pearl, is this your first cell phone?
Maybe...?
Is there anything else we can do to beef up the town security?
It'd be nice if we could have some kind of lookout. Maybe I'll buy one of those high powered telescopes for the lighthouse or something.
I VOLUNTEER! I LOVE LOOKING OUT! IF I CAN'T BE IN SPACE, I CAN AT LEAST LOOK AT IT!

This is beautiful! Ronaldo, Greg, you're on lookout duty. Kiki, Pearl, you're in charge of communication. Steven, Garnet, you record our rations. And Jenny and I will spread the word about the plan. Now, everyone is helping to make our town safe.
Everyone, except me...
Awww...
Oh... You made things awkward.
Sadie Killer and the Suspects are still going strong. They're gearing up for a huge show right here in Beach City. I hope you can make it back in time to see them play.
And just as the chorus is finishing up, I'll grab this fake, but very realistic, chainsaw, and then Steven will hit me with the lights, and then we'll all scream!

column6: Buck, Sour Cream, and Jenny all did fake screams, when Bill walked in, wearing a white sheet with eye holes.

column4: And then I'll come out! Oogity boogity!
I don't think you get it Dad, we're going for scary scary, not ha ha scary.
Ooohooohooo...  Alright, I just wanted to help.
Did you cut holes in my bed sheets?!
Jamie the mailman has been making a lot of progress establishing a local theater scene. He's done a bunch of one man shows, and even started teaching improv.

column6: A stage was set up on the beach, where Steven and Pearl were the only audience, and Jamie appeared onstage.

column4: People of Beach City! Are you ready to laugh your butts off?
I am!
We've got a killer lineup for you tonight! So please welcome the Beach City Laugh-guards!

column6: Amethyst, Barbara, Mr. Smiley and Peridot walked onstage.

column4: Wooo! Yeah!
Now all we need to get started is a single word from the audience.
"Steven"!
We do a scene about Steven every week.
Well, I think those scenes are good.
Uh, "spaghetti", no no uh- "car"? No, uh that's not good. Oh! Uh- How about "plumber"?
I heard "plumber", and now the Beach City Laugh-guards will preform a completely improvised scene, based on the word "plumber".
No, do "Steven"!
Wait, "cats"!
And no more suggestions for the rest of the show!
Thank's for coming out on such short notice. My sink is clogged.
Welp, looks like we're gonna need...  One of these!

column6: Steven started laughing as Amethyst jumped into Barbara's hand.

column4: No no no, cut, stop. Notes, Barb, love how you set up the scene. Amethyst, you don't have to become a plunger, just pretend to have one. Observe, and learn.

column6: Jamie proceeds to mime many hand and arm gestures while moaning puzzlingly.

column4: What?
Wow!
That's way too confusing. You could be holding anything.
I'm holding a plunger.
Oh, I thought you were holding a long, skinny submarine sandwich.
Pearl! Be nice!
It's obviously much more clear if you can see the actual plunger!
Eehh, she's got a point there, dude.
Looks like I improved improv!

column6: Just then, Bill voiced out from behind a door prop.

column4: Did I miss my cue? Oh!  Whatever! Hello ladies, it's me! The waiter in this restaurant! Can I offer you some more... worms?
Blackout!
... It was better than last week.

column6: Ronaldo was seen looking through a telescope on the lighthouse.

column4: Anyways, my dad is still rich even after buying that telescope, so he's been trying out rich people sports.

column6: Greg and Garnet played tennis together, while Steven watched on a chair.

column4: He and Garnet have been playing tennis over the weekends.

column6: Greg ran back and forth on his side of the tennis court, struggling to keep a volley going.

column4: Garnet, this is a little intense for a warm-up. Maybe we could try a light volley?

column6: Garnet stood in place on her side of the tennis court, extending her arms to hit the ball with great force.

column4: This is light. Being rich has made you weak.

column6: Once again, Bill ran in, dressed in a tennis outfit and holding a racket.

column4: Oh, hey! Tennis? Room for one mo- Oww!

column6: Bill got hit in the face with the tennis ball, while Greg, Garnet and Steven stared at him silently.

column4: In other news, Beach City Underground Wrestling has been intense!

column6: Steven and Amethyst watched from the audience in excitement, as the various wrestlers faced against one another.

column4: The Marmalade Boys fought each other in, you guessed it, marmalade. The crowd was eating it up! But not literally, because that would be gross! Concrete Heat faced off against the Wolves of Wall Street in a steel cage! And the Good-Looking Gang finally lost the tag-team title to The Sea Wasp and Shark-O-Mania.

I know you don't need to eat anymore, but I thought you'd still be interested in the local french fry scene in Beach City. Peedee started his very own food truck. He's not old enough to drive yet though, so it's kind of just another fry stand.

column6: Steven walked up to Peedee's food truck, named "Hot 2 Tot".

column4: Hey! Steven, what'll it be?
What've you got?
Well I deal exclusively in tater tots now.
That's great Peedee! Can I get the bits?
Uh, why don't you try the tots? They're the fry of the future.
Do the tots have bits?
I'll get you the bits.
I like your super cool truck, Peedee. I love the giant potato on the top.

Oh thanks! It actually used to be the Mayor Mobile, I just painted over Mayor Dewey's head. It's a good thing that his head was so big and lumpy. Yeah, the new city board practically just gave it to me too. It's like they wanted nothing to do with it anymore. Everything's been great for me since Nanefua became mayor.

column6: Steven peeked behind the truck and saw Bill munching on tots sadly on a bench. He then got up and walked away.

column4: Oh no...
Alright, I got the bits. Steven?

column6: Steven caught up to Bill as he walked along the streets.

column4: Mayor Dewey! Wait!

You know Universe, seeing my old Mayor Mobile turned into a giant potato, made me realize that nothing is like it used to be. My old life, my old town, my old citizens, they've all changed. They've... all outgrown me, I suppose.
Well of course everyone's changing. Nothing can stay the same forever.

You know what I miss the most about being the mayor? The little things, getting dressed and ready for work, walking down the boardwalk seeing everyone's smiling faces Yes! Knowing I had a place in this town. I used to look forward to it every day.

column6: Steven and Bill walked together up to the Big Donut.

column4: Just like the people of this town used to look forward to their morning donut. I guess these days no one gets what they want.
Wait a second... I have an idea!

column6: Bill stood happily behind the counter, wearing the Big Donut uniform and serving happy customers.

Someone who misses you every day... I think. You know what? You haven't met before. I'll have to introduce you when you get back to Earth.
Huh. Thanks for the letter, Steven.

column6: The star iris closes on Steven's smiling face.

column4: Goodnight, Peridot.

Not a fourth time!

column4: Lapis?

column4: You and me, buddy. You stay here and rest up, okay?

column4: Lapis?... Lapis!

column4: Steven?
I can't believe it! It's so good to see you again!
Oh, really?

I got... distracted.

I sleep with a teddy bear. No judgements.

column6: Lapis taps the orb and turns if back on, showing the hologram of the Earth. She then taps on a location on the hologram, and a projection of Beach City appears all around the room.

column6: Lapis changes the projection to a forested area.

column4: Wow. Can I try?
Sure.

Oh Lapis...

column6: Lapis starts laughing hysterically.

column6: The projection fazes briefly, and Lapis begins to sing "That Distant Shore".

column4: ♪ It all became so lovely: ♪ Those bluest skies above me, ♪ Those funny feelings I had never felt before I met you. ♪ I thought I'd stay a while, ♪ I tried to learn to smile. ♪ So many colors I had never even known. ♪ Maybe I'll find myself sitting on that distant shore, ♪ Maybe I'm not alone. ♪

column6: The projection in the room begins to fizzle.

column4: ♪ Then I see the colors fading, ♪ Gentleness of light escaping. ♪ Shadows of my fear invading, ♪ Have I seen this all before? ♪ I know that there's something residing, ♪ A terror deep inside me. ♪ I couldn't understand how you could be so bold? ♪ Maybe I'll find myself smiling on that distant shore, ♪ Maybe I'm not alone. ♪

At least she has Pumpkin.

Are you kidding!? The Moon sucks. There's nothing here! Maybe I'm tired of running away. Maybe I'd rather be with everyone and be in danger than be safe and... alone.

Yeah, but that's alright. Things would just be different.

column6: Steven and Lapis laugh together.

column4: When you go back, we should all hang out more.

PEARL, CAN I ASK YOU SOM-

Peeearl!

But Pearl, don't you see what's happening?
Huh?!
We're actually here! And I am fitting right in! None of that dumb salute- Thank you so much for talking me into this, I couldn't have done this on my own.
Uhh... You're welcome, my Diamond-
Gah- Shhh... Pearl, you're gonna get us in trouble.
Sorry, my... Quartz.

column6: Rose giggles and leads Pearl off. They walk up to a group of Amethysts standing by the canyon wall.

column4: Hey... fellow Amethyst guards! What are we all up to?
There's two more from our unit that haven't emerged yet, so we're gonna wait for them. Here comes one of them.

column6: An Amethyst bursts out from the wall and lands on the ground, groaning in disorientation. Rose walks up to her and clutches her shoulders.

column4: Oh, wow, look at you. Welcome to Earth!
That is the first and... nicest thing anyone has ever said to me.
What's going on here? Our orders were to move out as soon as you emerged!
But 8XM hasn't emerged yet.
She can catch up with us later. Go, go, go!
Hup! Hup! Hup!

column6: The Amethysts ran off and Rose started to follow them, but Pearl quickly halted her.

column4: My Diamond? Please? Let's not draw any more attention to ourselves than we already have.
Ugh you're right. But things were getting really fun.
What if, we took some time to explore some of Earth's other features?
Pearl! You're so smart.

column6: The flashback pauses briefly, returning to Steven, Sapphire and Pearl.

column4: So it was all, just so she could get out and have some fun?
Well, that's how it started...

column6: The flashback continues; Rose and Pearl exit the Prime Kindergarten to observe the surroundings of Earth.

column4: So... This... is Earth.
And this is just a small portion of the resources available for making Gems on this planet.
I have to see it all.

column6: A montage begins as Rose and Pearl explore Earth together. They walk through a field of flowers, chase a butterfly, and watch a fish in a river. The pair then see a group of humans collecting water from the river, when Rose comes to a horrific realization. The sky begins to grow dark, the pair return back to the Kindergarten, with Rose looking uneasy.

column4: Is everything alright, my Diamond? You seem troubled.
All this life that's been growing wild here on Earth... None of it... will survive my invasion. We're not creating life from nothing. We're taking life, and leaving nothing behind.

column6: Flashes of lightning strike as thunder is heard, and it begins to rain.

column4: Forgive me, my Diamond. I shouldn't have brought you to such a place.
No. I needed to see this.

column6: Rose gazes at the Kindergarten, now looking dark and ominous.
The flashback pauses again, returning to Steven, Sapphire and Pearl.

column4: So she did want to protect Earth. She didn't realize what the colony was doing to the planet.
So what?! She suddenly started to care about Earth? Why did she have to rope us into all this? Why couldn't she just stop the colonization herself?
She tried.

column6: A flashback montage is shown of Pink Diamond pleading to Blue and Yellow Diamond, only to be shut down by them.

column4: When she told the other Diamonds she didn't want to go through with the colony, they told her to finish what she started. When she told the other Diamonds she wanted to preserve life on Earth, they created the zoo and threw a handful of humans in. She did everything she could as Pink Diamond. But her status meant nothing to Blue and Yellow. So she decided to make a stand, as someone they couldn't ignore.

column6: In her fury, Pink Diamond shapeshifts into Rose Quartz.

column4: She was going to scare every Gem off the planet. But everything changed when she saw... your fusion.

column6: Rose and Pearl saw the newly-fused Garnet for the first time, but quickly fled before the Homeworld Gems could catch them.
Rose begins musing over Garnet's fusion as she and Pearl trod through a forest.

column4: I still can't believe it. Only on Earth, don't you think? Only on Earth where anything can happen. A fusion of two completely different Gems! Can all Gems do that? How have I never heard of this?! I've only ever heard that it's unheard of. Can you imagine what that must feel li-

column6: Pearl suddenly lifts Rose above her by her feet.

column4: Fusion... Activate!

column6: Pearl quickly loses balance, and she and Rose collapse onto the ground.

column4: Oh! I thought- If a Ruby and a Sapphire- But you're a Diamond- Forgive me! What am I doing? I... I need to be replaced immediately!
No!

column6: Pearl begins blushing madly, while Rose gazes at her in awe.

column4: But I've been... imagining things, even when you haven't asked me to. I imagined that I ran away and met you here on Earth, a Rose Quartz. And I'm not yours, but, I make you so happy anyway! Isn't that ridiculous?! Tell me to stop!
Please don't ever stop!

column6: Pearl and Rose suddenly fuse into Rainbow Quartz, but she quickly brakes apart, and the pair collapse onto the ground again.

column4: This is very not allowed.
That fusion! We never should've left her there with Blue! Who knows what sort of horrible punishment-

column6: Just then, a rustling is heard in some bushes nearby. Pearl, with a sword in hand, cautiously searches through the bushes and finds Garnet, having fallen down a hill.

column4: Ouch... Ah!

column6: Garnet flinches at the sight of Pearl, as Rose walks towards them through the bushes.

column4: We didn't mean to fuse! Well... well, we did this time. We'll unfuse! We, we'll...
No, no, please... I'm glad to see you again.

column6: The flashback concludes, as it stops snowing and the ice around the sanctuary begins to thaw.

column4: Before Garnet, Rose was only fighting for Earth. But Garnet changed everything. Rose wanted to fight for her, she wanted to fight for Gems! And maybe she was foolish, and maybe even... selfish! But she was-
Following us.
What?
This whole time, we thought we were following her, but she was following us. How could she not after you swept her off her feet?
W-What? Me?
Are you kidding? You took her on this whirlwind tour of Earth and then she wanted to live here with you forever!

column6: Pearl begins blushing madly.

column4: That's just how I felt when I came here with...  Ruby! Oh no! We have to get back right away!

column6: The group warps back to the dark-looking beach house.

column4: Ruby! I'm so sorry! Where...? Huh?

column6: Sapphire then sees a note on the floor with "Sapphire" written on it.

column4: Oh no...

column6: Following the events in "Now We're Only Falling Apart", Sapphire, Steven and Pearl warp back home from Rose's Fountain.

column4: Ruby! I’m so sorry! Where...? Huh?

column6: Sapphire finds a note on the floor that has “Sapphire” written on it.

column4: Oh no.

column6: Sapphire picks up the note and begins to read it.

column4: "Sapphire, you were right. I need some time to think, so I am running away? Ruby." This can’t be happening.  Oh Ruby, I’m so sorry. You left before I can take back all the horrible things I said to you.

column6: Pearl takes the letter off of Sapphire’s hand and reads it as well.

column4: Well... Amethyst was with her, right? Maybe she knows she went.

column6: Electronic sounds are heard, and the group finds Amethyst playing video games on Steven's bed.

column4: Amethyst, have you seen Ruby?
Yeah, I've seen her. Huh, she asked me for a pen and paper a while ago. Why?
Because, she ran away!  Did you see where she went?
I don't know, maybe she'll come back. It's not my job to babysit her.  Hey, Steven! Get over here, I need a Player Two!
Hold on a second, Amethyst. Do you see her coming back in your future vision, Sapphire?
Oh? Oh! Maybe! But... She's so wonderful... and spontaneous! I have no idea what she could- Why would she be a cowboy?!

column6: Sapphire clings to Pearl's legs and begins sobbing loudly. Pearl pats her head, kneels down to her level and holds Sapphire's hands.

column4: There, there. It's going to be okay. She's going to come back! She's got to come back! If she doesn't then... then, there would be no more Garnet. And... what on Earth would we do without Garnet?
Oh, Pearl! How will I ever get her back?!

column6: Pearl embraces Sapphire, as Sapphire clings to Pearl's arm, visibly trembling.

column4: I- I don't know! You two are incredible together! It can't be over! It can't be!!

column6: Both Pearl and Sapphire begin sobbing loudly together, while Amethyst watches on uncomfortably.

column4: Uhh... Why don’t you two take all of this into the Temple?  Steven and I are going to play some video games.
No, no, it’s ok! Don’t worry Sapphire. I’m gonna go out and find Ruby.
What?
I’ll be right back with her in no time.

column6: Steven walks off, leaving Amethyst behind, while Pearl and Sapphire continue to sob loudly.

column4: Yo Steven, wait up! I’m coming too.

column6: Steven begins looking around while Amethyst unenthusiastically walks up to him.

column4: I don’t think Ruby used the Warp Pad. She said she was running away, not warping away; she’s usually pretty literal. We just need to figure out which direction she ran in.
So, how do we do that?
Uh... Let's try putting ourselves in Ruby's shoes.
Heheheh, now what?
Amethyst, be serious.

column6: Amethyst looks umamused.

column4: She could've only gone in one of two directions, either into town, or into the ocean.

column6: Steven and Amethyst ponder for a moment.
Steven and Amethyst decide to search around the ocean first for Ruby.

column4: Ruby! Ruuuby!
Ruby!

column6: Steven and Amethyst exits the ocean, after searching for Ruby with no luck.

column4: Okay... So... She wasn't underwater...

column6: Steven and Amethyst start walking towards Beach City.

column4: Ruby!?
Ruby...

column6: Amethyst nudges a seashell on the sand gently with her foot.

column4: Ruby?
I really don't think she's hiding under a seashell.
Maybe Ruby shapeshifted really small! You never know.

column6: Amethyst shapeshifts really small and climbs inside the seashell.

column4: What a spacious house! I'll keep it.
Amethyst... You know I love these great goofs but...  I'm worried about Ruby, can you stop messing around and turn back to normal?
You're the boss.

column6: Amethyst shapeshifts back to her normal size, bursting out of the seashell and falling on top of Steven, who is unimpressed.

column4: We need to think... Where would Ruby go if she ran away? Is there anyone in town that she knows?

column6: Steven and Amethyst arrive at Greg's car wash, and Steven peeks into the shop

column4: Doesn't look like she's here.
Dead end, huh?
We've just got to keep looking.

column6: A montage begins to play, as Steven frantically searches for Ruby, while an disengaged Amethyst follows him around. At Vidalia's garage, Steven draws a missing poster for Ruby, and Vidalia gives a thumbs-up in approval.

Steven pastes a copy of the missing poster on Peedee's food truck, while Amethyst orders a tray full of fry bits. Amethyst offers the fry bits to Steven, but he walks away, ignoring Amethyst, and she takes a bite of the bits in dejection.

At the pier fun fair, Steven and Amethyst ride on the teacup ride. Amethyst is having a blast while Steven scatters the posters all around the fair grounds. Afterwards, Amethysy wins a prize from a game booth to get Steven's attention, but Steven is too focused searching for Ruby.

At the top of the lighthouse, Steven searches all around town using Ronaldo's telescope, while an uninterested Amethyst carries him on her shoulders. Looking through the telescope, he spots Bill Dewey sweeping outside the Big Donut, Sadie hanging out with the Cool Kids, and Onion emerging from some bushes and noticing Steven, but no Ruby.
Steven peeks through the windows into the pizzeria.

column4: She's not in here either... This is where I'd go if I was feeling down... Pizza always cheers me up.
So, why don't we get some?
But... We haven't found Ruby yet.
Steven, it's cool you wanna help Ruby, but... What about you?

column6: Steven looks down in reluctance.

column4: Come on! Let's forget about Ruby for a moment and get some pizza!
I'm not hungry!

column6: Steven's stomach suddenly starts growling.

column4: Maybe I'm a little hungry?

column6: Steven and Amethyst sit at a table inside as Kiki serves a pizza onto the table.

column4: Here's your pizza, with literally all the toppings.
Yessss...!

column3: ['hands a spoon to Steven and Amethyst']
column4: Oh, and here. You're gonna need these.
Thanks!
Yeah, thanks man!
You're welcome!

column6: Steven grabs the spoon and begins picking the food a little. Amethyst grabs a slice of pizza and rolls it up.

column4: So... Pink Diamond, huh?
Yep...

column6: Steven scoops up some of the toppings with his spoon and eats it, while Amethyst takes a big bite of her pizza.

column4: Mmm... Rose Quartz, eh?
Mm-hmm...
So... All this time... You thought Rose was this rebel leader, but... She was just rebelling against herself?
Apparently.
And the Diamond that Rose supposedly shattered. I mean... You've got it. It's right there under your shirt.

column6: Steven lifts up his shirt, glances at his gem and nods.

column4: Yeah..
So... How are you feelin'?
I feel... confused. I-I thought I'd really finally got it. That Mom didn't have everything figured out, even though everybody put her way up on this pedestal, but... now I guess she's royalty too?
Mm-hmm, mm-hmm.
I'm relieved that she didn't shatter anyone, but... She lied to everyone. I mean... I'm not surprised. I knew she was a liar. But this is just... so much.

column6: Steven grabs a slice of pizza and attempts to eat it, but the toppings falls off his slice onto the table.

column4: But like... Aren't you mad?

column3: ['wraps the fallen toppings in a napkin']
column4: Kind of? I don't know... I can see how she was good and bad... and bad and good.  But I... I guess what really matters right now is how hard Garnet took it.

column6: Amethyst slams her fists on the table.

column4: But what about you?! She's your mom! You were always under all this pressure to be like her! But... Was she even like her?! Was anyone ever like her?!

column6: Amethyst begins digging into the pizza with her spoon, while a shocked Steven listens to her rant.

column4: She was supposed to be so great! She was supposed to know everything! And... Ugh... She was supposed to make everything better! It's not fair! We shouldn't have to deal with any of this, we shouldn't have to fix any of this, we weren't around for a stupid war! This... is everyone else's problem... This has nothing to do with me...

column6: Steven stares intently at Amethyst, who flusters in response.

column4: And you! This has nothing to do with you!
Amethyst, hold on a second. Are you okay?
No! I mean... Yes! Of course, I'm okay! Ugh... I'm trying to find out how you feel about all this! Ugh! She's... your mom, okay? Doesn't really affect me.

column6: Just then, Jenny enters the pizzeria.

column4: Dude! Kiki, I just got the biggest tip from Mr. Universe and I'm totally gonna buy those boots now!
Woah... Seriously?
Yeah! He was like all the way out on Brooding Hill, which is totally out of our delivery radius, comforting some little friend! She must've been crying because she was like really red.
Ruby!
Let me handle this, Steven! No more adult should be putting anything else on you. Just let someone else take care of it for once!

column6: Amethyst stomps outside and Steven chases after her.

column4: Amethyst, wait! There's someone else who needs help even more, and it's you! Amethyst, we need to talk!
Uhh... Can't now, bud.  Going to find Ruby!

column6: Amethyst takes off into the sky, but Steven jumps up after her and clings onto her back.

column4: Let me help you with your feelings!
Get off my back, dude!

column6: Amethyst tries to shake Steven off her back.

column4: Wuh- Come on! You can- Ugh!- Talk to me!

column6: Steven is flung onto Amethyst's leg, and Amethyst begins twirling around, trying to shake Steven off.

column4: Geh uh- Euh! If you open up you'll feel so much better!

column6: Steven loses grip and is flung upwards, landing onto Amethyst's head, where the helicopter seats are.

column4: Come on! You're hiding something!
Get out of my head, Steven!
Am I getting too personal?
Dude, you're literally inside my head!
Amethyst, look out!

column6: Distracted by Steven, Amethyst accidentally collides into the Water Tower and begins diving towards the ground.

column4: We're crashing!!
But... How does that make you feel?!

column6: The pair crash-lands into the beach. Steven slowly gets up and sits up, while Amethyst is seen lying on the ground, with her face dragged across and buried into the sand.

column4: A-Amethyst?
You wanna know how I feel, Steven?!
I thought I was pretty clear about that.

I thought I was pretty clear too! I feel like I don't wanna say, "What about me?" Okay!? And I don't want to be bent out of shape! I don't wanna be stuck in the past, and I'm not responsible for what Rose did! None of us are! Not you... Not Pearl... And not Garnet! But I am responsible for me! And right now, I am NOT gonna dump another thousand-year-old complex on you or anybody else! I'm ending it right here! I am the ding-dong sunshine future; your friend forever! And I'm not gonna fall apart on you.
Amethyst..
So Steven, how do you feel?
Pretty good.
... Good.

column6: Amethyst sits next to Steven and flops backwards onto the ground.

column4: Have you been trying to cheer me up this whole time?
Yesss...! Geez... Don't you know you deserve it? You... Great... Person?

column6: Steven and Amethyst remain silently on the beach for a moment.

column4: Hey, Amethyst?
What?
I can't believe I'm going to say this, but... I think you're officially the most mature Crystal Gem.
Oh... No...! Ugh, gross! That's what this is, isn't it?
Yeah... Pretty much.
No! Nyooooooh!

column6: Amethyst and Steven laugh together in joy.

column4: You still wanna find Ruby?
Yeah.
Alright. Let's go.

column6: Amethyst shapeshifts into a helicopter and begins flying with Steven into the sky. Steven then spots Greg and Ruby sitting on top of Brooding Hill.

column4: There they are!
Target spotted!
Let's go in for a landing!

column6: Amethyst flies in closer towards the two, as the episode ends.
Following the events in "What's Your Problem?", Amethyst and Steven find Ruby, sitting next to Greg by his van.

column4: Ruby!
Oh boy... So she's all the way out here...
After everything Sapphire said, she must be heartbroken.

column6: Amethyst and Steven proceed to walk up to Ruby and Greg.

column4: Hey guys!
Steven? How'd you find me?
We sensed you...!
We... heard you ordered pizza.
Ruby was just telling me about your mom.
Oh... Are you okay?
Well, I fell in love with Rose Quartz, and she fell in love with Mr. Universe. Sure, she never told me she used to be Pink Diamond, but, heh, I never told her I used to be Gregory DeMayo.
So... How are you holding up, Ruby?

column3: ['holds up a box of pizza to Steven']
column4: I'm okay!  Want a slice?
Uh... Thank you...  Wait, really? You seemed so sad before.
Yeah, but, me and Greg talked it out. I'm fine now.
Are you sure?

column6: Amethyst takes Steven's pizza slice off his hand.

column4: Yeah. Sapphire was kinda right about everything. We really did stay Garnet because Rose told us to be her... Uh...'answer'. It's my first time thinking about it... It's my first time really thinking about... me!
What do you mean?

Back when I emerged, the first thing I did was get crammed together with a bunch of other Rubies! Then... I was with Sapphire all the time. I was always checking in on someone. But now... I can go wherever the wind takes me!

column6: Ruby grabs three pizza slices and three comic books in each hand.

column4: I'm up here, eating pizza, reading comics! I don't know if Sapphire wants to read comics. I don't have to know!

column6: Ruby throws the items on the ground and somersaults onto the roof of the Greg's van.

column4: The rest of my life could be like this! I don't have to be Garnet... I can be on my own!
Sure!
I guess.
Whhhaaaaat?! B-But you guys love each other! You're my favorite couple! You're- You're like sugar and flour, I- I love eating them separately, but I still want cake! I'm sure Sapphire would want-
I'm not fussed about what Sapphire wants! I've seen my own future now. And it's nothin' but Ruby!

column6: Steven silently starts freaking out.

column4: Relax, kiddo. This could be what she needs.
But, Dad! What if they never form Garnet again?! We gotta get them back together!
Woah... Tha-That's not our call to make! Ruby's gotta want that for herself! If that's not what Ruby wants, then it's not what Garnet wants, right?
Mmm... Ugh, I guess so...

column6: Ruby begins jumping up and down on the van in enthusiasm.

column4: So... Where you going after this, dude? You just gonna stay out here?
I wanna live free! One with the wilderness! Facing danger in every turn! Not leaving nothin' or nobody to get me by! Just like... this guy!

column6: Ruby holds up a comic book titled "Dolphin Tail".

column4: Hmm. Do you mean... something like this?

column6: Steven shows Ruby another comic called "Lonesome Lasso". Ruby jumps down from the van and takes the comic book.

column4: That's even better! The open plains, that's where I wanna go!
I think I know just the place. I'll get ya there.
Thank you!!
Alright, alright, if this is how it's gotta be. I'll support Ruby in her quest for emotional growth.
Yee-haw! Pa-pow, pa-pow! Bang bang bang! Woo-hoo!!

column5: Trans. Open Range, The Next Day

column6: Greg drives Ruby, Steven and Amethyst to an open outdoor range.

column4: Y'all ready to wild west it up?

column6: Ruby kicks the back doors of the van open, revealing to be dressed like a cowboy, and jumps out. She pulls the Lonesome Lasso comic from under her hat and begins to read.

column4: "Here I am, on the open range... At least you understand me, horsey."
Oh, Ruby, you need a steed!
I'm always down for a little... horsin around.

column6: Amethyst grunts loudly as she begins to shapeshift into a horse, and neighs proudly.

column4: Giddy-up.

column6: Ruby begins riding on Amethyst's back and treads into the open range, while Steven and Greg follow behind.

column4: How's it goin', Ruby? Feel like a real cowboy now?
Yep. I sure reckon I do.
Sorry I gotta be a yellow-belly about this, but we don't even have a map. I think we're just gonna get ourselves lost.

column6: Amethyst snorts.

column4: I already am lost. That's why I came out here; to find myself.

column6: The group comes to a hedge that blocks their way.

column4: It's a dead end.
This is what I mean. What's behind this brush... I dunno! Sapphire ain't here to predict for me. It's my chance to find out for myself!

column6: Ruby crawls into the hedge, and then screams loudly.

column4: Oh jiminy! Ruby?!

column6: Steven peeks through the hedge to find Ruby standing on a cliff ledge, breathing quickly and looking down at a deep ravine.

column4: Whoa!! I had no idea this ravine was here.

column6: Ruby jumps up to the other side of the cliff.

column4: I almost fell down there. And, it was all my choice! Yee-haw!! Independence!

column6: Steven smiles nervously as Ruby runs around, laughing and cheering herself. A montage begins to play, of Ruby being a cowboy, while she sings "Ruby Rider".

column4: ♪ This ol' Ruby rider, ♪ Is Ruby ridin' alone. ♪ She's a sturdy, ♪ Solitary stone~ ♪

column6: Ruby continues riding on Amethyst into the evening, while Greg drives his van behind. Ruby then attempts to lasso a bull on the range and succeeds, but the bull begins chasing the group in agitation.

column4: ♪ This ol' Ruby rider, ♪ Not a fusion no more. ♪ Now the dirt and the dust, ♪ And the danger is my new home~ ♪

column6: The group encounters a rattlesnake and Ruby decides to have a showdown with it. She glares at it, points a finger-gun at it and succeeds in scaring it away. Night quickly falls, Ruby lights up a campfire, picks up a guitar and continues to sing.

column4: ♪ I used to think I, ♪ Would always be by your side. ♪ But lately you’ve been rather cold. ♪

column6: As Ruby sings, Greg, Steven and Amethyst harmonize with her.

column4: ♪ One look in your eye, ♪ Could make an honest Gem cry. ♪ But Ruby Rider don’t need no one to hold. ♪

column6: Ruby sits atop a rock and begins whistling her song, while strumming the guitar.

column4: Wow. Ruby's really getting into this.
Seriously! I just taught her how to play guitar like, ten minutes ago!
No Dad, I mean the whole "cowboy-being-alone" thing. I've never seen her like this before... She seems really... happy.
♪ This ol' Ruby rider, ♪ Is Ruby ridin' alone. ♪ She's a sturdy, ♪ Solitary stone~ ♪ Yee-haw~

column6: Greg and Amethyst are fast asleep, Greg is snoring loudly while Amethyst whinnies in her sleep. Steven, in his caterpillar sleeping bag, looks up at Ruby, who is still sitting atop the rock.

column4: Hey, Ruby.
Hmm?

Y'know... I got really scared when you said you didn't want to fuse with Sapphire any more. I felt like I was losing someone I cared about. But I saw how much fun you were having today. All this buckaroo-ing really suits you. I'm sorry I tried to push you back into being Garnet.
It's... not true...
Huh?
That stuff I sang about... It's not true...!
W-What?!

I mean, I did have a lot of fun today; I loved it! But... the whole time, I... I kept thinkin' about how much more fun I'd have if I were with her. Sapphire was always there with me. I feel her smile just like it was mine. It's so lonely now... Gaaah!

column6: Ruby leans backwards and slides down the rock, landing on her head with her arms crossed in annoyance.

column4: That's lame, right?! I came here to be my own gem, but, I'm still thinkin' about what she'd like! What'd she want! All, the time!  Turns out, I'm no good at not needin' nobody.
C'mon, that's not lame. You led us on a frontier adventure! You're still the same Ruby who did all that stuff, even if you're thinking of someone. Look at our friend Lonesome Lasso.

column6: Steven picks up the Lonesome Lasso comic book and walks to Ruby.

column4: They call him that 'cause he's lonesome! "I miss Sally May!" He's still a rootin'-tootin' cowboy, blazin' his own trails. But, he loves someone too.

column3: ['blushes and gazes up to the sky', 'sighs and gets up']
column4: Well, if I'm making my own decisions... Then, I'll decide I wanna be with Sapphire.  I mean, I've gotta ask her first. I just don't want it to feel like we're going back to how things used to be; back when someone else told us to be together. I want it to feel different...
Wait a sec!  What do you think of this?

column6: Steven shows Ruby a page of the comic, and she gasps and grins in delight.

column5: Trans. Int. Beach House, The Next Day

column6: Pearl and Sapphire are seen sitting on the couch, still troubled over Ruby's departure, when Steven enters the house.

column4: Steven! Did you find Ruby?
She's outside. She's got something to say to you.

column6: Sapphire, Steven and Pearl step out onto the porch, when they see Ruby and Amethyst standing on the beach in the sunrise.

column4: Ruby!

column6: Sapphire quickly runs off the porch and up to Ruby.

column4: Ruby, I'm so sorry! I should have never said those awful things to you. That we didn't matter any more; I shouldn't have pushed you away like that. I was wrong.

column6: Ruby spits away the wheat grass she is chewing out of her mouth.

column4: Pt'ooey! Naw, you were right.

column6: Sapphire reacts in shock as Ruby jumps off of Amethyst's back. She pats Amethyst's side, signalling her to run off, and approaches Sapphire.

column4: Someone else told us we were the answer. But... I don't believe that anymore. At least, not 'til I hear it from you.

column6: Ruby holds out her hand to Sapphire. Sapphire takes her hand, and Ruby kneels before her, as a wind blows away her cowboy hat.

column4: Sapphire... Will you marry me?
What?  Marry you?
Yeah! This way we can be together, even when we're apart! This time, being Garnet will be our decision. What do you say?
Of course.
Yee-haw! Mmmm...!
I've been waiting to kiss your cute face!

column6: Sapphire kisses Ruby on her cheek. Ruby lifts Sapphire up and spins her around, and they begin laughing together in joy.

column4: AWWWW!

column6: Steven and Pearl watch on the romantic scene on the porch, when Amethyst approaches from behind, startling Pearl.

column4: Psst, it's me. I'm a horse.

column6: Pearl smiles and places her hand on Amethyst's mane. Steven!
