column6: Pearl brings Steven back to Pink's room, and he starts patting water out of his ear.

column4: This is so weird. Was this some sort of spa day or something? And what about Pink? Did she have a job here, or did she just sit in a room while they were off doing whatever?
Before her colony, Pink used to throw massive balls.
She was a juggler?!
No- Well, yes. But she would also throw parties for the other Diamonds to mark their many accomplishments. Every member of every court would show up to bask in the presence of all four Diamonds.
Even White would come?
Oh, yes! Huh, I wonder what's even become of Pink's court.  That reminds me. Hang tight, I'll be back.
Where would I even... go...? What did I get myself into?

column6: Steven falls stomach down onto the floor. The floor activates and a platform raises underneath him, as a bunch of Pebbles climb on top of him.

column4: Am I just supposed to be Pink Diamond now?! Hey Pebbles, can you help me? Who was she? What did she do? And why does this feel so...

column6: The Pebbles mumbles among themselves, as Steven gets off the platform and begins to sing "Familiar".

The Pebbles help Steven get dressed into the outfit. Steven, joined by the Pebbles, then walks onto the balcony and points in determination at White Diamond's ship, as he concludes his song. At that moment, the door opens and Pearl runs in the room.

column4: Steven! I'm back with-

column6: Pearl pauses to see Steven, dressed like Pink Diamond, standing at the balcony, as the Pebbles run out of sight.

column4: Hi, Pearl. I just thought I'd, uh, dress for the occasion.
Well... you're not the only one with surprises.

column6: Pearl pulls Garnet, Connie, and Amethyst out of her gem.

column4: Guys!  Mmm! I figured it out! Remember back when I was little and maybe kind of annoying, and I couldn't come along on adventures? You guys would still drop everything to hang out with me! That's Pink Diamond! I know I can do this! Just watch- I'm gonna throw a huge ball, and I'm gonna invite everyone!

column6: Steven is seen balancing on a bubble, juggling three smaller bubbles containing MC Bear-Bear, Chaaaaps, and his ukulele. A pink Pearl watches in amazement and claps for Steven. Steven jumps off the bubble and lands gracefully, blowing a kiss and smiling to Pink Pearl as she continues to clap. Just then, Yellow Diamond appears at the doorway and stares in anger, watching Pink Pearl getting Steven ready for the ball. She extends her neck in a comically way over to them, Pink Pearl does the Gem salute and Steven waves at her. Yellow Diamond smiles and leaves the room shortly. Steven glares at Pink Pearl for a moment, mocking Yellow, and they both start to laugh. Steven then starts coughing and a piece of Rose's hair comes out of his mouth onto his hand. The background turns black as Pink Pearl gets pulled away from Steven, and the bubble he was standing on pops. Steven looks up and sees White Diamond staring at him with a deranged smile. Steven continues to cough and throws up more of Rose's hair.
Steven wakes up abruptly in a cold sweat, back in reality.

column4: Steven? Are you okay?
Yeah. I just had a really weird nightmare.
Pink's moving again!

column6: The Pebble runs up to Connie, who begins to wake up too, while another Pebble uses Steven's phone nearby.

column4: Oh hey! Good morning.
It's something with four legs and a lot of cushions on top!

column6: The Pebbles construct a couch-like piece of furniture in the room to Amethyst's specifications. Amethyst leaps onto it and gives a thumbs-up.

column4: The Pebbles have been working all night. What do you think?
It almost feels like home.
Almost...

column6: Garnet stares out the balcony at White Diamond's bust ship in unrest.
Steven and Pearl proceed to have an audience with Yellow and Blue Diamond in the throne room.

column4: A ball? We haven't had a ball in 6,000 years.
We haven't had Pink in 6,000 years!
Yeah! When White Diamond shows up, we can tell her why we need her help on Earth!
And, this can also mark the beginning of Era 3.
You're right, it's brilliant.
Thank you, Yellow! Thank you, Blue!
If White is going to be there, everything has to be perfect! Pink, can you manage this on your own? Our Pearls can help you get started.

column6: Blue Pearl warps into the room, doing the Gem salute.

column4: At your service, Pink Diamond.

column6: Yellow Pearl also warps into the room, doing the Gem salute too.

column4: Make sure you go through all of our customs with Pink, since she has so much trouble recalling her past here on Homeworld.
Yes, My Diamond.
Era 3! Steven, you're already changing the world!
Yeah! Come on, party Pearls!
We are at your command, Pink Diamond.
Just call me Steven!
Whatever you command, Pink Diamond.

column6: The Crystal Gems are gathered around the steps to Pink Diamond's throne, as Steven begins planning the ball with Yellow and Blue Pearl.

column4: Balloons everywhere! Confetti cannons too!
Dibs on being the confetti cannon!
Cannons are forbidden inside palace walls. These "balloons", you're referring to, are unprecedented and therefore out of the question.
So what is precedented and therefore in the question?
You are to sit on your elevated throne, while the members of your court indicate to you that they are present.
Yikes, this sounds pretty dry.
Liquids are forbidden in the ball room.
All right.

column6: Steven proceeds to jumps up the steps to Pink Diamond's throne, along with Yellow Pearl.

column4: From here, you can accept or reject the members of your court at your leisure. My Diamond will do the same. As will Blue Diamond, and if we are so lucky, all of us will enjoy the impeccable judgement of White Diamond.
So when she gets here, I'll just hop up there and talk to her?
Oh, stars! No! I forgot how silly you can be. Everyone stays where they belong.

column3: ['hops off the throne onto the floor']
column4: Oh, so...  I'll just wait until I get a chance to talk to her on the dance floor!
Pink Diamond! Your subjects will do the dancing for you! Why would a Diamond want to dance?
Because dancing's fun!
What is... "fuh-un"?
You know, it's when you do something you wanna do, just because it feels good.
I don't think we do that here.
Well, is there something you really like to do?
Oh!  Of course not! My feelings are irrelevant.
I like to draw.
W-w-w-what?!
Can I see some of your stuff?

column3: ['pulls out a screen with her drawings']
column4: Um, here.  My Diamond allows me to draw during court proceedings. They're nothing much.

column6: Blue Pearl shows a drawing of Yellow Diamond zapping someone with her electric power.

column4: Let me see that! You can't share these; they're highly confidential!

column6: Yellow Pearl scrolls through Blue Pearl's drawing and sees a drawing of herself.

column3: ['hands the screen back to Blue Pearl', 'poses elegantly']
column4: Hmm... Not bad.  Try a different angle.
That's it!  You like being a model!  And you like being an artist!

column6: Yellow Pearl starts laughing proudly, when Blue Diamond enters the room, and the Pearls quickly stand in attention.

column4: Pink! Why aren't you getting ready?
I guess I am ready, if all I have to do is sit in a chair.
Are you really going to look like this?! Even at the ball?
I can't really help it.
You weren't thinking of inviting your "Earth friends", are you?
Why wouldn't I?

column6: Blue Diamond places her palms between Steven and the Crystal Gems, and separates him from them.

column4: Steven!
They can't come? Aren't they my... court or whatever?

Pink, quit fooling around! White Diamond is going to be there! We have to present her with our best possible selves, just as our Gems have to present us with their best possible selves. A ball is a chance to inspire everyone!
But my friends are super inspiring! They'll inspire White, too. Together we can make a case for Earth!
Very well, you can bring your Pearl, of course, and your pet.
Uhh, pet?
I think she means me.
As for this faulty Amethyst...
Oh boy, here it comes.
She'll need limb enhancers to meet her height requirements. The Sapphire will need to enter with the other Sapphires of course, and the Ruby will need to enter with the guards.
Woah, woah, woah. Are you talking about Garnet?
Garnet? Does "that" call herself a Garnet? Haha! What would you have her do? Enter with the Demantoids? The Hessonites, the Pyropes? Pink, I'm being very generous, but you can't expect me to-
I won't go.
Garnet?
At least the Sapphire in there has some sense.
Grrr!
Ummm...
Pink! Are you going to ring in the ball?
What?
Ugh. I'll take care of it. I'll take care of everything. Come, Pearls!

column6: Blue Diamond walks off as Yellow and Blue runs after her.

column4: Garnet...
I'll find you when it's over.
I thought we'd get to do this together!
Steven, this is your chance to talk to White. She's not going to listen to me but she might listen to Pink.
And she'll listen when I tell her about you! Once I talk to White Diamond, I'll change everything. I promise.

column6: Loud mechanical-like music is heard as the ball commences. Steven is seen sitting on his throne, with Pearl and Connie on his sides, while various Homeworld Gems are gathered in the throne room. He looks up and sees a statue-like Gem singing the ballroom music.

column4: Pink Diamond! It's wonderful to be in your presence.
Uhh, thank you!
Wow! So radiant and sparkly!

column6: The pair of Gems leaves, and another pair arrives, looking identical to the previous one.

column4: Pink Diamond!
That's me! Your ding-dang Diamond!
Wow! So radiant and exquisite!
Steven! You're doing great! White Diamond will be very impressed.
Well she better be.
Yo! My Diamond!

column6: Amethyst, now wearing purple limb enhancers, arrives before Steven.

column4: Amethyst!  Is it okay if I say hi?
We're starting soon, but if you're quick about it-
Thanks Pearl!
Steven! Your manners!
Oh! Right.  Amethyst, it is good to see you.
Good to see you! My Diamond.
Sorry you have to wear those limb enhancers.
I'm not sure how Peridot put up with these things but, I'm getting used to it. Yo, check out this cool party trick I taught myself!

column6: Amethyst maneuvers one of her enhancer fingers to touch her nose and then floats it over to Steven.

column4: Amethyst, come on!
I know, this is a serious party. Anyway, I'm going to go mingle with some Quartzes.  Hi! How's it going?
I really hope this works out, Connie.  Ruby and Sapphire are here!

column6: Ruby and Sapphire arrive separated, alongside with other Homeworld Rubies and Sapphires.

column4: When I told Garnet I still wanted her to come, I-I hope she didn't think I meant I wanted her to split.
I'm sure she just wants to support you in any way she can.
Everyone, behold! The daunting, beauty and elegance that is, Yellow Diamond!

column6: Aquamarines pull back the curtains, revealing Yellow Diamond, sparkling her radiance as she enters the throne room. A Jade tries to take a peek, but another Jade nudges her back into position.

column4: Not a bad turnout, Pink.
I appreciate your attendance, Yellow.
Ahem, everyone prepare yourselves emotionally for the overpowering elegance that is, Blue Diamond.

column6: Blue Diamond dazzles her radiance and enters the room. The Jade previously starts to cry, and the other Jade rolls her eyes at her.

column4: You're doing great!
Thank you, Blue.

column6: Suddenly, the ballroom turns completely dark. A pair of spotlights shine upon White Pearl in the room, and all the Gems watch on in awe.

column4: To those in attendance of the Era 3 ball, White Diamond... has more important things to attend to.
WHAT?!

column6: White Pearl encases herself in a white bubble, sinks into the floor and appears on White Diamond's throne.

column4: Therefore, I will be here to observe in her place. Welcome, to Era 3!
Gah!

column6: The Gems in the ball start to dance in a mechanical manner, while White Pearl observes, smiling derangedly.

column4: I made everyone do this and it's so... miserable.

column6: Amethyst tries to dance with her limb enhancers, alongside the other Quartzes, but slips and falls.

column4: Steven.
Don't you mean "Pink Diamond"?
Of course I don't! Come on, do you wanna dance?
Yeah... But, I'm not supposed to.
It's your party.
But White expects me-
She's not here.

column6: Steven and Connie jump off the throne and onto the dance floor, catching the attention of Sapphire, Ruby and several Homeworld Gems.

column4: Everybody's staring!
Since when does that bother you?
I'm sorry everyone, uhh!
Steven? We're gonna be okay; I'm here. Look at me, we'll get through this together.

column6: Connie holds Steven's hands and they begin laughing and dancing together. White Pearl's smile quickly turns into a frown, as the pair accidentally fuse together in their dance. Yellow Pearl watches in horror and Yellow Diamond immediately stands up in rage.

column4: Pink, what are you doing?!
I was just dancing! Huh!?

column6: Stevonnie realized that they have fused, and everybody in the ball stares at them in total shock.

column4: Pink, this is completely unacceptable! Unfuse or I'll make you!

column6: Ruby and Sapphire quickly rush in and fuse back into Garnet.

column4: You'll have to go through me!
And me!
Yeah!

column6: Pearl scoops Amethyst up and they fuse into Opal, joining Stevonnie and Garnet. The two Jades earlier quickly fuse together too.

column4: And me!

column6: Opal and Stevonnie look at Garnet, and she shrugs.

column4: I knew it! I knew I couldn't be the only one! AAHHH!

column6: Yellow Diamond zaps the Jade Fusion, Opal, and Garnet in quick succession with her electric powers, causing them all to destabilize and poof back into their gems.

column4: Opal! Garnet!
Pink! You've gone too far, even for you!

column6: Yellow Diamond grabs Stevonnie and throws them into a dark room.

column4: Stay in here and think about what you've done!
No, wait!

column6: Yellow Diamond shuts the door, leaving Stevonnie alone in the pitch-black room.

Following the events in "Together Alone", after being thrown into a dark empty room by Yellow Diamond, Stevonnie attempts to get out by bashing against the door with Steven's shield, but gets blown back when the shield breaks.

column4: Ughh... Hmm. Not getting out that way.  A window!

column6: Stevonnie climbs up and looks out of the window, finding themselves in a solitary tower high above the ground. They then accidentally slips and falls off the window, unfusing back into Steven and Connie.

column4: You okay?
Mm-hmm.

column3: ['sighs and pulls out a Protes bar']
column4: Well... Good thing I grabbed a couple of these before the ball. Otherwise, we'd have nothing to eat. Can't escape Gem prison on an empty stomach.

column6: Connie breaks the energy bar in half. She hands Steven a half, and the pair chomps down on the energy bar.

column4: We never should have come here.
What?
This whole plan! What was I even thinking?
Well, you were thinking that if you came to Homeworld and talked to White Diamond, maybe you could save all the corrupted Gems on Earth.
Oh right. And look where that got us.
Well, we knew it wouldn't be easy.
Yeah, but I didn't think I'd get every Crystal Gem poofed at the same time. And what'll Dad say when he finds out? His only son, in jail at fourteen! What a disgrace...

We can't give up; one step at a time! We'll think of something. Okay, so, we tried the bubble and the shield and that window. What else have we got? Uh... Hey, my phone. Oh, wait. No reception. Not that there's anyone we could call for help anyway.

column6: Steven, curled up in distress, begins to slip into his psychic mind state, but quickly wakes up, breaking out of the state and gasps in shock and realization.

column4: How long do you think they'll keep up locked up in here? 100 years?
That's it!
Really? 100 years?!
No, call for help. There's one Crystal Gem left that hasn't been poofed, and that's Bismuth. Maybe I can reach her with my sleeping psychic mind powers.
You think you can do that? Reach all the way to Earth with your mind?
It'll be a stretch for sure, but I won't know unless I try.
Well, what are we waiting for? Bedtime, mister!
All right. Here goes nothing!
You can do this!

column6: Steven breathes in and out, and then begins to doze off. He then reenters his psychic mind state and leaves his physical body.

column4: Whoa. Connie, I did it. I'm in that psychic ghost space again.
Great! Can you talk to Earth?
H-hang on. I gotta find it first? Okay. Earth, where you at? Come on!  Beach City. Video games, donuts, Dad!

column6: A bright star sparkles in the distance.

column4: There you are!
You find it?
Yeah, but it looks far away. This might take me a while.
Okay. I'll be here. Good luck!

column6: Steven begins to swim away from Connie and through the astral plane towards Earth, seemingly making little progress forward.

column4: This is gonna take forever. Maybe if I...

column6: Steven throws both his arms back simultaneously, causing him to dart forwards quickly towards Earth.

column4: W-whoa! Uh, too fast! Too fast! Slow down! Aah!

column6: Steven tries to halt himself to no avail, as Earth approaches fast and he blacks out.

Steven slowly wakes up and finds himself as a Watermelon Steven again in Mask Island, split in half during the events in "Super Watermelon Island". He roars loudly in distress, causing birds to fly off the island in shock. Steven gets up and begins walking through the forest, disappointed he has entered a situation he did not want, when Melon Mutt pops out from the bushes and pounces on Steven. Steven pulls Melon Mutt off his face, when he spots some Watermelon Stevens, all with yellow stars painted on their bellies like he is, marching in a line. He follows the W.S.s into a village, modeled in the image of Baby Melon. The W.S. villagers are then seen gathering the statue of Baby Melon. A W.S. elder prompts them to assume the pose of Baby Melon and they all bask in the presence of Baby Melon's statue, much to Steven's annoyance. Steven tries to converse with the W.S.s, but one of them, wearing a farmer hat, shushes him. Steven then stomps off in annoyance. Steven walks up to the cliff and gazes out to the ocean, as Melon Mutt runs to his side. Steven proceeds to dives into the ocean and begins swimming, attempting to reach Beach City this way. However, his light body gets washed back ashore on Mask Island, where the farmer W.S. is watching. Steven attempts to draw a picture of the Crystal Temple on the beach, but the farmer W.S. draws the statue of Baby Melon in response, and Steven drops to his knees in dejection. He then draws a small picture of a raft in the sand and runs into the forest, while the farmer W.S. cries out to him with unease. In the forest, Steven begins gathering a stack of sticks while Melon Mutt follows him. He hops over to the other half of the island and spots a stick stuck in the ground. He pulls it out of the ground, only to find it is a spear. Suddenly, a W.S., wielding a shield and wearing war paint on its face, pops out in front of Steven. It snatches the spear from Steven and shortly, Steven finds himself surrounded by more W.S.s. The W.S.s proceed to lead Steven and Melon Mutt into another village, garrisoned and heavily guarded. The W.S.s bring Steven and Melon Mutt towards the statue in the village, modeled after the both of them for their bravery. A W.S. chieftain walks in, wielding a giant spear, and points it at Steven. The W.S.s proceed to wipe the yellow star off his belly and apply war paint on his face, much to Steven's displeasure. Steven tries to wrestle back his stack of sticks from the Spear W.S.s, when the W.S. elder suddenly walks in, along with the Star W.S.s. The Star W.S.s begins to lead Steven out of the village, but the Spear W.S.s blocks their paths. Vastly irritated, Steven wipes off his face war paint and slips away. The Spear W.S.s begin provoking the Star W.S.s, all while the Star W.S.s simply stand in pose of Baby Melon. Steven shakes his head in disapproval of the dispute and walks off. The farmer W.S. from before and a Spear W.S. notice Steven and follow him to the beach. On the beach, Steven begins constructing a raft with the sticks, but is unsuccessful due to his stubby melon hands. He then begins to tear up in defeat, when Melon Mutt, the farmer W.S. and the spear W.S. approach him. The W.S.s notice Steven's drawing of a raft in the sand and begin putting the sticks together, much to Steven's delight. More W.S.s then joins in to help Steven construct the raft. Just then, the W.S. chieftain, provoking the W.S. elder, walk in. The W.S.s proceed to take the chieftain's spear and the elder's cape away to construct the sail, completing Steven's raft. The W.S.s all clap in triumph and Steven begins setting sail out to sea, waving the W.S.s farewell. 'Steven sails happily towards Beach City, when a storm suddenly brews overhead, and Steven struggles to control the raft. After the storm calms, the raft comes to a standstill in the middle of the sea. Steven tries to blow at the sail, but spits out watermelon seeds instead. He then sits in disappointment at the edge of the raft, when a Melon Shark suddenly attacks, destroying the raft, biting off his leg and plunging him underwater. Steven however succeeds in calming the Melon Shark down by patting it and kissing it, causing it to blush and swim away. Steven swims to the water surface, grabs onto a driftwood from his raft and begins paddling his way to Beach City. Time passes on, Steven's melon body begins to rot under the hot sun, causing him to lose an arm. Night quickly falls, Steven floats in exhaustion in the middle of the sea, when Lion pops in, standing on the water surface. Steven grunts in relief at the sight of Lion. Lion licks Steven, places him onto his back and begins running towards Beach City.

Greg is seen strumming his guitar on the beach, when Lion approaches him and shows him Steven on his back, to which he react in shock. "Escapism" begins to play, as Greg brings Steven to Bismuth, who is seen repairing the Beach House, and she reacts in shock too. Steven begins to converse verbally to Greg, Bismuth and Lion, who are unable to understand what he is saying as a Watermelon Steven. Greg hands Steven a stick and he begins to draw on the sand. He illustrates the events of "Together Alone" in the sand, to which Greg and Bismuth still cannot understand. Steven, annoyed, draws in the sand again, this time writing in words, reading "Help! We Need Backup!", and Greg and Bismuth finally understand Steven's message. Steven gives a thumbs-up and collapses onto the sand. Greg, Bismuth and Lion runs up to Steven and Greg gives a thumbs-up, as Steven's mind quickly slips away from his melon body.
Steven gasps as he wakes up, finding himself back in his body, and Connie sleeping behind him.

column4: Guess we'll see what happens.

column6: Steven slowly wakes up and sits up on the floor of a dark room. He looks up and spots a high window, beaming a stream of light upon, as he realizes where he is.

column4: Oh, right. Prison...

column6: Steven then hears the door opening and he turns around, seeing Blue Diamond entering the room, as she immediately begins to berate him.

column4: I cannot believe you! Making a scene like that!
We weren't trying to make a scene! We were just... dancing...?

column6: Steven looks around then room to find Connie is nowhere to be found.

column4: Connie?  What have you done with Connie?!
What have I done?! What have you done!? You're the one that wanted to keep those organics from the Kyanite colony! I'm just the fool that let you.
...What?
Now your little pets are chasing the Pearls up and down the halls. What were you thinking!? Letting them loose in the ballroom? They could be anywhere.

column6: Just then, a rainbow-colored, caterpillar-like creature appears from Blue Diamond's hair. It babbles happily before Blue notices, screams in fright, and smacks it across the room, sending it slamming against a wall.

column4: Pink!

column6: The creature falls off the wall, lands in Steven's arms and hugs him. Blue groans as she rubs the spot where the creature touched on her face.

column4: Ugh. Please. Just get rid of it.

column6: With a concerned look on his face, Steven walks over to the door and lets the creature escape through a crack in the door. Blue turns to look out the window as she sighs.

column4: Pink... White is very unhappy with you. If this keeps up, she's going to take away your Pearl.

column6: Pink Diamond is now in the place of Steven, but still speaks with his voice. She appears remorseful and a tear falls down her cheek.

column4: I know. I'm sorry...

column6: As the tear hits the ground, Steven cries out in surprise to find himself in Pink's body. His vision turns blurry as Blue speaks ethereally in the background.

column4: Why do you always do this, Pink...?
Huh?

column6: Steven finds himself back in his body, and in a strange pink void. Silhouettes of Gems surround him as they glare at him with glowing pink eyes with unintelligible whispers. They quickly disappear beneath view, and Steven looks up to suddenly see Yellow and Blue Diamond looking down at him with surprised, angry looks on their faces, motionless. Pearl and Amethyst also suddenly appear frightened behind Steven, and are poofed by an unknown source. Steven screams and then sees Garnet also getting poofed as well. A clip of Yellow, White, and Blue Diamond extending their hands to emit the Corrupting Light from "Your Mother and Mine" is shown. Steven raises his hands to shield himself form the light.

column4: No! Stop!

column6: A great glow can be seen behind, and Steven find himself rapidly cycling between the forms of Pink Diamond, Rose Quartz, and himself. Steven grasps his head in pain as the cycling gets faster, and he screams in distress. A cropped clip of White Diamond's eyes opening from "Legs from Here to Homeworld", glaring down at Steven.
Steven wakes up, now back in reality, in cold sweat and breathing heavily. He quickly realizes hie is himself again, and notices Connie sleeping beside him.

column4: Oh, Connie, you- you're here.

column6: Connie wakes up and yawns, rubbing her eyes as Steven smiles.

column4: Yeah. Can't exactly leave...

column6: Connie and Steven looks up at the window, when they hear the door opening. They turn around, seeing Blue Diamond entering the room, as she immediately begins to berate Steven.

column4: I cannot believe you! Making a scene like that!
Whoa. Deja blue.
We didn't mean any harm! I asked Steven to dance; he wasn't trying to cause trouble!
What do you know about this, human?
You think I've never been grounded before?
"Grounded"?
Blue, you gotta let us out of here. We're gonna starve!
"Starve"? What is this? Another made up problem? Another trick, so I'll cave and let you out? Well not this time. You're not leaving this tower until you apologize for fusing at the ball!

column6: Steven looks down, considering his options for a moment, and looks back up.

column4: No.

column6: Blue Diamond gasps in shock.

column4: Steven!
What? I'm not sorry.

column6: Blue's hands shiver as tears well up in her eyes.

column4: We finally have you back... And you're worse than ever!

column6: Blue Diamond emits her blue pathokinesis aura, causing Steven to cry and collapses to his knees.

column4: Steven!

column6: Steven smiles as he sits up and looks over at Connie, wiping the tears from his eyes.

column4: It's fine, Connie; I'm not even sad.
But you're really dehydrated!
Blue, Connie and I fuse all the time. It's totally normal and fine.

column6: Blue is visibly uncomfortable at this point and squirms as Steven speaks, grasping her face in her hands.

column4: Agh! In what universe could that possibly be fine?!
This universe! The Crystal Gems fuse all the time, too. Blue, you gotta tell me where their gems are. They didn't do anything wrong!
Ooohh! Pink! Your time on Earth has warped your sense of right and wrong!
Yeah, maybe it has. Maybe Pink thought you guys were right to lock her in here when she messed stuff up.

column6: Blue Diamond's sorrow quickly turns into anger again, as Steven speaks.

column4: But I know what it's like to have a loving family. And we don't do stuff like this to each other. The Crystal Gems understand that I'm Steven, and they support me and Connie.  And you guys poofed 'em for sticking up for me. That isn't normal!
That's enough!

column6: Blue summons a concentrated burst of blue energy and throws it at Steven, knocking him across the room. Steven grunts as he is knocked a good distance backward. Falling on his hands and knees, he notices more tears flowing from his face.

column4: This isn't normal.

column6: Blue backs away a bit, surprised.

column4: How many times did you lock her in here? How many times did you make her cry?!
I didn't, I...

column6: Blue quickly realizes her abuse and gasps in horror, as she dissipates her blue aura. She then falls against the wall by the window, tears welling up in her eyes once more, and her hair slightly disheveled as it is pushed against the wall.

column4: And I'm doing it again... Aren't I?

column6: Blue Diamond slumps down the wall, as tears flow down her cheeks. Steven and Connie look at each other briefly, before Steven jumps and floats up to the window to speak eye-to-eye with Blue.

column4: And this is why you left... isn't it?

column6: Blue Diamond and Steven look at each other. Tears fall down Steven's face too, not because of Blue's power, but instead of his own emotion. Blue stands and wipes the tears clean from her face. She looks away, contemplating for a moment, before speaking.

column4: You were right to leave. I always thought that you were failing this world. But, if you were happier on Earth, maybe... this world was... failing you.

column6: Blue glances at Steven and smiles, then casts her view out the window at White Diamond's Ship

column4: We never should have brought you back here. Your "family"- your "Crystal Gems"- are bubbled. Let's get you all back in your legs... and back home.

column6: Blue Diamond picks up Steven and Connie and raises them to her face. Steven and Connie then smile at each other.
The door to Pink Diamond's room opens and Blue enters, setting Steven and Connie down on the floor.

column4: All right, it's safe.

column4: Take them back to the tower, now!

Then I'll do it myself.

column4: Blue?!

Come on, guys. You're not bubbled anymore. You can come out!

column4: Stop!

column6: Steven summons his shield and chucks it towards Yellow Diamond's hand, disrupting her concentration. A surprised Yellow then glares toward Steven.

column4: You don't have to do this!
Yes, I do! This is what White Diamond expects of all of us. From a thin flake of mica, to the deepest, hardest stone. We all must make sacrifices for the sake of our perfect empire.
Does this look perfect to you?!

column6: Yellow's anger wavers, as she looks at the ruined wall of her palace, as well as Blue sizzling on the ground from her attack earlier.

column4: My dad says, "if every pork chop were perfect, we wouldn't have hot dogs".
And that means... what?
It means if you try and make this empire perfect; if you just wipe away everything you see as flawed, you lose all the things that make you happy, like hot dogs.
Or our Pink.

column6: Yellow groans a moment of weakness and falls to her knees.

column4: Uhh... Stop! Stop it, Blue. Stop using your power on me.

column6: Yellow is seen crying, in an uncharacteristic emotional breakdown.

column4: I'm not.

column6: Blue Diamond gets up and walks over to Yellow, comforting her as she continues to cry.

column4: Steven, come on. Grab the Gems. Let's get out of here.
Right. I hope they're okay. Amethyst would usually be back by now.
They'll be out for a good while. They took a direct hit from me.
Yellow, we've got to get them out of here! Before White finds out about any of this.

column6: Yellow walks towards Pink's Ship as Blue, Steven, and Connie follow. Steven looks down and speaks to the four gems in his arms, as the group runs towards the legs.

column4: Don't worry, guys. I'll get you home safe.
Even if we have to escape now, we'll find some way to heal the corrupted Gems. We can come back to Homeworld. W-we'll still have the legs.
I don't know, I- I don't know if White will ever see us.
We're almost there.
Here we are! Hurry, get inside.

column4: You've made a grave mistake. Go to your rooms!

Blue, don't make her any angrier than she already is!
We're busted.

column6: Just then, a pair of bright lights appears in the sky, almost appearing like shooting stars.

column4: What the heck is that?!

column6: The group watch in shock as Blue and Yellow's arm ships, seemingly repaired, come flying through the sky and slap the Diamond Ship in the face.

column4: Yellow, Blue! Did you have a hand in this?
No way!
White, that wasn't us!
We swear!
Then who's that?
Who cares! Knock her out!

column6: The arms square up against the Diamond Ship and uppercut it into the air, sending it flying and crashing into some buildings far behind them.

I always wanted to uppercut an upper crust!

You came!
Heck yeah, we did.
"We"?
Of course!

Lapis Lazuli and Peridot!

Blue... Yellow...

column6: Blue and Yellow brace themselves to face the gravity of the situation, as White Pearl enters the forehead of the Diamond Ship via the white bubble.

This way of living... It must have been like torture for you.

column4: Just go! Hurry! She's getting up!

column6: Lapis, Peridot, and Bismuth walk up to Steven in support.

She'll never want to hear it.

She even let me come out to space to help Steven. If White knew how unhappy she's made you feel, maybe everything would change.

It's worth a try. Lend me a hand, will you Blue?
Heh, okay.

column6: Yellow and Blue reach out their arms forward and begin regaining control of their respective ships.

column4: Huh?
The ships!

column6: Blue and Yellow begin controlling their ships and hover them towards the Diamond Ship. White Diamond attempts to fend off the two arm ships by kicking, but is unsuccessfully it preventing them from subduing the Diamond Ship.

column4: Steven, take a knee.
Okay.  White, please! All we want you to do is listen!

column4: That's it, Steven! Come on, Blue.

column4: White, we used to be close. Don't you remember? When Pink would make us laugh? All those silly things she did for no reason, there was a reason. She wanted us to be happy together. Steven!

Holy-
All right!
Unbelievable!
Oh, you better believe it.

Right!
Let's take that bully down!

column6: As White Diamond speaks, she is expressive, while Yellow and Blue smile and stare blankly.

column4: White Diamond! My name is Steven Universe. I'm here to- Gah!

column4: Poor Yellow. Her impurities absorb all the blue in her light. She's so strong...! But so weak when it comes to Blue. Ah, and Blue, her impurities soak up all of the warmth in her spectrum. ...What?!
Dude, what is she even talking about? This is nonsense!

Connie!

Well, you seem to have made a series of miraculous recoveries, but that doesn't change the fact that you experienced trauma. You've recovered physically, but have you recovered mentally?
You think there's something wrong with my brain?!

Not wrong! It's that adverse childhood experiences, or childhood trauma, can have a lasting impact on how your body responds to stress. This can affect your social, emotional, and physical development. When humans are in crisis, the brain releases the hormone cortisol. Your heart races, your muscles tense. I wonder if your body is reacting to a gem equivalent of cortisol. Steven, do you remember anything bad in your childhood that particularly stuck with you?

I-I guess. I kinda freaked out when they cancelled my favorite ice cream, and then I got attacked by a giant bug monster, and I got trapped in a bubble and almost drowned, I lost control of my body and turned into a blob of cats, I almost turned so old I died, Amethyst almost died, Pearl did die, Garnet got destabilized right in front of me, I woke up with a black eye imprisoned on a spaceship—
Steven, this is serious!
But— that was just the early stuff!

I think all these experiences have been subjecting your body to a harmful amount of stress, and that's affecting your ability to respond to new forms of stress in a healthy way. You've been dealing with genuine threats from such a young age, your body is now responding to minor threats as if your life were in danger!
But— why am I only swelling up now?
Stress is less harmful when we have people we trust to help us through it. Maybe if— if you're losing your supportive relationships, or if you had a recent experience that was practically off—

column4: STEVEN!!!!!

column6: A surprised Steven begins to struggle as Garnet lands and holds her arms tightly over him, giving him a hug.

column4: Steven, when I fell apart, you were there for me. I want to be there for you now. I'm here, Steven. I'm here.

column6: Steven stops struggling and stands in the hug.

column4: This is working? You hear us? STEVEN!

column6: The Diamonds come in for the hug too, with White having an awkward expression. The rest of the Gems and Greg make it in too, with Spinel coming in to tie them all in the hug together with her arms.

column4: I'm here, Schtuball! Whatever you need, I'll make it happen! You hear me?!
STEVEN! You never gave up on me for some reason I don't understand! I'LL DO THE SAME FOR YOU!
I know you feel bad! Believe me, I get it! Sometimes it feels like you're never gonna like yourself but...  It's possible, man!
Steven, I know how awful it feels to keep a part of yourself secret! You shouldn't have to hide anything from me!

column6: Steven grunts, as The Cluster reemerges, holding his hand. Connie appears last, jumping from Lion's portal and lands on his nose. She walks closer, hugging him.

column4: Steven... you must have been so afraid to show us this side of yourself. But we're not going anywhere. We're all gonna take care of you the same way you take care of us. You know what? I don't have your powers, but...

column6: The scene cuts to black, a pink droplet appearing. The scene then cuts to show pink drops falling into the ocean, as Steven cries. His tears start to glow, and then the rest of him as he starts to transform back. Fade to white. Steven wakes up, back to normal, still crying, and notices Connie wiping away his tear.

column4: Huh?

column6: Steven looks and sees Blue, White, Yellow, Spinel, Greg, Connie, Garnet, Lapis, Bismuth, Pearl, Peridot and Amethyst smiling at him, and that he is sitting in the Cluster's open hand.

column4: Wha... I...  D- Did I- I'm-

column6: Lion comes into his vision and licks his face.

column4: Lion.  Lion!

column6: While still hugging Lion, Steven, letting out his emotions and he begins sobbing as Spinel sits in the loop in Blue Diamond's hair. Still wearing her armor, Bismuth moves one of her tears away. We watch as the group sits on the Cluster. Fade to black.

Steven sets down a stereo on the beach. He presses play on the stereo and backs up. The workout track from "Future Vision" begins to play. During this, Steven performs the exercise routine from the same episode.

column4: Let's exercise! Cha! One... two!... Two... two!... Three... two!... Four... two!...

column6: Lion roars off-screen, and his portal opens just to the left of the stereo. Lion lands on top of it with Connie on his back.

column4: Good morning, Steven. One last routine before hitting the road?
Yeah... I'll be sitting for a while.

column6: Steven and Connie sit on top of Steven's bed with Lion on the ground next to them. Connie types on a computer on her lap, while Steven studies a map laid out in front of him.

column4: I'll be in Charm City in time for Shep and Sadie's concert,  I'll meet up with you and Lion on Providence Island when you're touring schools, and then I'll catch up with Lars for our weekly space hangout.
I'll add that to your Boogle Maps doc. So... how did everyone take the news?
I basically told everyone in Beach City – plus my dad – but, I haven't told the Gems yet.
You gotta tell them!
I-I know, I just have no idea how they're going to take it. They've been so protective of me these last few months since my meltdown. I wonder if there's a way I can let them down easy.

column6: Steven stands at the foot of the table, facing the Warp Pad, where Garnet, Amethyst, and Pearl return from.

column4: Oh, Steven! Were you waiting for us?

column6: Steven opens a cooler full of homemade Cookie Cats.

column4: I sure was.
Whoa, Cookie Cat!
I thought they stopped making them.
They did, so I made my own.

column6: Steven looks at the Cookie Cat's slightly deformed face.

column4: You can kinda tell.

column6: Garnet takes a bite of her Cookie Cat, while Amethyst has already finished hers.

column4: They're delicious.
Mmm-mmm!

column6: Pearl takes a hesitant nibble out of her Cookie Cat's ear.

column4: Scrumptious!
Remember when you used to sing that song for us?
If I may...

column6: As the music plays, the Gems recite the lyrics to the Cookie Cat song.

column4: Oohhhhh! He's a frozen treat with an all new taste!
'Cause he came to this planet from outer space!
A refugee of an interstellar war!
But now he's at your local grocery store!
Cookie Cat!
He's a pet for your tummy!
Cookie Cat!
He's super-duper yummy!
Cookie Cat!
He left his family behind.
That's right, he did leave his family behind.
That's not how it goes!
I think maybe Cookie Cat had run out of ways to grow on his home planet. And even though it must've been hard, and he loved his family so, so much, maybe he had to leave to keep moving forward.
We're still talking about ice cream, right?

Everyone... I've decided to move out! Don't worry about me, I have a very comprehensive plan to visit all 39 states before I decide where to settle down, and I can still video chat my new therapist while I'm on the road. Do not try to talk me out of this!
When are you leaving?
Uh... tomorrow.
Oh, so soon! Well, all human adolescents need to seize their independence eventually.

column6: Pearl gives Steven a hug.

column4: I'm so happy for you.

column6: Pearl exits.

column4: Yeah, bud. I'll miss ya. Peace!

column6: Amethyst exits.

column4: You guys know I may never come back, right?

column6: Garnet places her hand on Steven's shoulder.

column4: We know, Steven. This will be an exciting new chapter in your life.

column6: Garnet exits, leaving Steven shocked by their surprisingly calm response.

column4: That... went well... right?
You... WHAT?!?! What's the problem, Steven? Are you mad at me?
Of course I'm not mad at you.

column6: Bismuth brings Steven into a tight hug.

column4: Then don't leave! Oh no, am I smothering you? (backs away) I get it, I get it.
Bismuth.

column6: Bismuth turns her hands into a saw and hammer.

column4: How about I build you a nice vacation house just outside of Little Homeworld?

column6: Lapis approaches Steven, briefly summons her wings and outstretches her arms.

column4: Listen to me, Steven. You can't run away from yourself. Wherever you go, you'll be there. Trust me, I know.

column6: Peridot drops down on the floor and sobs into her hands. Steven kneels down and gives her his hand to hold.

column4: Peridot. Come on, it's okay.
Where am I going to find another Steven as good as you, huh? I like this one so much!
Here, I want you to have this.

column6: Steven gives Peridot his old salmon-pink shirt from the original series.

column4: My very own Steven shirt?
Be the Steven you want to see in the world.

column6: Peridot wails once more and blows her nose with the shirt. Steven approaches Lapis, who has her arms crossed.

column4: Lapis, this is for you.

column6: Steven gives Lapis a drawing kit as she reads the description.

column4: What the? 142 pieces? 60 crayons? 24 oil pastels? It even has watercolors?!
Do you like it?

column6: Lapis takes the box with tears in her eyes.

column4: I... love it!

column6: Steven approaches Bismuth with a bright pink flag.

column4: Stay back, Steven!
Bismuth, I can't think of anyone who's more of a Crystal Gem than you. So please take this: the original Crystal Gem flag.
Oh, Steven.

column6: Peridot (wearing Steven's old shirt

column4: If it wasn't for you, none of us would be who we are today. You make me so proud to be a Crystal Gem.
Why did you have to put it so well, Bismuth?
I'm gonna use my tears to make a watercolor painting of you.

column6: Steven also breaks down as they all hug each other.

column4: Peridot, Lapis, Bismuth... I love you!

column5: Cut to outside of the tower Steven and his friends were standing on.

column4: We love you too, Steven!

column5: Cut to Steven walking near the tower.

column6: Steven wipes his tears with a smile on his face. A hole is busted through the wall, revealing it to be Jasper, staying aloof. She doesn't face Steven.

column4: Heard you're leaving.

column6: Jasper faces Steven.

column4: I'm coming with you!
Jasper, I'm going alone.
Then who will protect you?!
I can protect myself.
I know.

column6: Jasper punches a hole in the ground and looks the opposite direction.

column4: Farewell, my Diamond.

column6: Jasper headbutts the wall, creating another Jasper-shaped hole next to the previous one. She walks through it.

column4: Whoa! Even Jasper's more upset than my own family! Maybe I need a round two?
Oh, Amethyst!

column6: Amethyst jumps up into a sitting position on the couch with Steven in front of her, holding a box.

column4: Huh?
I have a gift for you.
Is it food?!

column6: Amethyst grabs the box, tilting the contents of the box into her mouth.

column4: No! It's-

column6: Amethyst holds an old game console in her mouth, surprised it's not food.

column4: What the?

column6: Amethyst spits the console back into the box.

column4: It's my old video game systems!
Aw, dude... you better kiss your high scores goodbye!
What?!
And say goodbye to your save files, too! Oh, I've been waiting forever to play through Golf Quest Mini on my own!  Why the heck would you own a game with only one save slot anyway?

column6: Steven is left dumbfounded and alone in the living room.

column4: Uhhh...

column6: Steven opens the front door and greets Pearl, who is sitting in a white chair, playing her bass.

column4: Hello, Pearl!
Oh, hi Steven! Do you need help packing?
No, it's just-

column6: Steven takes out his old ukulele.

column4: I'm leaving you with my ukulele.
Steven! That's very thoughtful of you.

column6: Pearl puts the ukulele inside of her gem.

column4: Pearl, it's okay to be sad that I'm leaving.
But Steven, it's a good thing that you're going to get out there and explore the world. It's not something to be sad over.

column6: Steven frowns, his eyes large and tear-filled.

column4: Yeah, you're right.

column6: Steven starts walking back inside, groaning.

column4: Alright, have fun.

column6: Steven warps to the Temple hand where Garnet is doing the laundry. He is holding a large scrapbook in his arms.

column4: Garnet!
Well bust my britches, it's Steven Universe.
I'm here to give you a very important and sentimental gift because I'm leaving. Getting to plan Ruby and Sapphire's wedding was so amazing, and I hope that one day, you can help me plan my own.

column6: He holds up the scrapbook titled "Dream Wedding" to Garnet. She takes the scrapbook in her hands.

column4: Thanks. I'll take good care of it.
Okay, Garnet, level with me here. You used your future vision, saw that everything would be fine, and told the Gems not to worry about me. That's it, right?
Steven, I don't need future vision to know that you're gonna be fine.

column6: Garnet heads over to the warp pad.

column4: Besides, part of the fun of leaving is figuring it out on your own.

column6: She warps away, leaving Steven to cry alone.
Steven shuts a suitcase filled with old items and sighs.

column4: You alright, Schtu-ball?
Yeah, it's just-
Just what?
Well, I told the Gems I'm leaving but I don't think they're even sad about it.
Isn't that a good thing?
I guess I wanted them to be at least a little upset. Is that petty?
You're allowed to have feelings, even petty ones.

column6: Greg walks over to Steven and gives him a hug.

column4: They love you, kiddo. They're probably just trying to be supportive.
Thanks, Dad. Oh! I still have to give you your gift!

column6: Steven jumps up onto the bed and puts a poster of "Kerry Moonbeam" on the empty wall.

column4: It's all yours. I want you to move in!
Huh? Don't you think it's a little... ritzy for me?

column6: Steven sits back down on the bed, patting the space next to him with his hand.

column4: Try the bed, Dad.

column6: Steven and Greg lay down on the bed, looking at the glow-in-the-dark stars on the ceiling.

column4: Woah. Steven, I don't think I can get up.
I knew you'd like it.
I guess the Gems are gonna swap one Universe for another, huh? You know, you heading off and me settling down, it makes the kind of karmic sense I just can't resist.

column5: Cut to the beach in front of the Temple.

column6: The Gems, Greg, and Connie are all gathered next to Steven's car, ready to give their goodbyes. Steven gives Connie a hug.

column4: Bye, Connie. See you soon.

column6: They share a kiss and Steven holds her hands, both of them blushing.

column4: Text me when you get to that bed and breakfast. Don't breakfast without me.
You got it.

column6: Steven hugs Greg next.

column4: Bye, Dad.
Aw, I'm gonna miss you, Schtu-ball. But I'm so proud of you.
Thanks, Dad.

column6: He approaches the Pearl, Garnet and Amethyst and gives Pearl a hug.

column4: Goodbye, Pearl.
Goodbye, Steven.

column6: Steven hugs Garnet next.

column4: Bye, Garnet.
So long, Steven.

column6: He hugs Amethyst.

column4: Bye, Amethyst.
See ya, bud. Don't forget about me!
I won't.
Well, I guess this is goodbye.
We'll be thinking of you.
Alright then.

column6: Steven gets into his car and begins to drive off, watching his friends wave to him in the rear view mirror. As he gets farther and farther from then, he begins to panic, and once they are all out of sight, the car comes to a screeching halt and reverses all the way back to the Gems. Steven appears in the car window with tears going down his cheeks.

column4: What's wrong with you guys?! Aren't you sad that I'm leaving?

column6: Amethyst bursts into tears.

column4: Oh man, I can't take this anymore!

column6: Garnet sprays tears all over her visor as they run down her cheeks.

column4: We were trying to be strong for you.

column6: Pearl turns her head to face Steven, sobbing sloppily as she's unable to speak.

column4: Pearl agrees.

column6: Steven jumps out of the car, running over to the Gems.

column4: You guys!

column6: They leap into a group hug and sob together.

column4: I was kidding, man! I'm never gonna delete your save files!
Ah, I love that ukulele! I'll never play anything else!
I'd be overjoyed to plan your wedding. In fact, I've already planned over 363 versions of it.
Why didn't you guys just tell me all of this?
I'm sorry, Steven. I couldn't resist looking into your future. I peeked. But I saw a possibility that our tears would keep you from leaving.
We didn't wanna hold you back!
But I also saw many paths ahead of you, and we are a part of all of them.

column6: Garnet takes off her visor.

column4: Wherever you end up, we will visit you to talk, to listen, to be there, whenever you need us. We love you, Steven.

column6: Steven wipes the tears away from his eyes.

column4: I love you too.

column6: Greg wipes a tear from his eye, and Connie puts her hand on his arm to comfort him. Steven begins to get back into his car as Garnet waves at him and Pearl begins sobbing again.

column4: Check your rear left tire before you hit the desert! It's not serious, but could be trouble if left unchecked!

column6: A tear goes down Garnet's cheek, and Amethyst throws him a peace sign.

column4: Later bruh!

column6: Pearl continues to sob uncontrollably as Steven starts the car and begins to drive off.

column4: Bye, Steven!
Bye! Have fun!
Bye!
Bye!

column6: "Being Human" plays as Garnet, Amethyst and Pearl continue to wave after their departing friend. In front of the Big Donut the townspeople hold a banner saying "Bye Steven" and wave after him. Steven waves back at them as they yell their final goodbyes as he turns the corner, passing the car wash. Steven turns up the radio and begins to drive out of Beach City and towards his distant future. Our view moves up into the night sky as the stars glistening. Fade to black as the credits roll.
